description:
Wellington Heritage Festival in the Wairarapa 2025, Experience the People, Places, & Stories of Te Upoko-o-Te-Ika-a-Māui, the Greater Wellington Region, and discover over a dozen events in the Wairarapa alone.

Wellington Heritage Festival 2025 will run from Saturday the 18th October until Sunday 9th November, spanning from the Kāpiti Coast to the Wairarapa.

On the 8th and 9th of November, the focus will be on the Wairarapa, with a variety of events taking place all across the valley. Come to discover local history, visit historic marae, or delve into some of the delicious food that this magical area has to offer.

Visit our website to discover over 140 culture and heritage themed events across the wider region, from walking tours to wagon wheel making courses. There's something for everyone!

Some events require booking. Please visit our website to learn more about booked events. www.wellingtonheritagefestival.nz/events

Organised by the Wellington Heritage Festival Trust and the Rotary Clubs of Greater Wellington. Sponsored by the Wellington City Council, Hutt City Council, Trust House Foundation, Historic Places Wellington, Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, and Hiamo Ltd.
label: Festivals

description:
Mums at Table | Free Mama & Baby Dance Class, Mums, this one’s for you!
Join us for a FREE Mama & Baby Dance Class hosted by Bring Your Own Dance in partnership with Mum’s at the Table. This is a safe, baby-friendly space where you can:
Move your body (no dance experience needed!)
Bond with your baby through rhythm and movement
Connect with other mums in Wellington
Take a breath for your own wellbeing
We’ll have:
A breastfeeding-friendly space
Changing area
Gentle, joy-filled movement designed for all fitness levels
This is more than a dance class — it’s community, connection, and a little spark of joy in your week.
⸻
What to Bring:
• Comfy clothes & water bottle
• Baby essentials (nappies, blanket, etc.)
• A smile and an open heart
⸻
Cost:
FREE – but spaces are limited!
Reserve your spot here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSexfUqoKoJ.../viewform...
⸻

description:
SHARPENING AT THE HARBOURSIDE MARKET, Holy molly! And just like that a month races by! Jo and I will be sharpening at the Harbourside market this coming Sunday. Bring your knives, edged gardening equipment, scissors, axes in for a good sharpening. Drop them off and go for a shop, lots of lovley foods and coffee to choose from. You can stock up on your veggies as well. Please be aware we can sometimes have a bit of wait. Payment is by cash or bank deposit, as we don't have eftpos.
See you all on Sunday.

description: Beginner's Kayaking Tour on the Wairarapa Coast: A guided kayaking tour of the Wairarapa Coast, perfect for beginners. Learn basic paddling techniques and enjoy the stunning views of the coastline from the water. All equipment is provided.

description:
'TONES OF SILENCE' - FUTUNA CHAPEL IN B&W - EXHIBITION, ‘TONES of SILENCE’ – FUTUNA CHAPEL in BLACK & WHITE - EXHIBITION
The ‘Tones of Silence’ -explored through B & W photography taken with vintage camera and lenses to give another way of viewing and experiencing the Chapel. This exhibition will explore the tones, textures, composition and forms of the Chapel in black and white with many shades of grey.
"Generally, the older the equipment, the greater the personal input of the photographer is required and therefore the greater the commitment and individuality. Often, you can look at a 19th-century photograph and tell who the photographer is. You certainly can't do that today. It isn't only the camera and lens, but also the type of film (or in those days, glass plate), the developer used and how the print is made onto particular types of paper. Each gives a distinct interpretation".
John Grace - email - 18/06/25
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all koha received from the exhibition events will go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.  Please register
BOOKINGS ARE PREFERRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
7 Days — Live, Since 2009, Kiwi comics have been delivering weekly laughs to television audiences. 7 Days is a homegrown panel show where local comedians take an irreverent look at the past week in news. Now they’re leaving the television studio behind and heading out on the road. Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre is in their sights. Watch host Jeremy Corbett lead a band of comedians in a live version of the show. Dai Henwood, Hayley Sproull, Paul Ego, Josh Thomson, Ben Hurley, and Justine Smith intend to break all the rules. With no cameras, censors, or TV lawyers on hand, the show is bound to be a riot. 
Award-winning panel series 7 Days has introduced a wide range of comedy talents to New Zealand audiences. They compete across a wide range of games, including ‘My kid could draw that’, ‘Caption That’ and ‘Guess Who’. Get ready for quick-thinking stand-up comedy.
label: Arts & Theatre

description: A Night of Prayer for the City, Join us as we come together to pray for our city. This evening of corporate prayer will focus on local needs, from community welfare to political leaders, and will be an opportunity to seek God's guidance and blessing for our region. This is an interdenominational event, and all are welcome to participate.

description:
Earth, The Wellington Youth Orchestra, Wellington Youth Sinfonietta and Wellington Youth Choir are joining forces for a one-of-a-kind concert at the Michael Fowler Centre on Sunday, October 19. This unique collaboration promises an unforgettable afternoon of music you won't want to miss.
The performers will be playing music by Runestad, Mantyjarvi, Hopkins, Rameka, Thomas, and Schubert. Wellington Youth Orchestra's concerto competition winner Solace Ward will perform the Ritchie Concerto for Viola and Orchestra.
Earth

Don't miss your chance to be part of the action — grab yours today on Ticketmaster before they're gone!

description:
ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy, ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy
Join us at Fringe Bar for ALTAR, a spellbinding drag ritual honouring the turn of the seasons. As day and night stand in perfect balance, witness an evening of witchcraft, blasphemy, mythology, and queer magic brought to life by a fierce coven of drag kings, queens, monsters, and cryptids.

This equinox, we invoke the primal, the divine, and the forbidden. Expect offerings to old gods, sacrificial glamour, and performances steeped in folklore, resistance and radical ritual. ALTAR is a celebration of queer power, transgressive beauty, and the defiance of a world that seeks to burn us at the stake.

With Performances By:
Robin Yablind
Rover Stimulation
Misty Frequency
Darryl Parton
Rocky Rhodes
MANNNTIS
Judas Kiss
Aracella
Cailiah the Banshee

Come ready to worship. Come ready to sin.
Bring your rage, your devotion, your offerings, and lay them down at the ALTAR!

Doors open 7.30pm
Show starts 8pm

description:
The Racket Lounge: Evolve, Come along to the FINAL Racket Lounge concert for 2025 to hear some brand new music written by local composers and soak in the good vibes!
The Racket Lounge: Evolve
Wednesday 8 October, 6.30pm
Book now through the link above

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!
Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!
A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.
All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.
Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description: Meditation session first Thursday of the month, An opportunity for beginners and experienced meditators to gather and benefit from each others presence as we take advantage of the special atmosphere of the practice hall in our ashram, finding inner stillness and awakening the feeling of inner freedom, peace and happiness.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Permaculture for People & Place, Permaculture for People & Place
🌱 Permaculture for People & Place - New Workshop at Mangaroa Farms. Led by our resident permaculture enthusiast Halina Horn, experience a hands-on learning journey for the whole whānau. Come get your hands in the soil, explore the garden, and grow over a 4 week course alongside your tamariki 🌻

Together, we’ll learn to care for land, food, and each other. We’ll achieve this through learning about permaculture systems, composting, water wisdom, nature play, and storytelling.

This event is friendly for kids and adults alike - a great opportunity to get family connection over earth-based practices going.

HOW IT WORKS:
🌀 Sign up for 4 x Saturdays in Nov (1st, 8th, 15th, 22nd) at the link below.

🕙 Each event runs from 10am – 1pm | 298 Whitemans Valley road, Upper Hutt

👦 For families, educators, grandparents, & curious growers (ages 5+)

💚 Different adults and kids ticket options available

This is the first of many permaculture education seasonal offerings designed to re-root us in the rhythms of nature.

The second block course in November will cover key themes in seeds, soil, spring growth, plant communities and more... so come along to continue the learning journey.

Spots are limited. Come and grow with us.

🔗 Book now at https://store.mangaroa.org/products/permaculture-for-people-and-place

📧 Questions?
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Auditions! Superior Donuts by Tracy Letts, Auditions! Superior Donuts by Tracy Letts
Stagecraft presents: “Superior Donuts”
By Tracy Letts
Directed by James Kiesel
26 November – 6 December 2025

“What could be more human, than to be scared, and keep it a secret.”

Arthur Przybyszewski (that's (p)Shub-er-shef-ski), is the proprietor of a modest, behind-the-times donut shop in uptown Chicago. He can't seem to find joy in anything these days, not even the donuts he used to take such pride in making by hand. Vandals armed with spray paint, predatory landlords, and that nefarious Starbucks down the road all threaten to unceremoniously snuff out the only thing he's got left.

That is, until an upstart, ambitious young man shoulders his way into becoming a Superior Donuts employee, and an unlikely friendship (or is it a rivalry?) develops, inspiring both to face the demons they've been hiding from all this time.

This is a sharp-witted, heartfelt comedy by Pulitzer Prize winner Tracy Letts (“August: Osage County”) offering a warm and wry take on depression, diversity, and bravery that will leave you feeling all fluffy and sugary on the inside. Plus, who knows, you might get a donut!

Go to the Stagecraft website to book your spot!

https://www.stagecraft.co.nz/auditions

AUDITIONS:
Auditions will be on Saturday 13th & Sunday 14th September, with callbacks the evening of Monday 15th September.

To book an audition, please fill out the form by 10th September - we'll be in touch to confirm your audition date, time and location. If you have any questions please get in touch at .

Roles (just try your best with accents, coaching available once casting is complete)

Arthur Przybyszewski [Male, Polish, 50s - 60s]
The owner and operator of Superior Donuts. Old, grumpy, and more than a little depressed. Secretly an artisan and a scholar, he’s spent his whole life running from conflict. Until now? [Has a scene involving some violence]

Franco Wicks [Male, African-American, 20s]
Young, idealistic, a little pushy, and full of attitude and energy. Franco believes that good things will happen to him despite all odds, and evidence, to the contrary. A former employee of Luther.

Max [Male, Russian, 40s - 60s]
Owner of the DVD shop next door, Max is interested in buying Superior Donuts to expand his (tiny) capitalist empire. Fancies himself a self-made man. [Speaks in a Russian accent, along with some dialogue in Russian]

Randy [Female, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Raised in the middle of 7 brothers and working as a cop in the Chicago Police Department, Randy’s always been ‘one of the boys’. Big hockey fan. Has a soft spot for Arthur.

James [Male, African-American, 30s - 40s]
Another cop with the Chicago Police Department and Randy’s beat partner. Well-respected in the community and [not so] secretly a giant Star Trek nerd. [Will consider any and all BIPOC actors for this role]

Lady [Female, Irish-American, 60s - 70s]
Likely homeless and definitely a little hard-of-hearing, Lady is a well-known as a confusing-but-likeable, perhaps even mascot-like figure in the Uptown community. Well past the point of giving a crap about what other people think.

Luther [Male, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Local bookie and crime-syndicate everyman, Luther has scratched out his living taking money from gambling addicts, which he finds troubling because he’d like to consider himself a good, fair man. Has a stomach ulcer which is probably somehow representative of this inner conflict. [Has a scene involving some violence]

Kevin [Male, Irish, 20s]
Another of Luther’s employees, Kevin’s probably fallen into the wrong crowd as a young man, but it doesn’t seem to trouble him that much. Seems to care mostly about getting paid and drinking Coca-Cola.

Kiril [Male, Russian, 20s - 30s]
A shy man of few words (mostly ‘hello’), Kiril is an intimidating figure with a big soft heart beating beneath his tall muscular frame. Brought into the fold to be a construction worker and bodyguard, he’s mostly interested in falling in love with the local bartender. [Most dialogue is in Russian]
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
August's Nomadic Speaker: Rachel Young, Rachel Young is a freelance graphic designer, traveller, and occasional van-dweller who’s spent the last few years navigating the messy, beautiful reality of creative nomad life.
For Rachel, being a ‘nomad’ has never been just about travel, but a mindset. Since leaving her home in the UK in 2019, she’s moved across the world, worked remotely from a van, taught graphic design in China, and rebuilt her creative career more than once.
Today, she blends her love of design with a passion for helping other creatives navigate the highs, lows, and mindset shifts of freelance life, while inspiring those around her to pursue their own dreams.
In this Friday's talk, she shares the unfiltered truths of freelancing on the move - from creative burnout to financial uncertainty - along with the mindset tools that can make the journey not just survivable, but meaningful and joyful.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Astro Photo Talk with Keith Molloy & JM Beltran, Join Wellington astrophotographers Keith Molloy & JM Beltran as they share tips and tricks on capturing the beauty of Aotearoa’s night skies.
Free to attend with a valid ticket to the World Press Photo Exhibition & Aotearoa Photography Showcase.
──────
About the speakers:
Keith Molloy
Wellington-based photographer passionate about capturing the beauty and diversity of New Zealand’s night skies and landscapes. He specialises in Milky Way scenes and celestial events, blending technical precision with creativity. Keith founded the Wellington Night Shooters Facebook group, has run workshops with the Wellington Photographic Society, and has been recognised through NZIPP NZAPA awards. His work is on display at the Tākina retail store during the World Press Photo Exhibition.
JM Beltran
Wellington-based landscape and nature photographer whose work captures Aotearoa’s wild beauty in colour and detail. His photography has been recognised internationally, including as a finalist in Australian Photographer of the Year 2024 and winning a Silver Award at NZIPP NZAPA 2024. JM volunteers at Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne, and his Wild Pōneke collection is on display at the Tākina retail store during the World Press Photo Exhibition.
label: Arts & Theatre

label: Community & Culture

description:
Bonfire, Created and directed by Matías Avaca

Bonfire is an intimate storytelling ritual where performers gather around the fire to share tales shaped by culture, memory, and imagination. Rooted in ancestral echoes, each story is poetic, powerful, and fleeting; never to be told the same way twice.

Inspired by the workshop The Stories That Made Us, the show blends magical realism, oral tradition, and ensemble connection.

With previous presentations in Auckland and Brisbane (as part of the 2025 Brisbane Improv Festival), Bonfire now arrives at the New Zealand Improv Festival, inviting audiences into a space of warmth, wonder, and shared humanity.

This show may include content related to family, identity, cultural heritage, and emotional themes. While performers are encouraged to approach these with care and sensitivity, the improvised nature of the show means themes may vary each night. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

Kareoke & Disco Fundraiser, Ultimate Kareoke Disco Fundraiser Night! Let’s send me to Australia in style!
Malo families & friends, as you all know I got picked for the Wellington Samoa cricket tour to Australia — but I need your help to cover my ticket, kit, and subs. This is my FINAL DANCE to fund this dream, and I’m counting on you to bring the vibes, the laughs, and the support!
Date, place & vibes:
Saturday 6th Sep
Cutlers Entertainment, The Hutt
6:00 PM – Midnight
Let’s light up the floor and keep the good energy rolling all night long!
What’s happening:
Kareoke & Disco Party Night — you bring the voice, we bring the glory!
Cash prizes: Winner takes home $500
, 2nd, 3rd and 4th places take home a NSW or Maroon hoodie (your pick)

Sing solo or in a crew — 10 lucky peeps get to perform the beat between 9:30pm to 11pm
Entry to perform: only $50 per seat (book fast — only 10 spots!)
Tickets to watch and dance: Online $20 | Door $25
How to join the fun:
Want to sing? Message me NOW to grab your seat!

Kareoke entry deadline: 30th Aug — don’t miss out!
Song submission for the night: 1st Sep — we’ll be ready to roll!
Tickets to dance & watch: inbox me — I’ll send your number once you book and pay

Payment - Te Mana
03-0531-0113530-001 (Please ref your FB name)
Support the dream:
Can’t perform? Come cheer, dance, and enjoy with great food & drink deals!

VIPs & judges will be on hand to spice up the night and crown our karaoke king/queen

Share this post, invite your crew, and flood the dance floor with love — the more, the merrier!
DJ & vibes:
DJ Mana spinning a vibrant mix of Pacific tunes for all ages
Epic lighting, dance circles, and island-flare vibes that’ll have you smiling all night
Why I’m asking for your help:
October tour in Australia is my first cricket adventure abroad — I want to represent our Tokelau family with pride.
Every dollar brings me closer to my dream and to stepping onto that pitch with heart!
Let’s make this night legendary. Your support means the world to me — bring family, friends, neighbours, and your best dance moves!
Special prizes for our male/ female best dressed outfit on the night

(Island Club Theme)
Hope to see you there!

description:
Bull Rush, THIS SHOW IS R13.

With a roster of Tāmaki Makaurau's best and brightest performers, expect spit-take-worthy gags, epic stories, heartbreaking tales, and live improvised music at Bull Rush.

So gather your mates for a night of never before seen, totally made up, improvised comedy.

Mess with the bull, feel the rush.

Since 2020, Bull Rush has been making it up as they go. With several seasons (Jingle Bull(Rush), Ghoul Rush, Bull Rush (1822) under their belt, these self-professed improv nerds know how to put on a bloody good show.

Winners of Best Improv Group at the 2024 NZ Comedy Guild Awards, among other accolades (not to brag).

“From start to finish, the show kept me laughing, and by the end, I found myself not only impressed by the performers' quick wit and timing but also rediscovering my appreciation for the art of theatre.”

95bfm.com

R13 - This show may contain potential references to sex, violence as death. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Image credit: John Rata
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Book Launch | It's What He Would've Wanted by Nick Ascroft, Join us at Unity Books Wellington on 3 September to celebrate a new book from Nick Ascroft! The book will be launched by Always Becominging.
Wednesday 3 September, 6pm
Unity Books Wellington
All welcome!
What would he have wanted? As little fuss as possible. But, reading between the lines: a little help. All the latest gossip and complaints. An arse that is not wrong. Opulence. One leap from the rope ladder. The final word.
It’s What He Would’ve Wanted is the sixth book of poetry from the author of the acclaimed The Stupefying. In this hilarious and affecting new work, Nick Ascroft writes of lost friends, new frailties, new braveries, and being stuck in an organ pipe during a recital and not wanting to bother anyone about it. Yes, there are poems of cycling into dead-end utility holes but also poems of trembling resolve and arriving at work as aged as the night sky after completing the morning school drop-off. This is the best collection yet by one of the most exciting and mercurial poets writing in Aotearoa today.
About the author:
Nick Ascroft is the author of five previous poetry collections with Te Herenga Waka University Press, most recently The Stupefying (2022) and Moral Sloth (2019). Living in Thorndon, he is a public servant and the president of Scrabble Wellington.
Cover design by Todd Atticus.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Charlotte Grimshaw: The annual NZSA Janet Frame Memorial Lecture, In her 2025 NZSA Janet Frame Memorial Lecture, Charlotte Grimshaw will report from the frontlines of fiction and memoir, discuss veracity, integrity and clarity in a so-called “post-truth world,” and share ideas she’s formed about authenticity after a whole life lived in fiction.

Grimshaw will describe her ongoing quest for answers, including a recent personal discovery of material in the Turnbull Library archive that shattered some final illusions, and fuelled her determination to go on expressing ideas and writing accurate human stories, no matter what. Don't miss this one-off, very special event.

Presented in partnership with New Zealand Society of Authors Te Puni Kaituhi O Aotearoa (PEN NZ) Inc, and National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa.

This event is free to attend, and will be followed by supper and light refreshments. Please register to secure your place. All welcome.

Charlotte Grimshaw spent two decades publishing fiction after growing up in the family of a writer. In 2021 she published a bestselling memoir, The Mirror Book, about her experiences in the literary family. She described this as an account of the creation of her authentic self.  In her latest novel, The Black Monk (March, 2026), she has continued her exploration of authenticity, blending the “micro” interior world of guilt, truth and lies with the “macro” world of geopolitics and history. Charlotte is the critically acclaimed author of eleven works, including novels, two outstanding collections of linked stories, a best-selling memoir, journalism and book reviewing.

Charlotte Grimshaw is The NZ Society of Authors Te Puni Kaituhi o Aotearoa 2025 President of Honour. This prestigious honour is bestowed on a senior writer and long-serving NZSA member in recognition of their contribution to writing, writers and the literary arts sector in Aotearoa. Each year the NZSA President of Honour delivers the Janet Frame Memorial Lecture.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent, Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent
Join Āporo Press at Unity Books for the mystical book launch of ‘Hoods Landing’ by Laura Vincent.

About this Event

Join Āporo Press at Unity Books Wellington on Halloween, 31 October, to celebrate the debut novel by Laura Vincent.

🎃 Friday 31 October, 6pm
🎃 Unity Books Wellington
🎃 All welcome!

Rita considered the dead. Shut her eyes. Rolled their names around her brain. Stacked each person in order like folded laundry, warm and crisp from the sun. She wondered how her name would sound amongst them.

In the rural reaches of Auckland, the women of the eclectic Gordon family gather for Christmas. They may push each other’s buttons, but know precisely when to offer tea (or a tipple). Rita, the 50-year-old baby of the family, is planning to tell them she has cancer. Drifting between past and present, she considers the lives of women in their community and reckons with what it all means for her future and her family.

Featuring elderly lesbians, twins who aren’t twins, and several dogs named Roger, Hoods Landing is about shoddy pasts, ambiguous futures and the imperfect bonds that tie family together.

About the author:

Laura Vincent (Ngāti Māhanga, Ngāpuhi) is an author whose work spans fiction, poetry and food writing. She has written the food blog hungryandfrozen.com since 2007, and her debut cookbook was published by Penguin Random House in 2013. Laura’s poetry has appeared in anthologies published by Āporo Press, Auckland University Press and Muswell Press, and she completed her Master of Creative Writing at Auckland University of Technology in 2022. Born in Waiuku, Laura currently lives in Tāmaki Makaurau. Hoods Landing is her first novel.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Cringeworthy: The 90's, Cringeworthy – 90s!
A high-octane explosion of ‘90s nostalgia!
Written and devised by Andrea Sanders
Produced by Beatgirl Productions
Starring Andrea Sanders, Devon Neiman, Jared Pallesen and Emma Katene
Following the success of Cringeworthy ’60s, ’70s and ’80s, this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a ‘rad’ mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.
The 90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, the swing revival (Mambo No. 5), country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as To Sir With Love, Silly Love Songs, Unchained Melody and Get Down on It (can you dig it??).
On the local scene, legends such as Crowded House, Dave Dobbyn, The Exponents, Margaret Urlich, Supergroove, True Bliss, Ardijah, South Side of Bombay and The Chills gave us heavenly pop hits that have become Kiwi classics.
In some ‘fly’ outfits, Cringeworthy – the ’90s packages the hits of the decade (including Can’t Touch This, Weather With You, Love Shack and How Bizarre) with some unforgettable fashion trends including flannel shirts, baggy jeans, tracksuits and chokers. These energetic styles are woven together with a witty narrative reflecting the lifestyle, news events and culture of the time – smelling like Teen Spirit!
What’s the time Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today. Get ready to party like its 1999!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Declarations of Love (And Other Useless Things) - BATS Theatre, Created by Tempest Theatre Co

Back for its five year anniversary, Emma Maguire and Hamish Boyle run the gauntlet of sketch comedy, performing 15+ sketches about love, sex, queerness and rom-coms in 55 minutes.
It's delirious, it'll get your blood pumping (not like that), and maybe we'll all come out of it satisfied.

Think parodies of Fifty Shades of Grey and the manosphere.
Interrogating love languages and horoscopes.
A lot of ~intimate eye contact~.
Maybe some touching.

The works.

“Take your friends. Take your lovers. This show IS a love story. And it’s totally for everyone.”
Theatreview

Created and Performed by Emma Maguire & Hamish Boyle
Facilitation & dramaturgy by Jo Marsh
Lighting design and operation by Ezra Jones-Moki
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Confessions Booth, ✨ Confessions Booth - Hosted by a Fabulous Drag Host ✨
Wellington, it’s time to spill your secrets… or just sip and enjoy everyone else’s! 👀
Step into the Confessions Booth for a cheeky, interactive night of cocktails, laughs, and anonymous confessions, hosted by a fabulous drag MC. Part comedy, part interactive theatre, part party - guaranteed to keep you laughing, sipping, and maybe confessing…
Here’s how it works:
On arrival, grab a drink and submit a confession on a card or via QR code. Totally optional - sipping cocktails is a perfectly valid choice!
Confessions must be about you only - keep other people’s skeletons in their closet.
You can submit anonymously, or add your name for a little extra spice and interaction with the host (and a chance to win a price).
Selected confessions will be read aloud by our drag MC, who will add cheeky commentary, playful roasts, and audience Q&A.
Not every confession will make it to the stage, but every secret counts and contributes to the fun.
Between confession sets, enjoy music, cocktails, and mingling. After the main show, the party continues with a pop, disco, and house playlist.
Ticket Tiers:
GA - $25: Entry only.
Upgraded - $35: Entry + welcome bubbly 🥂
VIP - $55: Entry + welcome drink (cocktail, wine, beer or Pal) + charcuterie cup + priority seating.
📍 Where: Whisky & Wood, Wellington
📅 When: Thursday 23 October, 7:00pm
Sip. Spill. Repeat. Whether you’re confessing your darkest secrets or just watching the chaos unfold, this is a night of laughs, drinks, and drama you won’t forget.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
NZIFF: Dreams (Sex Love), A teenage girl recounts her crush for her teacher through the pages of a memoir. The winner of the Golden Bear 2025 is a lucid and tender chronicle of the unforgettable experience of first love.

Originally intended as the second chapter in his trilogy and released in Norway as such, Dag Johan Haugerud’s Dreams ended up premiering internationally as the last. But it secured a fitting crown to the trilogy, by winning the Best Film at the 2025 Berlinale, thus inducting Haugerud among world class auteurs.

Dreams emanates from two of Haugerud’s passions: literature, as he first gained prominence in his homeland as writer, and the cinema of French master Éric Rohmer, distinguished by sentimental skirmishes brimful of finely written dialogues.

The film’s protagonist and narrator is Johanne, a 17-year-old student who falls for her new French teacher Johanna. Johanne manages to get close to her crush, who nonchalantly ignores how her student’s devotion is veering into affection. Yet, this chronicle of first love is told in a voice over reflecting the memoir that Johanne wrote on her experience – meaning that things may or may not have happened as she says. The memoir is also read by the girl’s mother and grandmother who muse on the girl’s literary talent and provide a layer of irony and melancholy to an unfathomably lucid and tender chronicle of the universal and unforgettable experience of first love. — Paolo Bertolin
label: Film & Media

description:
Steiner School Fair 2025, Nau Mai Haere Mai ki te Raphael House Steiner School Fair. The School Fair is our major annual fundraiser hosted by the school community. Its purpose is to celebrate the school’s education and culture with the wider Wellington Community.

Each year students, teachers and parents work together to transform the school environment. Activities, displays, artistic presentations, gift stalls and food offerings provide a venue for community engagement that is a highlight on the school’s annual calendar.

Dive into a world of magic and imagination at our Annual Fair! Join us for a day fueled by holistic education, creative adventures and community togetherness.

Throughout the year, parents, students and teachers get together to transform our school into a mystical, sensory wonderland.

Explore and shop from a delightful array of unique, handcrafted crafts, toys, and Seasonal treats. This is where nature, creativity and heartwarming experiences come together to nurture young minds and inspire families.

Kindergarten parents create small gifts, from natural, materials which the young child will receive in the Little Peoples room. The handwork room is lovingly and thoughtfully prepared with the sensory experiences and impressions of the young child in mind.

Other parents are busy with tasks like creating Christmas crackers and decorations and researching new and exciting tantalizing recipes for the two cafes.

The Teaching faculty gathers students' work, from Kindergarten to Class 12 (Year 13), which are on display in the Eurythmy Room. If you have ever wondered what a main lesson book is you are bound to find one, or more, here!

To ensure there is fun for everyone we even create games to play both indoors and out. Then to add to the atmosphere during the day you will hear the sound of music and singing, and even some dancing while enjoying an organic coffee. The School Fair is a great day for all.

Skip the traffic - There is very limited parking around the school area, so please make use of our Fair Shuttle Bus - every 30 minutes to and from Melling Station. Gold coin per person per trip.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Fresh Produce, Fresh Produce
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival
Directed by Guanny Liu-Prosee
Performed by graduates of the NZIF Youth Programme

Check out the future of New Zealand improv as these young whippersnappers vie for your laughs. Fresh on the scene, the graduates of the New Zealand Improv Festival Youth Programme are here to show you what they’ve got.

For the past week, they have immersed themselves in the joy of improv, and now they’re ready to impress you with their newly honed acting chops over two nights of high-energy hilarity.

Born in 2008, now in its 16th year (don’t think too hard about the maths), NZIF is a whirlwind celebration and showcase of improvisation from around Aotearoa and the world.

The NZIF Youth Programme brings together young people from around the Te-Whanganui-A-Tara region for a week of improv training and joy. For more information please email

We are grateful for the support of Insight to Action Consulting and the Performing Arts Foundation.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Photography: Nicolette Hurnen

description:
Customer Service Essentials, This course will cover the importance of creating a customer service mindset when dealing with your most important asset in a business, your customers. It introduces the key requirement to have a strong product knowledge, effective communication and listening skills, and polished customer service etiquette.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for employees who interact with customers on a regular basis, whether by phone or in person, and people who would like to gain a strong, foundational level of knowledge about how to deal effectively with customers.

Learning outcomes:
Understand the importance of a customer service mindset.
Learn about customer service etiquette and how it’s unique for each business.
Explain the requirement for a strong product and service knowledge.
Demonstrate the pivotal role of good communication and listening skills.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course Detail
Duration: Half day, in person
Time: 9am - 1pm

Course includes:
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee and morning or afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
Friday Laughs with Lesa Macleod-Whiting and El Jaguar, Saturday Laughs at the Royal Hotel brings top comedy talent to the heart of Featherston

This month's show features -
El Jaguar
Canadian comedy act El Jaguar is coming to wrestle his way into hilarity. From Canada, to New Zealand, and throughout Australia, El Jaguar is making a name for himself on the comedy scene using only his fast wits and tight lycra.
From the dusty streets of central America, rising triumphant as the luchador everyone wanted to be in the World Wrestling Federation circa 1990, then into obscurity: El Jaguar is making a comeback… and it’s going to be hilarious.

And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards

More acts to be announced!

This event brought to you with support from TrustHouse Ltd
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
George Fenn is: Sexy Ghost Boy, Sexy Ghost Boy is a wordless interactive comedy that came from the challenge to make work exploring consent without using words. Thematically this show is a celebration of the micro-neurosis and little rituals we have around sex and appearing sexy. It is an uplifting and exciting show, which is satirical in its burlesque and invigorating through its clown. It is very, very funny.
The performer’s approach to interaction and participation is gentle, with a focus on ensuring the audience is enthusiastic consenting to each action. George Fenn is an interactive theatre comedian with decade of experience. This is not an experimental show. This is a weird show. A very good, weird show.

Official and unofficial praise Sexy Ghost Boy:
Organised Chaos Award at Auckland Fringe / 2024
Bizarre and Charming Award / Hasting Fringe Festival 2024
Nominated for Outstanding Performer / Dunedin Fringe 2025
“A theatrical alchemist, Fenn has the rare talent to create something utterly ridiculous yet very clever…he worms his way into our brains making it crazy, yet safe. There’s an element of consent in the interaction that is miles away from the experience of sitting in the front row of some stand-ups.” - Rosheen Fitzgerald, Theatreview
"but we both feel so… I don’t even know how to describe it. I feel like I’m floating while simultaneously feeling grounded, I’m ecstatic while also very chill. Maybe it’s the full moon, or maybe I’m just a little bit possessed by the Sexy Ghost Boy." - Laura Ferguson, Art Murmurs
"... Like Mr. Bean, but Sexy." - Audience member
"What the **** that was incredible." - Audience member
The show is strictly R18. It contains sexual themes and nudity up to underwear.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
GISH: Live at Abandoned Tap Room Porirua, GISH: Live at Abandoned Tap Room Porirua
Join us for Gish Live at Abandoned Tap Room, Porirua
Date: Wednesday 19th November 2025
Time: 7:00pm
Comedy icon GISH is back with a brand-new tour across Aotearoa. For over 20 years, GISH has been one of New Zealand’s most beloved comedians, famous for his outrageous parodies that mix six strings with dodgy things. Get ready for a night where no song is safe. Joining him is Canadian freestyle sensation Jesse Firebrand, a razor-sharp musical comedian known for lightning-fast improvisation comedy songs, tearing through the Australian scene, with no one in New Zealand doing what he does. Your host for the night is Anthony Wilson, an Auckland-based comic and crowd favourite who has performed across Aotearoa, Australia, and the UK, known for quick wit, polished storytelling, and pub-worthy tales. There will also be a special guest on the night.

For more info and tickets go to www.gishtour.co.nz
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Glimmers of Gold | Embroidery by Jo Dixey, A gorgeous new exhibition pops up in Old St Paul's vestry this September featuring 79 hand embroidered golden humans.
Embroiderer Jo Dixey is constantly fascinated by the short interactions we have as humans that leave us with calm or happy feelings; feelings that can last for the rest of the day or sometimes much longer.
'This can be sharing a smile with a stranger on a beautiful day or even in the rain, chatting with people in a long queue, collectively watching a great movie. Being open to these moments enhances our lives and the lives of those around us,' Dixey says.
'In psychology, these tiny moments that stimulate positive feelings are called glimmers.'
Gold is a chemical element with the symbol Au and atomic number 79.
'Welcome to Glimmers of Gold.'
About Jo Dixey
Dixey is a Royal School of Needlework trained embroiderer. She teaches small groups a variety of embroidery techniques, works on commissions which have included large altar cloths, university banners and work for the fashion and movie industries, and repairs old embroideries. She holds exhibitions of her embroidered pieces every few years.
In 2017, Dixey published her first book Stitch People, which was later re-released as Creative Thread.
Her work is held in private and public collections in New Zealand and overseas.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
GISH: Live at Foxton Hotel, GISH: Live at Foxton Hotel
Join us for GISH: Live at Foxton Hotel!

Date: Thursday, 23 October 2025
Time: 7:00pm - 9:00pm
Location: Foxton Hotel, Foxton, Horowhenua

Comedy icon GISH is back with a brand-new tour across Aotearoa. For over 20 years, GISH has been one of New Zealand’s most beloved comedians, famous for his outrageous parodies that mix six strings with dodgy things. Get ready for a night where no song is safe. Joining him is Canadian freestyle sensation Jesse Firebrand, a razor-sharp musical comedian known for lightning-fast improvisation comedy songs, tearing through the Australian scene, with no one in New Zealand doing what he does. Your host for the night is Anthony Wilson, an Auckland-based comic and crowd favourite who has performed across Aotearoa, Australia, and the UK, known for quick wit, polished storytelling, and pub-worthy tales. There will also be a special guest on the night.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Gloria, Witness a show in honour of the renowned choreographer and dancer, Douglas Wright. The New Zealand Dance Company and Co3 Contemporary Dance Australia will restage his masterpiece, ‘Gloria’. Set to Vivaldi's legendary score, performed live by the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and Voices New Zealand. A celebration of life, dancers will fly, twist, and turn among the grandeur of the historic St James Theatre.
‘Gloria’ was originally performed at the 1992 Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. This contemporary trans-Tasman collaboration honours one of Aotearoa's most prolific dance talents. Producing more than 30 major touring works in his life and dancing across the globe, Douglas Wright was a celebrated performer and creative until his death in 2018.
The evening will also feature two new creations. ‘A Moving Portrait’ by Raewyn Hill is an intimate, meditative reflection on ageing and grace. ‘Lament’ by Moss Te Ururangi Patterson will take audiences on a powerful journey through memory and resilience. The performance honours the whakapapa of contemporary dance in Aotearoa.
‘Gloria’ is exclusive to Wellington. It's presented as part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts 2026.
label: Arts & Theatre

Lia Kelly

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. description:
Achieving Cashflow Freedom, Cashflow freedom means your business delivers sufficient cash for you to live your desired lifestyle. In turbulent times, this can feel increasingly unattainable, but there are many things you can take control of to increase the odds.
By attending this seminar you’ll:
Learn how a tougher economy could impact your business
Understand how to better plan for the ‘what ifs’
Discover multiple ways to increase sales outcomes
Understand how measurement improves management
Learn the processes required to boost your cash levels
Following the webinar, we’ll send attendees a Guide to Cashflow and Cashflow Health Check to ensure you take control of your cashflow and achieve cashflow freedom.

description:
The Tradie Roadshow 2025 - Johnsonville!, The Tradie Roadshow - 2025!
Come join us at the Johnsonville Rugby Club for an exciting event tailored just for tradies like you! Learn valuable tips and tricks to boost your business and increase your success in 2026. Network with fellow tradies and industry experts to gain insights and grow your professional circle. Don't miss out on this opportunity to take your trade to the next level!


Key Topics & Talking Points

Quote Smarter, Win More
How to make your quotes stand out from the competition with simple, professional templates.
Using free/low-cost quoting tools to speed up response time (and why speed wins jobs).
Adding small touches (images, guarantees, payment links) that boost acceptance rates.

Lead Tracking Made Easy
Simple ways to track every enquiry so none fall through the cracks.
Using a basic CRM or spreadsheet to stay on top of follow-ups.
How to automate reminders so you never forget to reply.

Booking Without the Back-and-Forth
How to let customers book jobs or quotes online, even outside work hours.
Tools to sync bookings with your calendar automatically.
Why offering easy booking options can double your conversion rates.

Boosting Your Online Presence
Making Google Reviews work for you — and how to get them without pestering.
Setting up a simple “digital business card” (or Quickr app) for instant credibility.
Quick wins on Facebook & Instagram that take 10 minutes a week.

Following Up Like a Pro
The 3-day rule for follow-ups — and why it secures more jobs.
Automating polite reminders for quotes and overdue invoices.
Staying front-of-mind without being pushy.

Why It’s Impactful for 2026

Customers expect fast, simple communication — these tools make it effortless.
You can compete with bigger companies without hiring extra staff.
Every strategy here is low-cost or free, and takes less than 1 hour to set up.

This event is free, just bring a mate and your questions to the Johnsonville Rugby Club.

Registration for the event is recommended so we can determine numbers.
label: Business & Networking

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.

description:
James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington, James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!

Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.

One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.


About James Nokise

A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.

Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.

James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.
label: Arts & Theatre

An Evening of Travel with Wendy Wu Tours, We’re delighted to invite you and friends to a special Travel Information Evening with Wendy Wu Tours – New Zealand’s leading touring specialist.
Known for their fully-inclusive, expertly guided tours, Wendy Wu Tours take the stress out of travel while unlocking some of the world’s most extraordinary destinations.
From the cherry blossoms of Japan and the wonders of China, to the treasures of the Middle East, the Four Stans and Africa, a special Women’s only tour in Sept 2026 and the colourful landscapes of South East Asia, Central and South America – there’s a journey for every traveller.
Come along and discover:
• Award-winning tours designed for ease and comfort

Whether you’re planning your next adventure or simply curious to learn more, this is a relaxed, no-obligation evening designed to inspire.

description:
Kotahitanga: Artist Series - Tusiata Avia, We are honoured to host acclaimed poet; Tusiata Avia who will be opening Kotahitanga with her response to He Kura Toi Tangata.

Expect nothing less than the power of the word steeped in truth and machete-sharpened wit from this New Zealand Samoan poetry pantheon.

5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends



About Tusiata Avia

Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. Her iconic play Wild Dogs Under My Skirt showed Off-Broadway in 2020, where it won the Fringe Encore Outstanding Production of the Year. Her most recent play, The Savage Coloniser Show won Best New Play at Wellington Theatre Awards 2024. Both plays are based on books of poetry of the same name.

Tusiata was awarded a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to poetry and in 2024, the Prime Ministers Award for Literary Achievement: Poetry.


This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kōrero Paki, Kōrero Paki
Performed by Kōrero Paki

Crack open a cold one and get set for a night of mean kōrero and wild comedy from this spontaneous tira whakaari. Delight as our performers talk sh*t, share off the cuff stories, and take the show to wild places through improv. Like all good garage parties, this show will be jam-packed with crack up storytelling, cheeky banter, and plenty of laughs.

Kōrero Paki debuted at NZIF 2024 and had a successful run at the 2025 NZ International Comedy Festival.

Featuring:

Mo (Mamaeroa) Munn
Q Potts
Kipling DC
Lachlan Bowker
Viki Moananu

Kōrero Paki is a Māori and Pacifica improv group who have performed in the NZ International Comedy Fest and the NZ Improv Festival. A group of improvisers and stand up comedians, Kōrero Paki is focused on comedic storytelling improv.

The show contains adult themes and strong language. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

description:
Lads Lads Lads! A Drag King Show, Are you ready for a boisterous band of bros?
A hefty helping of handsome heirs?!
A smorgasbord of sweaty studs?!

Then grab the gang and head down to Fringe Bar on 6 June for Lads Lads Lads! A Drag King Show, and prepare yourselves for the most delightful, most glittery, most wholesome masculinity you ever did see (there will be no hazing here!)

Our dazzling cast of dashing dudes and extraordinarily hairy gentlemen are bound to leave your seats moistened, your gobs a gasp, and have you cheering “Yeah the boys!”

So buck up, grab the whole fraternity and head to Eventfinda to grab your tickets from just $20.

Support your local Drag Kings!

Lads Lads Lads!

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($30.00 per ticket)

GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up
Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

You can contact us at willysmackntush@gmail.com

Over 3 rounds our talented performers will Lip Sync off against a random competitor chosen by the crowd - expect splits, and surprise tricks as each performer fights for the crown with charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and plenty of lip-gloss. Who will bring the passion? Who will bring the fire?
Watch as a lineup of unstoppable talent goes head-to-head in a night of iconic anthems, jaw-dropping moves, and show-stopping stunts. From power ballads to pop bangers, each number is a deadly display of pure performance power.
WHO WILL BE CROWNED WELLINGTONS LIP SYNC ASSASSIN?

A smorgasbord of sweaty studs?!

Then grab the gang and head down to Fringe Bar on 6 June for Lads Lads Lads! A Drag King Show, and prepare yourselves for the most delightful, most glittery, most wholesome masculinity you ever did see (there will be no hazing here!)

Our dazzling cast of dashing dudes and extraordinarily hairy gentlemen are bound to leave your seats moistened, your gobs a gasp, and have you cheering “Yeah the boys!”

So buck up, grab the whole fraternity and head to Eventfinda to grab your tickets from just $20.

Support your local Drag Kings!

description:
Made to bloom, exhibition by Josefine Gronkrans, We have a solo exhibition coming up from one of our ceramic artists Josefine Gronkrans
The opening night is 14th October, Tuesday at 5:30 pm
Vincents gallery : Willis St Village
5/148 Willis St
Wellington
14th October - 4th November
Pencil the date.
Nau mai haere mai.
Josefine Gronkrans bio
I'm a ceramicists from a rural part of Wellington who take inspiration from the beauty of Creation. I moved to beautiful Aotearoa from Sweden a few years ago, and my journey with ceramics started in 2023 and I've been elbows deep in clay ever since. I use flora found all over the world, and outside my doorsteps, to shape my artwork. My ceramic pieces are all hand made and no piece will be the other alike. I mainly throw a shape on the wheel and then let it tell me what it wants to become.
This exhibition is guided by Ecclesiastes 3:1-11. I think life is beautiful in it's times of joy, but also in the times of struggle, where we can grow and learn.
A Time for Everything
There is a time for everything,
and a season for every activity under the heavens:
a time to be born and a time to die,
a time to plant and a time to uproot,
a time to kill and a time to heal,
a time to tear down and a time to build,
a time to weep and a time to laugh,
a time to mourn and a time to dance,
a time to scatter stones and a time to gather them,
a time to embrace and a time to refrain from embracing,
a time to search and a time to give up,
a time to keep and a time to throw away,
a time to tear and a time to mend,
a time to be silent and a time to speak,
a time to love and a time to hate,
a time for war and a time for peace.
What do workers gain from their toil? I have seen the burden God has laid on the human race. He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the human heart; yet no one can fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Manage Your Expectations, Created and Performed by Eliza Sanders
Produced by House of Sand
Directed by Charley Allanah

You decide the ending…

Solo performer Eliza Sanders has a simple task: to tell you everything that will happen in the show, so you can decide if you would like to see it. Nothing is ever so simple.

This genre-defying work of dance, theatre, live film, clown and absurd philosophising takes the idea of the ‘trigger warning’ to its absurdist extreme to question how ‘informed’ consent can really be, and asking ‘How much do you really want to know?’

Created and performed by multi-award-winning maverick of the stage Eliza Sanders, Manage Your Expectations helps us to see the limits of the power to communicate and our failures to say what we mean. Through movement, multimedia, and razor-sharp wit, it examines the impossibility of perfect communication, musing on the influence of context, identity and personal history while creating something beautiful from our collective mess.

“Clever, witty, evocative, subversive, immersive, despairing, poignant, personal and universal” — Deirdre Tarrant, Theatreview

“Beautifully vulnerable” – Chloe Jaques, Theatreview, 2024

Full of vigour, energy, chaos and a hint of confrontation, Manage Your Expectations is a mind (and body) bending show about how we connect in an increasingly complex world. And you decide the ending…

Content warning: this show contains explicit content, mild coarse language, heavy nudity, themes of abortion and rape.

WINNER: Best Performer, Whangārei Fringe 2024
WINNER: Outstanding Solo Performance, NZ Fringe 2024
WINNER: San Diego Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Best in Fringe, NZ Fringe 2024

description:
Auckland Kristallnacht Commemorative Concert 2025, The Holocaust Centre of New Zealand must confirm all tickets generated by the Humanitix ticketing system. Once you register, you'll receive an acknowledgement from Humanitix, followed by a second email directly from the Holocaust Centre of New Zealand.
2025 Annual Kristallnacht Commemorative Concert
Escape & Exile – East & West
Join the Holocaust Centre of New Zealand for a poignant evening of remembrance and reflection. The Te Kōkī Trio, featuring Inbal Megiddo (cello), Martin Riseley (violin), and Jian Liu (piano), will be joined by Professor Kim Cunio, Head of Te Kōkī / New Zealand School of Music, in a powerful performance commemorating Kristallnacht.
 This concert commemorates Kristallnacht, or “The Night of Broken Glass,” the horrific pogroms of 9–10 November 1938, across Germany, Austria, and the Sudetenland. This state-sponsored violence saw the murder of an estimated 91 Jews, the arrest of 30,000, and the destruction of hundreds of synagogues and Jewish businesses. Kristallnacht is widely regarded as a pivotal moment, marking the escalation of Nazi persecution and often described as the beginning of the Holocaust.
 The Nazis sought to silence the music and art of all those they deemed "untermenschen," including six million Jews and other victimised groups. This concert stands as a powerful act of defiance and remembrance, allowing us to hear the voices of those who were murdered, forced into hiding, or exiled. It celebrates their artistic brilliance and ensures their memory lives on.
 This year's theme is "Escape and Exile: East and West." In the tradition of paying musical tribute to all victims, we will honour the music of Jewish composers from across the globe—from the Netherlands and Nazi-occupied Germany in the West, all the way to Iraq and Shanghai in the East.
 The programme will feature pieces that honour:
Erna Weiss Falk, a talented Jewish opera singer from Cologne, whose promising career was cut short by anti-Jewish laws. She and her family ultimately escaped to the Netherlands.
Brigitte Schiffer, a young composer who completed her doctorate in Berlin before fleeing the Nazis to Egypt, where she became the director of the Higher Music Education Institute for women.
The Al Kuwaiti brothers, Jewish pioneers of modern Iraqi music, survived the Farhud, a devastating pogrom inspired by Nazi ideology that targeted Baghdad's Jewish population on June 1-2, 1941, coinciding with the Jewish holiday of Shavuot. Despite their legacy resonating across the Middle East through radio, their contributions were erased from Iraqi history.
Ferdinand Adler, a Hungarian Jewish violinist who miraculously escaped from the Dachau concentration camp, to Shanghai.
 Join us for this important event as we mourn the lives lost and celebrate the resilience of the human spirit. We look forward to welcoming you.
 Details:
Wellington: Sunday, 9 November 2025
Auckland: Monday, 10 November 2025
Doors Open: 6:00 PM
Concert Begins: 6:45 PM
Location: To Be Announced
 Please RSVP by Monday, 3 November 2025, to let us know if you can join us.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Linda Linda Linda - Fundraiser for Burmese Punks!, The Freedom Shop are hosting another movie night and we would love to see you there.
LINDA LINDA LINDA (Nobuhiro Yamashita, Japan, 2005)

Fundraiser for Burmese punks - Koha entry.

Since the military overthrow of a semi-democratic government in 2021, Burma has been immersed in a civil war, three million people have been displaced, many now living as refugees in surrounding countries. Over half of the country has been liberated by opposition armed groups, but the regime hangs on, using air strikes, forced conscription and brutality to control the main cities and areas of economic value. Amongst the opposition is the punk movement that has led protests, organised Food not Bombs groups, food gardens, social centres and other projects, both inside and outside the country, all run on the smell of an oily rag. Your dollar goes further when it’s in the hands of punks.

We are screening Linda Linda Linda – a low-key, cheerful but by no means saccharine, 2005 Japanese film that actually gets punk. It has the same plot as every other rock movie, except this one is believable. Four grumpy teenagers are empowered through a willingness to accept outsiders, music and friendship.

Burmese food from 6pm, a short talk about the situation at 7pm followed by the film.

description:
Oops! All Donkeys, Oops! All Donkeys
Directed by Christine Brooks

Make. Pull. Carry. Work. Repeat.

Donkeys! Are you not tired? Atomised and alienated? It’s time to lay down your burdens and join us at our retreat. Be among friends. Feel the cool gleam of the moon upon your ears. Find and then heal your inner donkey. A most rare vision awaits.

From the creator of Love Isthmus: Dystopia Edition (“a truly bizarre and apocalyptic hour of improv” - The Wellingtonista), Murder on a Boat (“really, really, really good” - Regional News), and The Solarpunk Archives (“creative antics that leave the audience howling with laughter” - Theatreview) comes this festival premiere of the show concept that came to the director in a dream.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Messengers, ‘Animals first entered the imagination as messengers and promises,’ John Berger.
Messengers explores the enduring gaze shared between humans and other animals. The exhibition title is inspired by a line from John Berger’s seminal 1977 essay ‘Why Look at Animals?’ Berger argued that the relationship between humans and animals – ‘our unspeaking companionship’ – has been transformed by capitalism.
Messengers brings together historical and contemporary ways of looking at animals in photography and art. It features archival photographs from the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Collections, first taken by newspaper photographers in the mid twentieth century. The images capture everything from the polar bears once housed in Wellington Zoo, to an elderly gentleman standing amongst the life size concrete animal sculptures in his garden. These images are at once tender and loving, sentimental and silly, kind and indifferent.
Messengers places these archival photographs in proximity and conversation with contemporary sculpture and moving image works by four Aotearoa-based artists: Denise Batchelor, Brit Bunkley, Jane Dodd and John Ward Knox. From eerie AI and computer-generated animals to the hypnotic stare of a real live Ruru; from carved wooden godwits you can hold in your hand to ‘hominoid’ brooches, each artist’s work speaks to the ‘unspeaking companionship’ between humanity and other animals.
IMAGE Brit Bunkley, still from Transit, single channel video, 2025
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
New Zealand International Comedy Festival, Every May, the capital comes alive with laughter, thanks to the New Zealand International Comedy Festival (NZICF). New Zealand’s homegrown talent shares the stage with some of the world’s most exciting comedians. You could catch a big-name international artist, or discover a new local rising star. 
Since it began in 1993, the aim of the festival has been to champion the craft of comedy so everyone can share a laugh. Every year, a huge group of comedians descend on Wellington from local shores and beyond to deliver three weeks of merriment. 
The festival offers a diverse range of high-quality laughs. It showcases the best of local comedy and gives audiences a taste of some of the world’s best acts. Catch over 100 comics performing at The Opera House, BATS Theatre, Fringe Bar, San Fran, and more.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Over and Out, Created and performed by Jackson Burling.

"NEVER become a truck driver!" - A young Jackson Burling took that advice, avoiding the fork in the road, but now, after a long and gruelling two year slog in the arts industry he must confront that age old question: "why not, Dad?" - and take us along for the ride. In Over and Out, premiering at the 2025 TAHI Festival, Burling brings a real interview, a big character, and even bigger questions to the stage.

One actor. 50 minutes. Countless emotional potholes. Along the way, we get a rare look into the gritty, heartfelt, and often-overlooked life of one of Aotearoa’s essential workers: the truck driver. Is the open road calling — or is the stage his true destination? Buckle up. This is verbatim theatre with serious mileage.

Audience Care: Contains coarse language and mature themes.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Monument, Sculpting the future of our nation

“Succession meets Barbie” -Showcase Victoria
Edith Aldridge is the youngest woman to be elected leader of her country. In a lush presidential suite, she has just ninety minutes to get ready for the most monumental day of her life. But things are not going to plan. Due to heavy fog, her team is stuck in another city. Enter Rosie, a twenty-two year old makeup artist from the David Jones counter, sent last minute to help Edith get camera ready.
From very different worlds, these two women, though face to face, do not see eye to eye in this provocative, slick and funny play that is “sparkling fresh and urgently of the now”.

The team that brought you PRIMA FACIE, brings you this dynamic new work that “explores the role that makeup and fashion play in how we perceive and receive women in power.” -review quotes from Arts Hub & Australian Arts Review.


Written by Emily Sheehan
Produced by Kavanah Productions & BRAVE Theatre
Directed by Lyndee-Jane Rutherford

We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. description:
Painted Past: Tribute to the Heritage City of Ahmedabad, An exhibition Sandip Prajapati celebrating the architectural heritage of Ahmedabad, India.
Opening Hours
Tuesday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm
Sunday: 11am - 4pm
Ahmedabad, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage City in 2017, is renowned for its rich architectural heritage and cultural significance, showcasing a blend of Indo-Islamic architecture and vibrant local traditions.
Born in Patan, Gujarat, Sandip Prajapati has always been fascinated by the rich history and culture of the region.
An architect by profession, he uses his knowledge of design and structure to capture the essence of the pol houses. Pol houses are traditional residential buildings that are clustered around narrow streets and courtyards in the old city of Ahmedabad. They date back to the 18th century and reflect the influence of various communities and religions that coexisted in the city. Pol houses are known for their intricate wooden carvings, ornamental facades, and colorful decorations. They are also a living testimony of the social and harmony that prevailed in the city.
CONTACT
Website: sprajapati.com
Instagram: @sandipprajapati1
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Royal NZ Ballet Presents The Nutcracker, Summer 2025 will be celebrated with an eagerly anticipated new production of the world’s most beloved ballet classic, The Nutcracker. Central to Christmas memories for generations of audiences, The Nutcracker is a timeless celebration of family, fantasy and growing up, where ‘home for Christmas’ is the most powerful magic of all.

A uniquely Kiwi touch transports our audiences to the nostalgia of childhood holidays at the beach in Act I, before being carried in Act II to the snowy Southern Alps, where we encounter a fairytale Kingdom of the Sweets – some of which may look quite familiar…

This new production will be created by RNZB Artistic Director Ty King-Wall, with set and costume designs by Tracy Grant Lord (A Midsummer Night’s Dream, The Firebird), lighting design by Jon Buswell (Swan Lake, The Firebird, Hansel & Gretel) and visual effects by POW Studios (Cinderella, Hansel & Gretel), all driven by the timeless magic of Tchaikovsky’s wonderful music.

Live orchestra, conducted by Hamish McKeich, will accompany performances in Wellington, Christchurch and Auckland.

Pre Performance Talk Friday 31st October 6:30-7:00pm
Post Matinee Q&A Saturday 8th November 1:30pm
Audio Described Performance Saturday 8th November 1:30pm
Warm Up Curtain Up Saturday 8th November

description:
Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone), Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone)
Award-winning Australian comedian Rory Lowe is bringing the chaos to New Zealand!
Fresh from sold-out tours across Australia and Asia—and with his first comedy special about to be filmed—Rory hits NZ for the very first time with an hour of wild stories, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered laughs.

From getting arrested for terrorism, to snitching on a meth head, to getting married and failing miserably at quitting the party life, Rory’s real-life tales are as ridiculous as they are hilarious. Expect raw, real, and unpredictable comedy from one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today.

Critics and audiences can’t get enough:

★★★★★ – What’s On In Adelaide:
“Comedy at its finest! Lowe draws us in with his unique stories and larger-than-life personality… absolutely guarantees a f*ing funny hour of laughs!”


★★★★½ – Fourth Wall Media:
“Rory Lowe is absolutely killing it in the comedy scene… Fast-paced and non-stop, the jokes are funnier every year and the crowd interaction is spot on.”


★★★★ – The AU Review:
“Time flies when watching Rory, a non-stop comedian, with ready-made jokes and quick wit to keep the crowd on its toes.”

With over 2.2 million YouTube subscribers as part of YeahMad, 475K TikTok followers, and a reputation for high-energy, off-the-wall shows, Rory Lowe is ready to take New Zealand by storm.

One man, one mic, and an hour of absolute mayhem—get ready for Rory Lowe unleashed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Return to Babylon Documentary Film Screening, The Assyrian Church of the East Youth Association (ACEYA) (Wellington Branch) is excited to present a special screening of 'Return to Babylon'—the only one of its kind in Aotearoa New Zealand.
The documentary film takes you on an Assyrian family’s journey as they visit the Assyrian Homeland after years of living in France.
This is a story of reconnecting with one’s roots, identity, and people.
Following the screening, we will have a pre-recorded Q&A session which includes the film's director, Sébastien Daycard-Heid, and Sémiramis Ide and Agnes Ide Banipal—two of the film's protagonists.
 Synopsis:
Sémiramis is French, an Eastern Christian, and Assyro-Chaldean. In the Val-d'Oise region, this community, originally from Turkey and Iraq, has lived since the 1980s in a rhythm marked by weddings, church services, and family meals.
Shaped by the exile of their parents and the persecution their community faced under the Turkish dictatorship and Daesh, Sémiramis nurtures her roots in Assyrian civilization, originating from Mesopotamia. But the puzzle of her history no longer fits together as it once did.
Gradually, the elders are disappearing, taking with them an identity and culture that is 6,000 years old. How can this fracture be repaired, and this heritage preserved? Should they consider staying or returning to their ancestral homeland, now that peace has returned? Can one go back after decades of conflict? Can they rebuild and start anew to live in peace with themselves and others?
"Return to Babylon" is a road movie from Sarcelles to Erbil, following Sémiramis and her family on a journey that leads them to question their future in France and the fate of their community in the Middle East.
A film by Marie Dault, Sémiramis Ide, and Sébastien Daycard-Heid
Directed by Sébastien Daycard-Heid
Screen time: 52-minutes; French and Assyrian with subtitles
Link to the English-subtitled trailer: https://www.instagram.com/p/DDzsYJzt_B9/
The screening event will be held at the Cockburn Street Chapel, 1 Cockburn Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington from 5-7pm.

Entrance is free, but please register to confirm your attendance.

We welcome koha (donations) which will go towards supporting the ACEYA Wellington Branch's youth-focused activities and events.

description:
Saturday Laughs with Kajun Brooking and Sera Devcich, Saturday Laughs at Abandoned Taproom Petone is a showcase of some of your favourite comedians in the heart of Petone

With Kajun Brooking
Raised on the gang infested streets of Hastings, Kajun moved to Whanganui in search of a better life. This is where he cultivates cunning comedy and hustles sticky punchlines based on life experiences. Described as slippery, quick witted and punchy, his mission is to make at least one person laugh. If he can do that, his job is done for the night and he can continue to prove to his 17 year old daughter that Dad is actually funny.

Sera Devcich
With a strong background in theatre, award winning actress Sera Devcich has turned her stage prowess to the dark art of stand up comedy. Since then she has rapidly climbed up the comedy rank, performing across the country with NZ's top comics.
Sera Devcich is a must see act.

More performers to be announced
