description:
Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington, Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington
https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance and theatre.

The story follows Ash (Ben Ashby), Morris (Ethan Morse) and Mary (Jasmine Susic), at their university graduation house party. As they deal with personal heartbreaks, surprises and betrayals they must also reckon with a climate disaster unfolding in their hometown and a global future filled with war and political unrest. Dance, Clown, Live Music, Film and Physical Theatre weave together to catch the feeling of hope in the face of oncoming doom.

Running into the sun was developed by a2 Company; The Dance & Theatre production house co-directed by Nadiyah Akbar (Footnote NZ Dance, Joel Bray Dance) and Ben Ashby (Artistic Director of Long Cloud Youth Theatre 2020-2023).

“messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.” - Melbourne Fringe Festival: Judges’ Picks.

“...suffocating and comforting …exhausting but exhilarating” - My Melbourne Arts

https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

Credits

description:
Not ya nanas market, Not ya nanas market
*Strictly R18*
Get ready to immerse yourself in a world where art and craft meet the dark and mysterious. This market is not for the faint of heart! Here's what you can expect:
1. Creepy-Cute Delights: Explore a wide range of art and craft creations that blend the creepy and cute aesthetics. From adorable monsters to spooky dolls, you'll find something to tickle your fancy.
2. Witchy Wonders: Dive into the world of witchcraft and magic. Discover spellbinding artwork, mystical jewelry, and enchanting potions. Embrace your inner witch or warlock!
3. Kinky Curiosities: For those who enjoy a touch of kink, we have a selection of unique and provocative art and crafts, and kink wear. Explore the boundaries of sensuality and embrace your desires in a safe and inclusive environment.
4. Sexy Sensations: Indulge in the world of sensuality and erotic art. Discover captivating paintings, sculptures, and photography that celebrate the beauty of the human form. Embrace your sexuality with pride!
5. LGBTQIA+ Friendly: This market is a safe space for all members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Celebrate diversity and inclusivity as you explore the wide range of art and craft offerings.
6. Alternative Art and Craft: Step outside the mainstream and explore the alternative side of creativity. From gothic to steampunk, from punk to cyberpunk, you'll find a variety of unique and unconventional art and craft pieces.
Don't miss out on this extraordinary event! Mark your calendars and invite your friends. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little bit spooked. See you at the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!
$5 cash only door entry
It definitely will NOT be your nana's market! See less
Upper Hutt, New Zealand
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
AWE Partnership Masterclass for Violists and Violinists with Yura Lee, Join us for a Masterclass!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge Festival, Orchestra Wellington will host AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee to present a masterclass for violinists and violists in Wellington.
Anyone can register to attend and observe the masterclass!
Visit https://orchestrawellington.co.nz/event/awe-masterclass-2025 to register to attend and observe the masterclass for FREE!
Violinist/violist Yura Lee is a multifaceted musician, as a soloist and as a chamber musician, and one of the very few that is equally virtuosic on both violin and viola. Her career spans three decades and takes her all over the world, captivating audiences through various musical mediums from baroque to modern, and enjoying a career that spans three decades and takes her all over the world. She has performed with major orchestras including those of New York, Chicago, Baltimore, Cleveland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and given recitals in London’s Wigmore Hall, Vienna’s Musikverein, Salzburg’s Mozarteum, the Palais des BeauxArts in Brussels, and the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam.
At age 12, she became the youngest artist ever to receive the Debut Artist of the Year prize at the Performance Today awards given by National Public Radio. She is the recipient of a 2007 Avery Fisher Career Grant; she has received numerous other international prizes, including top prizes in the Mozart, Indianapolis, Hannover, Kreisler, Bashmet, and Paganini competitions. Yura Lee was the only first prize winner awarded across four categories at the 2013 ARD Competition in Germany.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!

description:
Sophie Thorn – Victoria University Photography Collection, A tour of the photographs from Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Art Collection
Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington holds a nationally significant collection of works of art which is under the care of Te Pātaka Toi Adam Art Gallery. Known as Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka, or 'the feathers which adorn the waka', over half of this collection can be found on display in the various buildings on the university campuses at any one time.
For this special outing, join the gallery’s Kaiwhakarākei, Curator Collections, Sophie Thorn, for an afterhours tour of the Hunter Building focusing on the photography in the collection.
We will see photographic works by Lucien Rizos, Ans Westra, Peter Preyer, Joyce Campbell, Fiona Pardington, Ann Noble and Chris Corson Scott.
We are meeting at the foyer of the Hunter Building. This is the big set of glass doors off gate 2 between the two sets of lights on Kelburn Parade.
As the tour begins at 6pm we would suggest,that people park in the Hunter Building carpark (coming in Gate 1 (right at the bend between Salamanca Road and Kelburn Parade). While these are reserved spaces for staff after 5:30pm parking is a bit of a free-for-all on campus after hours.
Thursday, 11 September, 6:00pm start, Meet at Hunter Building (Main Entrance off Kelburn Parade)

description:
The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf, Experience the world through the lens of award-winning photojournalists at The World Press Photo Exhibition at Tākina. This event showcases this year’s best visual journalism, featuring powerful and thought-provoking images from New Zealand and around the world.
Additionally, visitors can view "The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf: The Friends, Influences and Inspirations Exhibition," curated by Simon Woolf.
Photos on display will feature images by Ronald Woolf and Spencer Digby (Te Papa Tongarewa Collection), alongside works by Wellington’s own Simon Woolf, internationally renowned photographer Brian Brake, and legendary sports photographer Peter Bush. The exhibition will also display images by Barry Durrant, former chief photographer of The Dominion, as well as photographs by acclaimed recent talents, including Pulitzer Prize winner Melanie Burford, celebrated international photojournalist Simon Townsley, and esteemed photo historian Graham Stewart.
Don't miss your chance to see Kiwi photographers on show at Tākina.
Epson NZ sponsors the 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf.
Event Details:
• 5 September – 5 October: 10 am – 5 pm
• Tākina Exhibition Space
• Host: New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts.
Tickets available online or at the door.
Photo: © DAVID UNWIN / The Post.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like, Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like
THIS SHOW IS R16.

Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts

Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.

Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.

Living is Like - Directed by Andrea Ferpo

Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.

Living Is Like harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

R16 - As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, The Art of Ikebana exhibition
Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.

Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.

Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm

Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.

description:
EBANZ Natural Building Conference 2025, EBANZ Natural Building Conference 2025
This year’s EBANZ (Earth Building Association of New Zealand) national conference will see industry leaders, innovators and enthusiasts come together to profile the latest ideas, technologies and projects shaping the future of low carbon, high performing, sustainable building in Aotearoa.

Set at Te Wānanga o Raukawa and the Forest Lakes Conference Centre on the Kāpiti Coast, the earth building conference will see builders, designers, researchers and earth-building enthusiasts explore how traditional and contemporary earth construction methods are shaping resilient, sustainable futures in Aotearoa and beyond.

Themed ‘Earth, Culture and Community’, the three-day conference in mid-November will include presentations, hands-on workshops, site visits and kōrero with leading voices in natural building, indigenous knowledge, climate-responsive design and regenerative practice, while also profiling New Zealand’s own set of earth building standards (NZS 4297, 4298 and 4299) 2024.

A ‘Professionals Day’ on Friday 14 November at Te Wānanga o Raukawa is aimed specifically at architects, engineers, inspectors, builders and designers interested in earth and natural building techniques. It will dive into the Tennent Brown Architects-designed Pā Reo campus at Te Wānanga (a Living Building Challenge project) and presenters will include Rau Hoskins of designTRIBE, Verena Maeder of Solid Earth and Sigi Koko, founder of Build Naturally USA.

Friday will be followed by the in-depth weekend conference at Forest Lakes, featuring talks and presentations aimed to inform and empower people on different aspects of earth and natural building as well as hands-on workshops in different methods and materials, including clay-based plasters, cob, rammed earth and adobe, straw bale and hempcrete. House tours will feature different building techniques, including straw bale and rammed earth, adobe, natural plasters and more.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
The Amber Temple at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington, The Amber Temple marries mysticism with gritty, ghoulish escapades of rogues and renegades. Vignettes of characters similar to you, similar to me, similar to someone you may have been or may one day become, all on the path towards the Amber Temple.
From the bowels of the molten earth, to the jowls of the predatory opportunist, to the angel casting light from celestial constellations, you will find yourself wrapped in a web from a sliver of time, a faraway place, perhaps an unknown space, as musician and dancer weave their tall tales of trials and tribulations, mortal life and looming death, unwavering love and venomous hate, environmentalism and satirical social commentary.
An original music and interpretive dance collaboration between singer-songwriter Julian Temple and contemporary dancer Amber Stephens.
Temple, known mostly for his work in the eponymous Julian Temple Band has written all new works for the project while Stephens, a trained contemporary ballet dancer and choreographer who ran her own dance company in Vienna, has choreographed the interpretive dance for this unique performance.
“A live dancer added a visceral element to an already emotional performance. Having a responsive artist interacting and interpreting the music through movement only heightened the experience. It bridged the gap between performer and audience.”
- Ed Castelow - Dictaphone Blues
“You’ll be a converted fan of The Amber Temple before they’ve even finished their first song. There’s an obvious sense of originality, coupled with carefully crafted dance moments and some of the most intense and outstanding folk songwriting you’ve heard. There’s a feeling though that nothing is premeditated and that improvisation is the star of the show - the kind of performance that requires decades of experience. Luckily for us, Julian and Amber have this in spades. Do yourself a favour, I guarantee you’ve seen nothing like it.”
- Sam Cullen - Singer/Songwriter
“Even having an understanding of the type of show The Amber Temple would be putting on when booking them - I was blown away by the amount of drama, tension and world-building Julian & Amber are able to accomplish in such an agile performance. The Amber Temple is a totally unique and utterly engaging experience which should be seen and celebrated.”
- Chris Scott - Seaside Music
Show starts at 7 Presale tickets $20 (+BF) via undertheradar.co.nz or $25 on the door
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Griegol, From Trick of the Light Theatre (The Bookbinder) comes a charming, moving, and wildly inventive work.

After their grandmother passes away, a child suspects they are being pursued by the smoke demon shapeshifter of the old woman’s stories. The Griegol is a dark fantasy in the vein of Spirited Away, for older children and adults. Drawing from the techniques of silent film, it utilises silhouettes, smoke, puppetry, live music, and live animation. With the operation kept in sight, audiences see both the stage effects and how they are made. Combining hi-fi with lo-fi technology, and the mythic with the everyday, The Griegol is a show without words about death, love, and monsters. After winning Director, Composer, and Production of the Year at the 2022 Wellington Theatre Awards, and touring to the USA, The Griegol returns to the Hannah Playhouse this October.

Recommended for ages 7+
Contains references to death and grief
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Life of Henry the Fifth, A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

Circa One

Heartbroken (and hilariously bitter), he crashes every wedding he sings at… until he meets Julia, a sweet waitress who might just be the one. Only problem? She’s engaged to the wrong guy.

description:
Echoes of the Past, Echoes of the Past
Presented by Best on Tap

In keeping with the theme of the festival, Best on Tap ponders what has led us to 'be here now'?

What people, actions, and objects have combined to shape this place we know as Wellington/Te Whanganui a Tara?

What paths have led us to make this our home?

What decisions, genes, and character traits echo through generations to make us who we are today?

This show will traverse time to explore these rich themes, all with a good helping of Best on Tap truth-based, grounded, spontaneous theatre.

After all, what were our ancestors doing if not improvising?

Inspired by Felipe Ortiz (Colombia)

Best on Tap is a Wellington-based improvisation troupe who use truth-based play to create compelling and satisfying narratives. This is spontaneous theatre that honours and entertains.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. description:
Pacific Peoples and the Underclass of Aotearoa New Zealand: Repositioning the Narrative, In 2018, over 380,000 people in Aotearoa New Zealand identified with at least one Pacific ethnicity. Despite being a youthful and growing community, Pacific peoples are statistically entrenched in a cycle of disadvantage that cannot be ignored.
In almost every measure—health, education, income, home ownership, and justice—Pacific people are overrepresented in poor outcomes.
We are not just facing a Pacific problem; we are looking at the face of New Zealand’s underclass—systemic, intergenerational, and largely invisible in mainstream policy conversations. Despite progress for some groups, the Pacific population remains on the wrong side of the statistical ledger.
Pacific peoples experience:
• The highest rates of avoidable hospitalisations and chronic conditions.
• Worst material deprivation across nearly every indicator.
• Persistently low home ownership rates.
• A widening education achievement gap, often masked by ethnic averages.
• Underrepresentation in decision-making, leadership, and governance roles.
While initiatives for Māori advancement are critical and must continue, Pacific peoples require their own distinct policy lens. A “one-size-fits-all” approach under a pan-ethnic umbrella risks making the Pacific experience invisible.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Writing Off The Map: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill | Writers on Mondays, Nina Mingya Powles calls Anna Jackson's Terrier, Worrier 'a remarkable and playful book on language, anxiety, poetry, and the strangeness of being a person'. Somewhere between a diary and a collection of poetic essays, it takes Jackson's work into previously uncharted territory.
Equally off the charts is film-maker, writer, and artist Rachel O'Neill's Symphony of Queer Errands, a delightfully riotous musical fantasia and an irreverent ode to queer joy.
Chris Price will pilot the conversation between these adventurous voyagers in unknown seas.

Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

In two hours have a go exploring the different veneers, get to know the chisels and knives, and create your own take home block (or coaster) having learnt the fundamentals to take it further.

Students must be 16 and above. Must be able to use small hand tools safely.

Daniel Champagne (Australia) LIVE at The Little Theatre | Lower Hutt (Matinee Concert), Presented by Nightingale Concerts...
The young virtuoso recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation” has spent the past few years selling out shows all over the globe and will be bringing his dynamite live act back to New Zealand in 2025 for a series of intimate regional concerts!
Seated show
Family friendly  
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s because live music is for everyone!
October 18, 2025 @ The Little Theatre, Lower Hut
Doors open from 2:30pm / show starts at 3:00pm (4:15pm finish) 
Tickets are VERY limited. DON'T miss your chance to see live music at it's finest!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY..
“The word Prodigy seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills, he coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
The Calgary Herald, CANADA

“Today I saw the future of Folk – Festival goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.” The Firefly Column, USA

“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads. Fusing the strong traditions of Blues, Folk and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.” The Indie Blender, CANADA

“reinventing roots guitar” Rhythms Magazine, AUSTRALIA“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once in a lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy that plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.” BW Review, NEW ZEALAND

description:
ration the Queen's veges, Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.
label: Arts & Theatre

After 5: Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay, What does the future hold for local businesses in Aotearoa - and how can you take advantage of the opportunities on your doorstep? Join us for a special After 5 at Bunnings Lyall Bay, where we’ll look at new ways to grow, train, and connect as a business community.

You’ll hear about the exciting potential of the 2026 New Zealand Trade Expo, designed to open doors for business investment and international partnerships. You’ll also learn how the MBIE Management Capability Development Voucher Programme can provide funding and support to build your business skills and capability.

From a local perspective, we’ll showcase how Bunnings partners with businesses, schools, and community organisations - and how Chamber members can unlock exclusive savings and benefits with the Bunnings Power Pass.

Popular suppliers including Ryobi, AEG, and Ozito will also be in-store to answer questions and share product advice, making this session a rare and practical opportunity to get info that gets you ahead.

Most importantly, this After 5 is a chance to network with fellow Chamber members in a fresh setting, and take away practical opportunities to strengthen and grow your business.

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. Louise Pirini - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. Peter Holmes - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. Dan Young - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. Andrew Webber - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!

description:
BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua, Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.

We’re continuing our series of one hour workshops targeted at those who want to learn a bit more about how their bike works and how to maintain & repair it to keep it running at its best.
This workshop is more general than some of our other more topic specific sessions. We will cover:
* Road Readiness. A front to back check for safety and performance
* Drivetrain tuning and maintenance
* Brake tuning and maintenance
* Tyres & Tubes. Pressures and repair.
Sunday, September 21st from 9:00am to 10:00am at the Bikespace workshop.
We'll spend most of the hour with interactive learning followed by time to work on individuals bicycles. To allow hands-on participation we are limiting the numbers to this workshop to 8 people and their bikes. Bikespace is a Wellington City Council initiative allowing us to offer all our services at no cost to participants.

description:
Boost Your Business: Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing - PART 2, Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing – Part 2

We’re back for Part Two of our popular “Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing” workshop and you’re invited! Whether you joined us last time or are coming along for the first time, this free, hands-on session is designed to help you feel confident and in control of your digital marketing.

Led by Katie Brown (Ngāti Whātua, Ngāti Raukawa), you’ll dive deeper into practical tools and strategies to make social media and digital marketing work for you. Expect a friendly, open environment where you can ask questions, share experiences, and learn alongside others. And yes, we’ll have refreshments and kai catered by Amilagi’s to keep you fuelled and inspired!

By the end of this session, you’ll walk away with real, usable tools to grow your online presence, simplify your marketing, and boost your confidence.

This workshop is part of the WLG NZ RPBN programme, where Katie’s full course supports your next steps in building a powerful digital presence.
Spaces are limited so book your spot today and take the next step in your digital journey!
**Doors open at 5.30pm, session begins at 6pm**

About the Speaker:
Katie Brown (Ngāti Whātua, Ngāti Raukawa) brings over 15+ years’ experience in social media, digital strategy, and communications. She’s the founder of Social Good and has held key roles in government and corporate spheres, including setting up ACC’s social media strategy and leading Aotearoa’s all-of-government digital communications response during COVID-19. Katie is also a certified Meta (Facebook) Community Trainer and regularly delivers workshops across Aotearoa, helping organisations to tell stronger digital stories.

description:
Behind the Scenes with VicASA: BDO Wellington, 🔥 Behind the Scenes with VicASA x BDO 🔥
Exams are coming - so why host events now?
Because your future doesn’t wait for finals.
Exams test your memory, but these events sharpen your career. While exams last weeks, the connections you’ll make at BDO last a lifetime.
Here’s the truth: top firms don’t just recruit; they provide support, advice, and insider tips to help you thrive as a student and future professional. These events aren’t distractions - they’re an investment in your success.
Therefore the VicASA exec made sure these events (just like the rest) are taking you beyond the lecture halls and giving you exclusive access inside the most influential firms in the accounting world. And yes, it’s all completely free.
Wednesday 24 September – BDO Open Office & LinkedIn Headshots from 2:30pm to 3:30pm! Arrive at 2:15pm to get the full experience!
Join us for an hour long experience to talk one-on-one with the most professional bodies from both the capital and international offices. And of course, 🍴 free food — because good conversations happen best over kai.
✨ What makes this event different from any other?
Most student events stop at surface-level networking. This goes further:
At BDO, you’ll step into an open-office tour led by BDO reps, chat one-on-one with professional buddies, and even get a professional LinkedIn headshot for free by selecting the "BDO - LinkedIn Headshot" option alongside your ticket (first in, first served!) to boost your personal brand.
⚡ Why you can’t miss this:
First-in, first-served — spaces are extremely limited
Genuine behind-the-scenes exposure you won’t find at standard info sessions
Practical takeaways: real answers, real connections, and a polished LinkedIn profile
💡 These are not your average student events. They’re designed to give you an authentic inside look at the top firms, preparing you for your next steps in a way that’s practical, personal, and powerful.

description:
Porirua, Porirua
Kristyl Neho's one-woman show, Tangihanga, is a drama-comedy that runs for 60 minutes. The story centers on Jess, a loving daughter whose father, Karanipa, has just passed away. The play unfolds at the Marae as Karanipa's family and friends gather to mourn his loss.
Neho takes on the challenge of playing over 30 characters, showcasing the complex dynamics and rising tensions that emerge during the tangi. As secrets are exposed and family members grapple with their grief, the play explores themes of family relationships, identity, cultural traditions, and the crucial role of community during times of loss

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.

Back to the Hillside: Underground alt-rock/grungegaze/post-punk band from Auckland. Started off making indie pop/rock songs, Back To The Hillside are now exploring other elements. Inspired by bands/artists like The Smashing Pumpkins, Team Sleep, The Smiths, Joy Division, Titlefight & Deftones.

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.

Customer Service Essentials, This course will cover the importance of creating a customer service mindset when dealing with your most important asset in a business, your customers. It introduces the key requirement to have a strong product knowledge, effective communication and listening skills, and polished customer service etiquette.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for employees who interact with customers on a regular basis, whether by phone or in person, and people who would like to gain a strong, foundational level of knowledge about how to deal effectively with customers.

Learning outcomes:
Understand the importance of a customer service mindset.
Learn about customer service etiquette and how it’s unique for each business.
Explain the requirement for a strong product and service knowledge.
Demonstrate the pivotal role of good communication and listening skills.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

description:
Digital experiences that truly matter, Note: This is a Hybrid Event:
In-Person Location: Level 1 , 107 Customhouse Quay, Wellington
Online: The Zoom link will be sent out the day before the event.
About this event:
About this event:

This highly interactive session will have engaging discussions that will uncover practical insights into creating user – focused, unified digital services that genuinely enhance customer experiences. We will discuss the complexities of web design and development, exploring them from a project delivery perspective, with a focus on building effective and impactful digital solutions.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:
 Pikselin: Pikselin is a New Zealand based consultancy and solution provider in the digital engagement and application development space. As a digital agency, they create user-focused digital experiences that are both functional and visually engaging. Pikselin delivers responsive websites, intuitive interfaces, and inclusive digital services for clients across government and private sector. Their expertise lies in simplifying complex information through thoughtful, user – centred design. As an approved supplier on New Zealand’s Government Marketplace, they have led key projects for a range of clients across the public and enterprise sectors. Pikselin is known for its collaborative approach and commitment to elevating digital experiences that truly serve New Zealanders. 

Steve Barnard Managing Director Steve leads client and partner collaborations at Pikselin, overseeing projects from marketing to post-development support with over 30 years of experience in New Zealand's IT industry.

James Guthrie Tech Lead James transforms complex design requirements into maintainable accessible code specializing in real-time data visualization interactive mapping, and fully accessible cross device websites.

description:
Electra Business After Five - 21 August 2025, We're delighted to welcome Jerry Shearman from Central Economic Development Agency (CEDA) which connects people, place and business in Manawatū. 
 
Jerry, a former scientist with a passion for data and insights, believes strongly in evidence-based decision-making.  With over 15 years’ experience in senior leadership roles within the tertiary education sector, Jerry brings a wealth of expertise in strategic thinking, stakeholder engagement, and turning vision into action, as evidenced by some of the exciting things happening in the area which Jerry will share with us. 
 
Join us for an evening of insight and inspiration and hear one of the region’s most dedicated leaders talk about: 
Te Utanganui - designed to be New Zealand's third major distribution hub, complementing the Golden Triangle (Auckland-Hamilton-Tauranga) and the Christchurch-Rolleston node. Te Utanganui is a transformative multi-modal logistics and distribution hub located in Palmerston North, it serves as a vital link in the national freight network currently going through transformational changes connecting road, rail, air, and sea transport systems. 
Manawatū Regional Food Strategy, our Land Diversification initiative and the complementary capability between regions
Regional NZ - the need to work together, shared populations, future growth plans
Electra Business After Five
Thursday 21st August 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf
Te Takeretanga o Kura-hau-pō, Levin

description:
Āhuru Kai Kōhua Poaka: Burger Wellington, The boil-up is a dish of love, traditionally made in big pots for whānau and friends. It brings people together. Te Papa wanted to capture the essence of this traditional Māori kai and give it a gourmet twist.

Traditional boil-up pork roulade, with Pagro lettuce and tomato, puha mousseline, and horopito aioli in a toasted Brezelmania watercress milk bun, with hand-cut kūmara fries, mānuka honey aioli, a shot of bone broth, and a heart-shaped raspberry framboise dessert.

Join us at the Te Papa Cafe on Level 1, walk-ins welcome. Reserve your spot by booking now.

Please note we aren’t able to accommodate dietary requirements.

description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington, Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington
Register Today by contacting Crown Leadership International Group: Website: www.crownleadership.com.au Phone: +64 9 889 7217

About this Event

Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

description:
TENZ Conference 2025, TENZ Conference 2025
TENZ invites you to our 2025 Conference - Inspiring Ākonga Empowering Kaiako, to be held at Wellington East Girls' College, 131 Austin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011.

The conference is designed for teachers and researchers at all levels of technology education and will provide opportunities to connect with, and learn from, other members of the community as well as get up to date with new products, tools and opportunities that support students’ learning in technology.

Register here: https://tenz.org.nz/2025-conference/

With over 50 sessions spanning the full spectrum of technology education - from food, textiles, DVC, and STEAM to digital, vocational, and emerging tech - there’s something for every kaiako, at every level. Dive into workshops on AI, AR, and rockets; explore neuro inclusion, culturally sustaining practice, and curriculum integration; get practical with tools like Minecraft, WorldPainter, and Brisk; or collaborate on pathways, assessment, and cross-curricular design thinking. Whether you're refining your NCEA practice, reigniting creativity, or discovering new ways to inspire ākonga, these sessions are designed to spark ideas, deepen confidence, and empower you to lead change in your classroom and community. This is your chance to connect, create, and be part of shaping the future of technology education in Aotearoa.

Join us for a complimentary seminar designed for business owners and sole traders who want clarity around the real role of trusts in today’s environment.
We’ll cover:
Recent tax and legal changes impacting trusts
Rising compliance costs (lawyers, accountants, admin)
Common hassles in day-to-day trust operations
Where the tax benefits really lie—and where they don’t
Succession and wealth planning essentials
Asset protection pros and cons
Smarter alternatives for managing business and family wealth
While this seminar focuses on existing trusts, it’s also valuable for those considering establishing one in the future.

DATE: Saturday Sept 27
TIME: 2-3pm
LOCATION: Greytown Art Gallery
AGES: 8-12 years
COST: $35 (all materials provided)

Children’s “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland – 60 minutes of fun and focused creativity for children aged 8 – 12 years. Immerse your child in a world of colour and creativity with the Under the Sea collage workshop, led by experienced educator Linda Kirkland. Drawing inspiration from the bold, large-scale collages of Henri Matisse—who famously described his technique as painting with scissors—Linda will guide the children through an exciting exploration of shape, colour, and composition. Her engaging teaching style will inspire the young artists to create vibrant and unique masterpieces that bring the underwater world to life.

This workshop has limited space.
Please register here: https://greytownarttown.com/childrens-matisse-collage-workshop-with-linda-kirkland/

description:
Iron, Iron
By Rona Munro
Directed by Campbell Wright
27th August - 8th September
The Gryphon Theatre
Iron follows the rekindling of a relationship between Josie and her estranged mother Fay who is currently serving a life sentence for killing Josie's father. Josie seeks to understand the events that she barely has any memory of, while Fay attempts to live life vicariously through her. As the play develops, we discover how incarceration has affected all of the parties involved, including the prison guards.

Josie - Ivana Palezevic
Guard 1 - James Bayliss
Guard 2 - Helen Mackenzie-Hughes

description:
Export Ready: Strategies and Lessons for International Growth, Whether you're exploring new markets, refining your export strategy, or preparing to scale globally, this practical workshop will equip you with the tools, insights, and confidence to take your business international
What’s in store
Join export expert Pete Torrington for an interactive, 2.5-hour workshop designed specifically for local producers and manufacturers. Drawing on over 30 years of global experience, Pete will guide you through the essential steps to becoming export ready.
You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls
Choose the right international markets for your product
Build effective distribution and retail strategies
Navigate food safety, packaging, and compliance requirements
Price and promote your product for global shelves
Whether you're just starting your export journey or want to sharpen your approach, this workshop offers real-world advice and actionable strategies to help you succeed.
Who should attend
Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers
Agribusinesses and primary sector entrepreneurs
Anyone considering export as a growth strategy
About the Facilitator
Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. He now works with New Zealand manufacturers and producers to help them grow in overseas markets.
More information: www.askpete.co.nz
Agenda
Tuesday, 7 October 2025 | 9:00 – 11:30 am | Focal Point Cinema, 223 Cuba Street, Palmerston North
Registration & Morning Tea
Workshop Session
Q&A and Networking
Cost
ExportNZ / Business Central/ Manawatū Chamber Member: $59 +gst
Non-Member: $89 +gst
Spaces are limited – secure your spot today and start your export journey with confidence.
Register Now!

description:
Foundations of Leadership - Core, This course will teach you how to build an effective team. It covers the tools that are required to confidently lead, plan, delegate, and manage the workload of your team. You will also learn about your leadership style and how to motivate your team members to achieve targets and perform well overall.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who are new to team leadership and would like a quick, concise overview to start their leadership career. This one-day course would also suit team leaders who are keen to learn more about how to manage a team and get the best out of it.

Learning outcomes:
Understand how your leadership style affects your team. 
Discover communication techniques that help to build connection with your team. 
Learn how to make smart decisions and solve problems efficiently. 
Identify common sources of team conflict and ways to resolve it. 
Use strategies to create a team environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. 

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Time: 9am -4pm

Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea.

Places are limited, so register today.

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.

Intro to Product & UX Design, Good design is more than making things “look nice” — it’s about solving problems and creating experiences people love.
Join us for an hands-on workshop where you’ll learn the basics of Product & UX Design, get experience with practical tools, and see how design thinking can transform everyday services and products.
👥 Who’s it for?
Startups, small business owners, and professionals curious about UX.
Students keen to break into the design world (free tickets available).
Anyone who’s struggled with bad digital or service experiences and wants to know how to fix them.
📚 What you’ll get:
A crash course in UX & product design.
Fun group activities to redesign common real-world experiences.
A peek behind the scenes at how design improves outcomes.
Networking with other professionals and students.
🎯 Why come?

description:
The Rocky Horror Show, Dust off your corset, strap on your heels, and get ready to Time Warp like it’s 1973. After a 15-year hiatus, The Rocky Horror Show is back. The musical, written 50 years ago by New Zealand national treasure Richard O’Brien, stars a phenomenal West End cast. This high-energy stage spectacular features all the catchy songs you know and love: Sweet Transvestite, Dammit Janet, and the pelvic-thrusting, showstopper Time Warp. 
The show follows two squeaky-clean college kids, Brad and Janet. The couple find themselves stranded outside a mysterious mansion. Inside awaits the fabulous and flamboyant Dr Frank’n’Furter, and a wild adventure full of fun, frolics, frocks, and frivolity. 
The Rocky Horror Show is the longest continuously running contemporary musical in the world. It has thrilled over 35 million theatregoers, been staged in 30 countries, and translated into 20 languages. Get dressed up, let loose, and be your fabulous self at the biggest glitter-soaked party in town.

description:
Learn how to build a Unicorn with Mahesh Muralidhar!, Join us as Mahesh Muralidhar shares his insights on 'How to build a Unicorn'. Hear stories from his Canva days and the journey he has had with the Phase One founders - Kiki, NextWork, Ivo, and Kiwifibre.
Mahesh has been a founder, was part of the early leadership team at Canva and has held senior roles in a variety of major startups. He came back home a few years ago and nurtured the Phase One founder community, with 80% of the portfolio backed by institutional venture capital.

description:
Leadership and Management Part 3, Leaders today are expected to be the driving force of their teams. They are constantly under pressure to lead effectively in a business environment that is characterised by constant change. Our leadership and management courses offer participants the opportunity to develop the necessary skills to embrace this challenge and lead their teams through these times with confidence and pride.

Our Leadership & Management - Part 3 workshop is a practical skills training course designed for people already in a leadership/management position, or those about to take up a new role, who want to explore the latest thinking and models for effective management and leadership and build on the techniques acquired in our Part 1 and 2 workshops.

In today’s world, emotional Intelligence is a critical and powerful component of effective leadership. This 2-day course will equip leaders with the skills to become more ‘people smart’ by developing ways to lead with emotional intelligence. Participants will also learn how to inspire their people with a shared vision and align teams to company goals, along with the tools to lead and manage change, ways to become a more influential and persuasive leader and the tools to raise awareness and manage unconscious bias in the workplace.

To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790

description:
Medical Astrology Workshop - Your Blueprint for Health, Medical Astrology Workshop - Your Blueprint for Health
Your chart’s not just about your personality, t’s your health manual.

Sick of vague health advice that doesn’t feel like you? Your body has its own energetic blueprint, and astrology can help you read it.

In this unique one-day event, I’ll show you how to connect your birth chart, chakras, and planetary patterns to real-life health insights. We’ll talk about what causes energetic imbalances, how the planets influence your body systems, and what astrology can tell you about the timing of illness, fertility, even surgery.
This is ancient science + modern health insight, with practical tools you’ll actually use.

🗓️ 5th October 2025 at the Newton Community Centre, Colombo Street and Rintoul Street, Newton, Wellington. 10.30 - 3pm - for more info and to register please email me

description:
Managing for value: building a strong financial advice business-Wellington, Building a valuable financial advice business means you have a resilient business to support your clients and a strong asset. Transactions – acquisition and disposal support the long-term growth and sustainability of financial advice provider businesses. Transactions take many forms, going concerns regularly acquire and dispose of clients, business units, lines of business, have investors buy-in, bring key staff together – and split businesses up. Only a small number of our transactions are the classic market exit.
Our aim is to spend time talking with advisers about how to grow their business and manage for value – making their business more valuable by explicitly thinking about valuation in addition to the other metrics such as profit and cashflow.

description:
Jonathan Kay - Massey University Lecturer/Master of Fine Arts Coordinator, Jonathan Kay is a photographic artist, researcher, and lecturer based at Massey University in Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington. His work explores the intersection of art and science, using photography to reveal the unseen and challenge conventional notions of landscape. Over the past seven years, his research has focused on developing a site-specific and responsive approach to photographic interventions within the landscape.
Drawing inspiration from scientific 'fieldwork,' Kay’s practice involves close observation and data collection, using these methods to uncover new insights into specific environments. However, his approach extends beyond the typical scientific framework by leveraging the unique possibilities of the photographic medium. This process enables him to move beyond the traditional, idealized representation of landscapes, offering deeper, more complex interpretations.
September 25, Tararua Tramping Club (4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria), Doors Open at 7pm
If you’re curious about the Wellington Photographic Society, you’re welcome to attend two meetings for free before deciding whether to join. It’s a great way to meet the community and see what we’re all about!
https://wps.wps.org.nz/

description:
NZ Make Tomorrow Chapter Summit, 𝗡𝗭 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁
The Educate Plus NZ Chapter is thrilled to invite you to our 2025 Summit taking place on Tuesday 19 & Wednesday 20 August at Victoria University of Wellington for the 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁. This professional development opportunity will bring together Advancement Practitioners from across New Zealand, in Tertiary Institutions and Schools, all dedicated to shaping the future together.
The Summit, with sessions in Admissions, Alumni & Community Relations, Fundraising, Marketing & Communications, Leadership and People & Culture, will be more than just a learning experience—it will also be an opportunity to connect, collaborate, and share insights with professionals who, like you, are passionate about building a better tomorrow.
Through these engaging sessions, meaningful conversations, and shared ideas, you’ll gain the tools and inspiration to create the future you envision, supported by the collective wisdom and energy of the New Zealand Chapter community.
Don’t miss this opportunity … Let’s Make Tomorrow —together.

description:
NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting 2025, Join us at the NAWIC Wellington Annual Regional Meeting to show your support and share your ideas.
The current NAWIC Wellington Committee excited to welcome members to attend the Annual Regional Meeting (ARM) where we come together as a chapter to reflect on our achievements, discuss ongoing projects, and plan for the future. This meeting is a fantastic opportunity to connect with fellow members, share insights, and contribute to the growth and success of our organisation.
Along with the formalities we will review the past 12 months and look forward to the year ahead. We want to hear your feedback and discuss how you can contribute to the success of our organisation.
We are keen to hear from you if you:
Have an interest in joining the Committee
Have ideas for inspirational speakers or other types of events
Can offer access for site visits and/or venues for our events
Can give your time to represent NAWIC to speak at schools/career days
If you are unable to attend but interested in providing your feedback, you can contact us at rsvpwgtn@nawic.org.nz
DATE & TIME: 5:30pm, Tuesday 7 October
VENUE: TBIG, Level 13, 215 Lambton Quay
REGISTRATIONS: NAWIC members only, who can attend in person or online. Registration required.  Anyone is welcome to join NAWIC here
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
Something Something Club Presents: The Darlings, Raffla and B-TELLO, Something Something Club Presents: Live music event featuring three acts:

RAFFLA
Raffla brings bass heavy skanks, groovy rhythms and infectious vibrations, causing a recent spread of the swamp across Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Their genre-less sound draws heavily from influences of reggae and dub, with fast paced skanks of ska, and groovy rhythms of dance music.

THE DARLINGS
Female-led five-piece band The Darlings bring the “fun music” back to Wellington with their wild mix of rock, funk, and R&B. Listen out for reckless genre-bending and theatrical performances that keep the energy high, and the boredom low.

B-TELLO
An upcoming DJ based in Pōneke (Wellington), NZ. He takes the sonic reigns and throws down tasty Garage dubs, Hardgroove heaters accompanied by old school Breaks, Dub and Techno to keep the dancefloor moving. B-TELLO specialises in dance rhythms from 120 to 160 bpm.

description:
Newtown Festival 2026, Rātapu, Tuawaru o Poutū-te-rangi
Waiata | Kai | Ahurea | Mahi Toi
Aotearoa’s biggest and best free music festival and street fair returns for its 32nd year! A shining calendar highlight, Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most colourful suburb invites everyone to come along to their favourite street party. From dawn to dusk, the streets are packed with people of all ages, stages, backgrounds, cultures, locals, visitors, whānau and friends. The beloved Newtown Festival brings you more than 420 stalls, 200 artists, 1000 performers, 16 stages, and heaps of activities for the whole whānau. Join us in a celebration with a mass concentration and extravaganza of local cultural identity, creative expression, and a day of community togetherness and joy.

description:
Pastor From Gaza, St John’s is collaborating with Central Baptist to host this Pastor from Gaza, as he shares about being the Church amidst conflict.
Born and raised in Gaza, he now ministers across the Gaza and Middle East, providing pastoral support and practical aid to persecuted Christians, refugees, orphans, and widows.
This tour is not political—it is about the Body of Christ. The Pastor will share his own testimony, speak to the ongoing challenges faced by Christians in Gaza, and highlight his wider ministry in the Middle East. It is a message of hope, forgiveness, and perseverance—one that will challenge the Church in Aotearoa.
This event is to raise awareness of the spiritual and practical needs of believers in Gaza and the Middle East, as well as invite us to give in support of his ministry, with funds going directly to help persecuted Christians with food, shelter, and outreach.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Omnia, Two nights. One reprogrammed theatre.

Omnia is a two-night techno rave held inside the Hannah Playhouse: a full venue takeover featuring live DJs, theatrical lighting and design, and unexpected performances throughout the night.

Each night offers a different experience, with immersive elements, costumed characters, dancers woven into the space, and a different DJ lineup.

With two bars, a multi-level layout, and a balcony overlooking the chaos, the theatre becomes a reprogrammed nightclub built for the industrial age.

This is Omnia.

Enter if it calls you.

Doors open at 9PM.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy, ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy
Join us at Fringe Bar for ALTAR, a spellbinding drag ritual honouring the turn of the seasons. As day and night stand in perfect balance, witness an evening of witchcraft, blasphemy, mythology, and queer magic brought to life by a fierce coven of drag kings, queens, monsters, and cryptids.

This equinox, we invoke the primal, the divine, and the forbidden. Expect offerings to old gods, sacrificial glamour, and performances steeped in folklore, resistance and radical ritual. ALTAR is a celebration of queer power, transgressive beauty, and the defiance of a world that seeks to burn us at the stake.

With Performances By:
Robin Yablind
Rover Stimulation
Misty Frequency
Darryl Parton
Rocky Rhodes
MANNNTIS
Judas Kiss
Aracella
Cailiah the Banshee

Come ready to worship. Come ready to sin.
Bring your rage, your devotion, your offerings, and lay them down at the ALTAR!

Doors open 7.30pm
Show starts 8pm
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Best Practice Guidelines Workshop - Porirua, This interactive session will help you effectively manage volunteers at your organisation. The Volunteer Best Practice Guidelines provide a framework to consider and review your own practice, and learn from others.
The session includes insights into managing challenging behaviour and problem solving, and is aimed at novices right through to experts in volunteer management.
We will explore the practice areas:
Recruiting and engaging volunteers
Welcoming and onboarding volunteers
Volunteer support, leadership, and management
Train and grow volunteers
Feedback and recognition
Celebrate volunteer impact
Exiting Volunteers
We will be learning from everyone in the room, including you!
The workshop will be based on the Volunteering New Zealand's 'Best Practice Guidelines.' You can access these on our website here.
We will provide you morning tea and a light lunch. You'll be asked your dietary requirements when you register.
Registration is from 9:15am. Entry to venue from Pātaka Art + Museum.
What previous attendees have said:
"I just wanted to say thank you for the opportunity to attend that workshop. It was lovely talking to other people in the charity sector which I haven’t had the chance to do yet. Great discussions and ideas."
"I am very much enjoying your workshops, and have implemented some of the learnings already."

About your facilitator:
Alison Marshall is about helping others build capability through learning and development.
Ali has over 25 years’ experience in learning and development at a senior level. She has worked in a broad range of industries that includes oil and gas, professional services, retail, education and hospitality. She has worked for large global organisations, start-ups and government. Her talent is being able to build relationships across all levels of the organisation.
Alison Marshall

description:
Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille, Kia ora e te whānau EHF,
You're invited to a very special evening!
Join us on Wednesday 27 August at 5:30pm for a heart-filled poroporoaki, a chance to celebrate Rosalie Nelson, and to officially welcome our new Co-Executive Directors, Elizabeth McNaughton and Shaquille Shortland.
📍 Te Wharewaka Function Centre, Wellington
🕔 Doors open at 5:00pm | Welcome begins at 5:30pm sharp
🕢 Event concludes by 7:30pm
👔 Dress: Business casual
To RSVP (button)
To register to join online (button)
This will be a joyful evening of reflection, reconnection and looking ahead. Whether you're joining us in person or online, we’d love to have you in the room (or on the screen!) as we mark this milestone in the life of the Fellowship. You are also welcome to bring your partner.
In te ao Māori, a poroporoaki is more than a farewell; it's a ritual of transition and gratitude. A moment to steady the waka, acknowledge the hands that have guided it, and prepare together for the voyage ahead.
We’ll honour Rosalie’s contribution, and we’ll raise a glass to Elizabeth and Shaquille as they step into their new roles. Expect warmth, good company, big-hearted kōrero and a few surprises too.
If you're planning to attend in person and haven’t yet booked travel, now’s a good time to do so.

Ngā manaakitanga,
The EHF Board

description:
Resilient Leadership, Resilient Leadership
Wellington Chamber of Commerce and JacksonStone & Partners present: Future Fluent: Navigate What’s Next – A New Series

About this Event

Resilient Leadership
Real talk on leading well without losing your spark
Leadership shouldn’t come at the cost of your wellbeing. Yet too often, high performance is confused with running on empty.

Why be part of this session?
We’ll cut through the clichés and have a real conversation about resilience, balance, and what it takes to sustain yourself - and your team - over the long haul. Walk away with practical strategies to embed wellbeing into daily work, recharge team culture, and lead in a way that keeps your spark alive.
Because the best leaders don’t just survive pressure - they model how to thrive through it.

This event is part of a new 3-part series: Future Fluent - Navigate What’s Next.
A practical, thought-provoking speaker series for professionals who want to stay ahead - not just keep up.

Who’s the speaker?
Jude West, Team & Clinical Lead from EAP Services/Habit Health

What’s in-store:
11:00am – Arrival/networking
11:30am-12:15pm – Speaker session
12:15-12:30pm – Q&A
12:30-1:00pm – Networking with light snacks

This series is brought to you by event partner - one of the most experienced executive search, recruitment and contracting agencies in New Zealand.

Attend other events in the series:
15 October: - What’s next for the world of work in Aotearoa New Zealand?
25 November: - Leading across generations with clarity and connection

description:
NZAC Wellington: Three Terrific Talks, This section night we're delighted to host four of our wonderful club members to share three talks on their respective adventures this alpine season.

Talk one: Cumulonimbus Corner by James Sales
James tells us about his trip up the Cumulonimbus corner on the South Face of Girdlestone, a tricky ascent requiring skills in rock and ice climbing!
Talk two: Taranaki East Ridge by Jon Keyzer
A group trip whittled down to two. Jon tells us about the mission up Taranaki's infamous East Ridge, the decision to keep going and the challenging conditions at the top.
Talk three: Angelus Hut - Leon Lim & Jim
Leon and Jim tell us about their adventure to Angelus Hut just last weekend! A trip down south and three days in the stunning Nelson Lakes area.

Join us for these exciting talks and our usual section night pizzas
We look forward to seeing you there!

Heat pump water heaters –
Benefits, current range, installation, service and warranty

installation and warranty requirements

description:
Startup World Cup New Zealand Final, Startup World Cup New Zealand Final
For the first time ever, Kāpiti will host the Startup World Cup New Zealand Final, powered by Pegasus Tech Ventures – the world’s largest startup pitch competition.

Startups from across the motu will go head-to-head in front of a live audience and expert judging panel at the beautiful Te Raukura ki Kāpiti. The winner will receive flights and support to pitch on the global stage in Silicon Valley on 17 October 2025, competing for a USD $1 million investment prize.

This inaugural event is more than a pitch night – it’s a high-energy celebration of New Zealand’s creativity, capability, and ambition. Expect standout founder pitches, insight from leading judges, and a vibrant crowd of innovators, investors, and changemakers.

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email or call 049740535 during office hours.

description:
Stage 2 Health and Safety Representatives, The purpose of this two-day course is to extend the skill level of H&S Representatives. Stage 2 training focuses on specific risk and hazard identification and controls, approved Codes of Practice and using accident data to identify trends and develop preventative actions across the core elements of your workplace H&S system.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who have completed the Stage 1 course and are interested in taking their skills to the next level. It would also be useful for anyone who would like to know about the requirements for the role or who have employees in these positions.

Learning outcomes
Identify and report on links to productivity due to improved health and safety practices.
Determine injury causal factors from incident reports and notifiable events.
Provide detailed feedback to H&S Committee meetings for further action.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details
Duration: two full days, in person.
Time: 9am-4pm
NZQA Unit Standard: 17593 ( Assessment costs additional)


To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
Omaka Wings & Wheels 28th Sept, Daylight Savings is coming, and so is the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre's Wings & Wheels Open Day! Make sure to mark Sunday, 28th September, 2025, on your calendar to spring forward into an amazing day of aircraft and classic cars!

We have a spectacular lineup of aircraft planned from throughout history, and joy flights will be available. Re-hydrate and refuel at the Omaka Cafe and guest food outlets. Bring your picnic rugs and deck chairs, and make yourself comfortable because you won't want to leave!

And don't forget to take the opportunity to visit the two remarkable exhibitions at the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre. Entry to both is included in your Omaka Wings & Wheels ticket. For value for money, it doesn't get any better than this!
** There will be gate sales on the day. However, we highly recommend that you pre-purchase tickets online for the best price and quickest check-in experience. **

Info about the teacher:

Guinean percussionist Sibo Bangoura grew up in Matam – the heart of Conakry’s arts precinct – surrounded by a family of griots. His mother was a singer and his father abalafon player. Sibo absorbed the rhythm from his infancy and began to study percussion formally at the age of 12. At 14, he joined Boka Junior ensemble and then played with Ballet Matam for many years, until he moved to Australia.

Sibo currently resides in Sydney and travels to China, Japan, Singapore and Thailand to teach and perform. He plays with his brothers Mohamed and Epizo Bangoura and has a successful 8-piece band Keyim Ba

If you have ANY questions please feel free to get in touch with Bridget xo
