description:
Seen The Film - Wellington, NZ. A Fundraiser for Te Aro School., We live in an age where, as parents and caregivers, there is more information than ever before. How much screen time is the right amount of screen time for our children? How best can we manage our children's daily meltdowns? Time in, time out, clear boundaries, feel all the feelings - what's best? We are hearing more and more reactive advice on how best to manage our children, yet we are missing the root cause and solution.
SEEN is a groundbreaking feature-length documentary that not only explores the transformative power of personal healing for parents, but also delves into the scientifically supported effects of such healing on parenting and its impact on child brain development.
movie trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZPQXpw6kT0
movie website with all the beautiful info: https://seenthefilm.com/
https://www.eventbrite.com.au/.../seen-the-film...
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”

description:
Terror-Fi Presents: THE LONG WALK (NZ Premiere - Wellington), How far could you go? Be the first in New Zealand see the stunning new dystopian thriller/horror THE LONG WALK – from the mind of Stephen King.
“A group of teenage boys compete in an annual contest known as The Long Walk, and keep walking faster than three miles per hour — or risk being shot.”
Early reviews back up claims that this intense and emotional exploration of boyhood is one of the most powerful Stephen King adaptations ever made – one that will stay with you long after you leave the cinema.
Based on King’s 1979 novel, the film is co-written by JT Mollner (‘Strange Darling’) and directed by Francis Lawrence (‘Constantine’, ‘The Hunger Games’ franchise) – features a sensational young cast alongside living legend Mark Hamill as our sinister antagonist.
Come to the cinema early to enjoy our themed lobby and custom pre-show… and don’t forget to drink plenty of water beforehand
Directed by Francis Lawrence, THE LONG WALK stars Cooper Hoffman (‘Licorice Pizza’, ’Saturday Night’), David Johnson (‘Alien: Romulus’), Garrett Wareing (‘Dead Sea’), Judy Greer (‘Halloween’), and Mark Hamill (‘Star Wars’).
Huge thanks to the team at StudioCanal NZ for this exclusive.

description:
Family Watercolour Art Class - Grey Day at Petone Wharf, In this class all the family can share 2 hours of creative fun together and grown ups can join in for youth price of $25. All materials supplied including quality watercolour paper, just arrive empty handed and two hours they will have a completed painting. No previous art experience is required as these workshops are suitable for both beginners and artists who’d like to fine tune their skills and style a little further. Don’t worry about drawing as this will be done so we can focus on the joys of watercolour painting. A step-by step teaching style is used and this all happens in a wonderful, relaxed and enjoyable classroom overlooking the harbour.

Check out other classes, each has a different subject to choose from, Also available are Saturday family art classes as well as Wine & Watercolour evenings on Friday and Saturday evenings.

description:
The Doctor's Wife Screening, This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information about The Doctor's Wife, screening on the 4th of September can be found at https://whitioraproductions.com/the-doctors-wife.
label: Film & Media

description:
The Lot Fundraiser Pub Quiz, Join us for a fun night of trivia and drinks at The Lot fundraiser Pub Quiz - let's raise some money together!

We are a bunch of Maessey University students and we need you help to fund our third year student film The Lot.

The film follows Riley and her boyfriend Jay, as they attempt to purchase snacks for a party. However, their arrogance and lack of communication turns a simple task into the unraveling of their relationship.
The film is a comical narrative that pokes fun at miscommunication and microaggression, and ends (literally) in a big mess. I hope audiences are able to share a laugh and see a bit of themselves in the characters: whether it’s the cashier who’s just trying to make it through his shift, or the partner who’s completely had it with their relationship.
label: Film & Media

description:
Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington, Hi queer friends who love crafts-have I got the film for you! NZ feature film Went Up The Hill will have its Wellington Premiere at the NZ International Film Festival on 21 August at the Embassy at 830pm-get your ticket now!
Come along and be amongst the first to see NZ feature film Went Up The Hill from queer NZ filmmaker Sam Van Grinsven.
Tickets to the Wellington screening are available for $26 at the NZIFF website:
https://www.nziff.co.nz/.../te.../went-up-the-hill/
The film is also screening at NZIFF in centres around the country including Auckland, Christchurch, Dunedin amongst others!
Shot in Canterbury and funded by the NZ Film Commission, the film stars Vicky Krieps (The Phantom Thread) and Dacre Montgomery (Stranger Things) in a poetic ghost story that centres on two queer characters-a woman and her dead wife’s estranged son -as they are each haunted by her spirit. The film premiered to critical acclaim as a Special Presentation at Toronto Film Festival in 2024 where Sam was hailed by Hollywood Reporter as already having the ‘control of a master’ in a film that is ‘captivating', ‘elliptical' and 'technically stunning’.
Sam Van Grinsven has a passion for queer interpretation of genre and seeing queer characters within spaces that historically have not been explored as diversely.
Here's the trailer link-we hope you can join us!
label: Film & Media

description:
Book Group: The Prophet by Kahlil Gibran, Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Group we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. The group has been running for more than a decade and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers that come along for particular books or simply when it suits. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

Our November book, and first work of poetry, is Kahlil Gibran's The Prophet (1923). Born in Lebanon in 1883 and later emigrating to the United States, Kahlil Gibran bridged East and West. His writings, poetry and art explore themes of love, spirituality and humanity.

The Prophet, his classic work of prose poetry, has been translated into more than 100 languages and is one of the best-selling books of all time. It has never gone out of print.

Project Gutenberg link for those e-reading:
https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/58585

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

description:
Top of the South Film Festival Red Carpet Screening & Awards Night, Top of the South Film Festival Red Carpet Screening & Awards Night
The Top of the South Film Festival (TSFF) returns for it's 11th annual edition. With three days of celebratory events throughout Nelson & Marlborough, this is a chance to walk the red carpet, share food and drinks, and mingle with the celebrities before premiering the 2025 selection of the best short films created both in the Top of the South region and throughout the rest of the country. From thrillers and dramas to westerns, animated comedies and documentaries—this year’s screenings contain entertainment for all.

SUNDAY 19 OCTOBER
10:30am-12:30pm - Bus Tour: Join locations manager & scout Dylan Poihipi in a tour around Marlborough as we discuss the art & technicalities of locations for film. Departing from ASB Theatre Marlborough.
2-3:45pm - Regional Screening: a curated collection of short films produced within the Top of the South region. The Anderson, ASB Theatre Marlborough.
5:30pm - Red Carpet screening & awards night. Doors open at 5:30pm with canapes in the foyer, followed by a curated collection of national and local short films at 6:30pm. The presentation of awards begins at 8:30pm. The Anderson, ASB Theatre Marlborough.

All festival proceeds are donated to the Top of the South Film Production Society, which provides financial support to its members who pursue the art of filmmaking in our Top of the South region.

Last time we met we celebrated completing all of Season 1 together.

I am excited to announce we are now going to watch Season 2! Starting off with the special double length "Episode 8: May the Giant Be With You". Written by Mark Frost, David Lynch and directed by David Lynch. Followed by "Episode 9:Coma". Directed by David Lynch.

This is what we will be watching :

-Episode 8: "May the Giant Be With You" (93mins)

-Intermission

With all Log Lady Intros!

WHERE: The mini cinema in Te Auaha. 65 Dixon St. Te Aro.

(Take the lift or stairs to Level 1 and turn left.)
The mini cinema's specs: 4K projection, Screen size 4450mm x 2500mm, Aspect ratio 16:9 with 7.1 surround sound.

Here is a link to Te Auaha's cinema so you know what to expect.

WHEN: Meet at 10:30am on Saturday 6th Sept. 2025. in the Bar area. The bar will be closed but you are welcome to bring your own snacks/drink.

Chat with other Twin peakies and the show will start on the dot at 11:00am

COST: Tickets are $10 per person

Tickets will be capped/limited so that everyone can have a decent seat. Every single screening so far has sold out well in advance, so grab those tickets ASAP and don't miss out on experiencing the epic start to Season 2 in a room full of your people that love Twin Peaks!


RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales, so DO purchase it beforehand please.

Thank you! And hope to see you there.

description:
Twisted Rings for Spring, Craft an elegant twisted silver ring from solid silver! Learn to soften and twist wire to create the twist you want, then how to form it up into a ring that fits you. Learn to use the jeweller's torch to solder then clean up and polish the ring to a beautiful finish.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

An excellent, fun class if you have already taken one of our Stacking Rings or Textured Earrings classes and fancy adding to your jewellery collection.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, sterling silver bar to create your twist ring and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Twilight, Details
Directed by Catherine Hardwicke
Starring Anna Kendrick, Robert Pattinson, Kristen Stewart, Billy Burke, Taylor Lautner
Step back into the world of vampires and werewolves, celebrating Bella's birthday on September the 13th we're bringing Twilight back on cinemas. To revive this love triangle debate, what would you be sipping? 'Team Edward' and 'Team Jacob' cocktails available to pre-order with your tickets. Can't decide? We'll have enough to upgrade you that night.

--- High-school student Bella Swan, always a bit of a misfit, doesn't expect life to change much when she moves from sunny Arizona to rainy Washington state. Then she meets Edward Cullen, a handsome but mysterious teen whose eyes seem to peer directly into her soul. Edward is a vampire whose family does not drink blood, and Bella, far from being frightened, enters into a dangerous romance with her immortal soulmate. ---

description:
The World of Nelsito, Movie Spotlight
The World of Nelsito / El Mundo de Nelsito
Country: Cuba
Genre: Drama
Audio: Spanish
Subtitles: English
Synopsis: Dramatic comedy that introduces us to Nelsito, a 16-year-old autistic boy. After running away from home, he is the victim of a car accident. From his stretcher and through his imaginary pen, Nelsito reveals the dark and hidden side of all those he lives with and those around him: perverse children, murderous women, adorable swindling girls… Now recovered, Nelsito returns home. There we will meet those same characters, now simple neighbours, real, everyday people, but which are the real ones, those common mortals or the ones he has imagined?
Rated: M - Suitable for mature audineces 16 years and over.
Note: Violence, sexual violence & offensive language.
Free Entry | RSVP required |

description:
One Bedroom Available In Super Friendly Definitely Not Scary Flat, Room Available – Viewings This Week Only!

Step inside. Swallow your fate. Hope the lights stay on.

You’re invited to a flat viewing unlike any other, one that takes you deep into the haunting heart of Aotearoa’s rental crisis. In this fully immersive, site-specific theatre experience, BATS Theatre becomes the flat, and you - the hopeful viewer - are here to secure a room.

But something isn’t right. The tenants are strange. The landlord is unseen but all-powerful. And there’s a bowl of jellybeans by the door...

As you are guided through a tour of the building, you'll discover a world where landlords hold supernatural control, and tenants find themselves trapped in a never-ending cycle of rent, sacrifice, and submission.

Darkly funny, chillingly dystopian, and disturbingly familiar, this intimate experience blurs the line between theatre and real estate.

Book your “viewing” now, spaces are very limited. Also, be warned - once you enter, the flat might never let you leave.

“The viewing is anything but boring.” - Brie Keatley - Art Murmurs
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Upper Hutt Santa Parade 2025, Upper Hutt Santa Parade 2025
The 2025 Upper Hutt Santa Parade is set to be another exciting event, so mark your calendars for Sunday 14 December 2025! Rain or shine Main Street on Sunday 14 December 2025 from 3.00 pm.

What’s New This Year?
This year’s Santa Parade theme is Lights, Camera, Christmas! We all have a favourite Christmas movie! Bring your favourite Christmas movie to life with a Christmas movie themed float. Whether it’s Home Alone, the Polar Express or even Die hard...

It’s not too late to get involved!
We’d love to see your creativity shine in this year's parade! Whether you're a local business, school, or community group, we encourage you to design and enter a float to bring your movie to life. One thing though we need a sign card saying the movie title on your float.

An invitation is extended to all business and community groups operating in Upper Hutt to join this community event and enter a Christmas movie themed float in the Parade.
label: Festivals

description:
Waifilmfest Presents Never Forgotten: the Marines of Masterton, Never Forgotten: The Marines of Masterton – Special Screening

After sold-out shows in May 2025, we’re bringing back Never Forgotten: The Marines of Masterton for one more special screening in Martinborough!

This feature-length local documentary tells the story of the United States Marine Corps’ 3rd Defense Battalion, who were stationed at Solway Showgrounds in Masterton in 1943 during World War II. Director Mark Pacey explores the Marines’ visit, the deep connections they formed with the local community, and their lasting legacy—including the journey to constructing a memorial in their honour.

Presented by Waifilmfest in partnership with Circus Cinema, Restaurant & Bar and the Wellington Historical Festival 2025, this is a unique opportunity to experience a powerful story of history, community, and remembrance.

Come and be part of this special event — one last chance to see it on the big screen!
label: Film & Media

description:
WPF presents: The Hunger (1983), WPF presents: The Hunger (1983)
Three of the most beautiful actors to ever live - Catherine Deneuve, David Bowie and Susan Sarandon- star in this ‘80s cult classic about a vampire couple posing as wealthy classical music teachers.

The Hunger is full camp; queer tension and complexity. And beware: the encounters in this movie do not stick to heterosexual norms.

Underworld Tavern in Mt Victoria is hosting this screening in their suitably dark, macabre and industrial surrounds. Prizes will be awarded to the darkest and most vampiric ensemble. A full bar service will be available throughout.

Continuing our run of film fundraisers, The Hunger allows us queers and our allies to engage with a pillar of queer culture. These screenings are organised and hosted by the community for the community. More than just a screening, this will be a queer horror experience.

The event begins at 3pm but come early to get comfortable. The film will start at 3.30. A short comfort break will be provided. Stay for a drink to discuss and dissect.

The Hunger is rated R18. No one under the age of 18 is permitted. Its running length is 97 minutes.

Tickets are $20 waged, $13 unwaged.

ACCESSIBILITY

- Underworld Tavern is fully wheelchair accessible
- The movie will include closed captions
label: Film & Media

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presenTs Rochelle (2024) + Bellbird (2019), Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.

ROCHELLE (2024) & BELLBIRD (2019) – Double Bill | Wairarapa Cinematheque

Two powerful New Zealand films, one unforgettable evening on the big screen.

ROCHELLE (2024) SHORT FILM
A brazen young man takes it upon himself to send his friend’s busted-up car, Rochelle, out in style by entering it in a local demolition derby. But to get there, he needs help from an unexpected source. A bold and surprising new story of friendship, loyalty, and going out with a bang.

BELLBIRD (2019) FEATURE FILM
Set in the heart of rural New Zealand, Bellbird is a tender, funny, and deeply human story of a father and son finding their way after loss. Warm, beautifully observed, and filled with aroha, it’s a heartfelt portrait of resilience, family, and community.

Tickets are $15 each, available via Humanitix or at the door.
If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night (28 September 2025), you’re covered — just show your card at the door.

Join us for an unforgettable evening of extraordinary local storytelling, celebrating the richness of Aotearoa cinema on the big screen.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents Rear Window (1954), Step into the world of Alfred Hitchcock’s timeless classic REAR WINDOW (1954) and help us celebrate the launch of the brand-new Wairarapa Cinematheque 2025 Season.

Cinematheques exist all over the world and are dedicated to presenting films as both cultural heritage and artistic expression. The Wairarapa Cinematheque brings this tradition to our region with monthly screenings on the last Sunday of each month, showcasing classics, contemporary gems, world cinema, and cult favourites.

We begin with REAR WINDOW (1954) starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly, a masterpiece of suspense and one of Hitchcock’s most enduring works. When a photographer confined to his apartment begins to suspect that one of his neighbours has committed a murder, he sets off a chain of events that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats 70 years later.
label: Film & Media

description:
‘Hīkoi — The Land March’ film screening, Come to the Library to watch the documentary ‘Hīkoi — The Land March’, 50 years after Dame Whina Cooper led the protest hīkoi from Northland to Wellington. The screening will be introduced by Larry Parr, Kaihautū of Te Māngai Pāho and former member of Ngā Tamatoa.

Presented by Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision in partnership with Manatū Taonga Ministry for Culture and Heritage and the National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa.

Photo ‘Participants in Māori Land March leaving Te Reo Mihi Marae, Te Hapua’, 14 September 1975, by Christian Heinegg. Ref: 35mm-87491-2 Alexander Turnbull Library.

description:
🎬 Movie Fundraiser: Kneecap 🎬, This time last year, Kneecap premiered at the Wellington Film Festival - but not enough people got to see it. Some films deserve the big screen experience, so I’m bringing it back!
Come along for a movie night with a twist - supporting a great cause while enjoying this epic film. Set in Belfast, this wild, witty, and politically charged story follows the rise of the real-life rap trio Kneecap, blending music, humour, and rebellion in a way only the Irish can.
Your ticket includes the screening plus a raffle with a twist 😉 - and every dollar goes towards my campaign, helping cover those last few expenses. Imagine the good we can do for our communities when I’m elected!
📅 Date: Monday 8 September
🕖 Time: 5.45pm
Location: Lighthouse Cinema Cuba Street
It’s a perfect chance to laugh and cry - imagine Derry Girls, Trainspotting and Spinal Tap combined - it will change you for the better and help make a difference - so gather your mates and join us for some great craic!
label: Film & Media

description:
‘Radicals’ film screening, Join us at the Library to watch the documentary ‘Radicals’ that tracks the evolution of modern Māori political activism — from young members of Ngā Tamatoa in the 1970s to the actions of Te Kawariki at Waitangi Treaty Grounds in 1995. The screening will be introduced by the Director of ActionStation, Kassie Hartendorp.

Presented by Manatū Taonga Ministry for Culture and Heritage in partnership with the National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa and Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision.

Photo ‘Scenes at Waitangi during the Waitangi Day protests’, 1982, by Ans Westra. Courtesy of Suite Tirohanga. Ref: PA-Group-00941 Alexander Turnbull Library.
label: Film & Media

description:
Powell Hut Slow Overnight Stay, This is a mid week tramp to beat any rush.
This event is aimed for people wanting to get up to this hut and stay the night as a group but NOT have the stress or pressure to break any speed limits.
The start time is set early to give the maximum amount of walking time to reach the hut destination. Typically it is a 3-4hr walk but even with a huge amount of breaks we will be arriving just in time to have lunch at the top.
There will be regular posted stopping points along the way at Rocky Mt Lookout and again at Mt House Shelter.
You will be in charge of yourself through the trip but we will be there to answer questions and provide the entertainment like always

This is a fully serviced hut with water, gas cooking and a lovely wood burner to heat the hut during our stay.
The walking distance is 7.3km on a well formed track in most parts and formed stairs.
The elevation gain is approximately 500m which brings you to the hut which sits at 1200m above sea level.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Moon Poetry, Poets and the moon: it’s a love affair as old as language. So it's only fitting that Nick Ascroft, Harry Ricketts, Stacey Teague, Jake Arthur, Kate Camp, Sylvan Spring and Ashleigh Young read poems to you in Moon Bar!
Settle in for an hour of readings where the poets meet their muse at last (or at least, read in a bar named after it). Expect poetry that's funny, moving, surprising, sharp and difficult to take photos of.

___
Special thanks to Booksellers Aotearoa NZ for supporting this event.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Chloe's Revenge, Chloe's Revenge
Written and performed by Chloe Bettina.

Part love letter, part exposé, Chloe’s Revenge is a musical theatre-inspired show that pulls back the curtain on the pro-am musical theatre “industry” in Aotearoa. With biting wit, Chloe lays bare the heartbreak of rejection from the world she adores, and turns that pain into power. This is a story of survival, self-discovery, and the ultimate comeback: becoming the best version of yourself when the system says you don’t belong. You don't have to be a "musical theatre person" to enjoy this show. In fact, it's better if you're not.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
9 September Whisky Tasting, Whisky Tasting: 9 September 2025
Hosted by Matt Mueller
In September, we'll get back on track, away from the International Whiskies of our August tasting, and on to the Eastern Highlands of Scotland: Glendronach.
Named for the valley of the brambles surrounding the distillery, Glendronach was the second distillery to gain a legal whisky license, and is currently under the stewardship of Dr. Rachel Barrie, a legend in the whisky industry. Dr Barrie has recently revamped the Glendronach lineup, and we're going to see how she's doing: we'll try the previous 12 and 15 year--old bottlings against her new releases. She's worked her magic at Ben Riach, and we'll see how she's doing at Glendronach (I suspect quite well!). Additionally, we'll try the highland peated Glendronach, a departure from the familiar smokey peat of Islay. We'll expect a sweeter, softer style, bolstered by some sherry maturation.
Please join me for this wonderful tasting of Glendronachs:
Tuesday, September 9
7:30pm Start time (arrive early to get a beer and a seat)
$60 per person
Seatoun Clubhouse (16 Dundas Street, Seatoun)
See you then,
Matt
Matt & the Clubhouse Team

*** Please note you need to be a member or a guest of a member to attend. Details on how to pay subs is below***
Membership subscriptions

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.
label: Food & Drink

description:
A Night on the Orient Express, All aboard as The Botanist turns into The Orient Express. Your tasty train journey will begin in Paris, heading to Istanbul via Germany, Austria, Serbia, Hungary and Bulgaria. The 7-course menu features modern plant-based takes on traditional dishes from each country’s cuisine, such as French crepes with vegan duck a l'orange, coconut-crusted parsnip Austrian schnitzel and Bulgarian kashkaval house-made cultured cashew cheese and spinach pastry; paired with creative cocktails, live music and some iconic Orient Express touches.
 
7-course tasting menu. Matched cocktails (alcoholic or non-alchoholic) can be added to your ticket.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Martial Law Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the Martial Law in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of the "Batas Militar" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS MARTIAL LAW?
"Martial law refers to the replacement of civil rule by military rule. This may be characterized by curfews, the dispensation of military tribunal rulings on civilians, and the suspension of the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus. The writ of habeas corpus, which in Latin refers to “having the body”, is a citizen’s protection against unlawful imprisonment. This is suspended in times of crisis to expedite justice" (Martial Law Museum).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte who spearheaded the violent War on Drugs in 2016 (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the Martial Law Era, wants to share their experience during the Martial Law (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.
label: Film & Media

Kaibosh Food Rescue, Kaibosh Food Rescue saves good food destined to be thrown out to waste, and delivers them to our hall for redistribution instead

Join us every Wednesday morning at the Lyall Bay Community Hall, to catch up with the community over a cuppa and grab some free kai for you and your whānau

Elegancia samba dance workshop S6 of 6 2025 winter, Elegancia samba dance workshop Last session 2025 winter
Our Last winter session! Come and join us for dancing samba! We practice a choreography potentially for the gigs towards summer. It includes the foundation of Samba no pe, musicality, stage skills and tips for solo.
Session 6, last session of this winter!

description:
A hāngi to remember, A hāngi to remember
Enjoy a delicious hāngi by P&S Kai, relax to live music and learn about the 1975 Land March coming to Porirua.

𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝟬𝟰 𝟮𝟯𝟳 𝟭𝟱𝟭𝟭 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗮𝘆 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘁 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗼𝗿 𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝗣𝗮̄𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗮 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗿𝗲-𝗽𝘂𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗵𝗮̄𝗻𝗴𝗶 𝗯𝘆 𝟯 𝗢𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗯𝗲𝗿. Be in quick! (Hāngi will not be available to purchase on the day)

$16 for a hāngi. Two options available:
Original: Chicken drumstick and pork belly, heaps of vegetables and stuffing.

50 years ago, Porirua welcomed thousands of marchers from the 1975 Land March. The marchers along with Dame Whine Cooper were welcomed with steaming delicious hangi and the legendary manaakitanga of Ngāti Toa and the Porirua Community before they delivered their message to Parliament.
To honour this significant time of unity and manaakitanga join us for ‘A hāngi to remember’.
Pick up your hangi, enjoy live music and visit the exhibition Not One More Acre: Remembering the 1975 Land March

https://pataka.org.nz/whats-on/events/a-hangi-to-remember/
label: Food & Drink

description:
A Rough-Cut Degustation, A Rough-Cut Degustation
Get ready for a full-throttle feast: a rustic 6-course beer and food pairing at Panhead, led by our Innovation Brewer Bern and Bar Boss Bree. We’re talking bold brews, killer eats, and some behind the scenes insights during a flavour filled evening.

Tickets are $75 a head and include:

- The full degustation ride
- Expertly matched beer + food pairings
- A rigger of your favourite brew to take home

Tickets on sale now at the Tasting Room Cellar Door — spots are limited, so don’t muck around!

This is a trust-the-chef night. No subs or swaps for dietaries. Strictly R18.

description:
Afternoon Tease, Doors open 1.30pm, serving 2pm, show starts 2.30pm.
Edible delicacies with a serving of delicious Burlesque.

An experience like no other. Nibble on a delicious afternoon tea served on a tiered stand, sip your tea or coffee, while you enjoy a burlesque show of fun and flirty acts. Ticket includes afternoon tea. If you are gluten, dairy or allium intolerant or vegan, please let us know when you book.

Featuring performances from:
Breathless La Belle - Pōneke Wellington
Papillon - Papaioea, Palmerston North

Weeds & Bellini - Pōneke Wellington

description:
Arizona Flashback, Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Art Flow: Dine & Discover, Join us for another exclusive evening celebrating art and cuisine at DoubleTree by Hilton Wellington. Experience the perfect blend of creative expression and culinary excellence as we bring together the artists behind our successful 'Art Flow' exhibition for an intimate dining experience.

Your evening begins at Grazie Italian restaurant with a welcome drink, followed by a carefully curated three course dinner. Our featured artist, Min Kim, will share insights into her beautiful art and offer a unique perspective on her creative process and inspiration with a live art demonstration between the main course and dessert. The journey continues when you’ll indulge in a dessert presented by Le Cordon Bleu, followed by the demonstrated artwork being auctioned towards the end of the evening. This intimate setting provides the perfect opportunity to engage with Min Kim while enjoying exceptional cuisine followed by a guided tour through our hotel’s art-adorned interior.

Event Details:
- Welcome drink on arrival
- Mix & Mingle – meet Min Kim
- A live art demonstration by Min Kim with the completed artwork being auctioned the same night
- Three-course dinner at Grazie Italian Restaurant with the dessert prepared by Le Cordon Bleu
- Guided art tour with our featured artists

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience art beyond the canvas and celebrate the intersection of visual and culinary artistry.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Bakery & Brewery, Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Writers Retreat, Set in the welcoming embrace of Featherston’s Fareham Creative Space, this weekend retreat offers a unique opportunity for writers at every level and genre to immerse themselves in creativity and community. This retreat will be a two day experience, with optional add-ons, designed to help you focus, recharge, and build lasting connections.

Our retreat is structured for those who are ready to escape the daily distractions, and explore wellbeing through creative practice.

2025 Retreat Themes:

Focused Writing Time: Quiet periods for personal writing, with prompts and encouragement to develop a new writing piece, or deepen your existing project.

Community & Connection: Opportunities for both structured and informal connection, allowing you to build a network that extends beyond the weekend. Optional evening events for building on social connections.

Wellbeing & Renewal: We're partnering with Wellspring Nature Therapy, to bring a wellbeing focus and spark creativity. Nature therapy is amazing for deepening your mind-body connection, and Fareham Creative Space's quiet rural location gives us a fantastic location to explore.

Enrichment & Inspiration: Scheduled time for the sharing work and celebration of each writer’s voice, as well as a Writers Journal, as a takeaway memento capturing a writing sample from each attendee.
label: Community & Culture

description: Breakfast Club, For one morning only – Loosie’s Superette is opening for breakfast, serving a comfort-filled menu with banging tunes and endless caffeine. Think trayfuls of fluffy pancakes, bacon and egg muffins, crispy hash browns drowned in maple syrup, and bottomless drip coffee to keep things rolling. Add a cheeky mimosa or two, and you’ve got the perfect start to your weekend. Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. No rules, no rush - just tunes pumping, trays piling up, and that warm, familiar feeling of a proper brunch done right.
label: Food & Drink

description: Breakfast Club, For one morning only – Loosie’s Superette is opening for breakfast, serving a comfort-filled menu with banging tunes and endless caffeine. Think trayfuls of fluffy pancakes, bacon and egg muffins, crispy hash browns drowned in maple syrup, and bottomless drip coffee to keep things rolling. Add a cheeky mimosa or two, and you’ve got the perfect start to your weekend. Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. No rules, no rush - just tunes pumping, trays piling up, and that warm, familiar feeling of a proper brunch done right.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Shawn James - Wellington, Shawn James – New Zealand Tour October 2025
Christchurch • Wellington • Auckland
For the first time ever, acclaimed American singer-songwriter Shawn James is bringing his powerful, soul-stirring music to New Zealand. Known for his raw vocals, heartfelt lyrics, and a genre-defying blend of folk, blues, rock, and soul, Shawn has captivated audiences around the globe.
Following a massive international tour and the rise of his hit song "Through the Valley" -featured in the critically acclaimed The Last of Us series - Shawn is thrilled to announce his debut run across Aotearoa.
Catch him live this October for three unforgettable shows:
Wednesday, October 15 - Loons, Christchurch
Thursday, October 16 - San Fran, Wellington
Friday, October 17 - Double Whammy, Auckland
Tickets are on sale this Friday the 30th of May at 1:00 pm
Pre sale starts tomorrow, Thursday the 29th of May at 1:00 pm
Don't miss this rare chance to experience the intensity and emotion of Shawn James in an intimate live setting. Tickets are expected to move fast - secure yours now!
"Hey there, this is Shawn James. I’ve had way too many writers think they could sum me up & relay what I’m about from an hour long conversation so they could write my “bio” but I’ve had it. Screw that. I’ll tell it in my own words.
I was born & raised in Chicago, Illinois. I grew up on the south side of the city where I attended a gospel church. I was always around a lot of heartfelt soulful music & hardworking, real, down to earth people. Although I no longer abide by any religion, I value the times I had and how they shaped me to be what I am now. I’ve moved around quite a bit living in all different parts of the US.
While absorbing all sorts of different cultures from here & around the world, I’ve developed my own sound. I started releasing my own music in 2012 and haven’t stopped since. I play a wide range of music from folk to blues, r&b, Gospel to rock, metal & alotta things in between. The main constant amongst all the genres would be that it’s all done with emotion, feeling, heart & a lotta soul. I mean what I say & deeply feel what I play.
I play covers of songs I dig sometimes and although some people may only know me because of those, I’m hardly just a cover artist.
If you come see me play live and expect just one style or aspect of what I do, you may be disappointed to learn that our shows are a roller coaster of emotions, musical styles, intensity & energy. I get bored easily & love to mix things up. Be ready & bring your ear plugs just in case..
I’ve always been the underdog so to speak since I’ve never had the backing of a large record label, big marketing firm or massive PR company & I truly like it that way. I feel as though I’ve earned what I have through hard work, determination, a good bit of luck & the great relationships with people I’ve made along the way. I’ve learned a lot of lessons the hard way being in this “music business industry” and that’s alright by me.
I’ve seen that with your support (the listeners out there) I can make my wildest dreams come true.
If you want to listen to an artist that’s authentic, genuine & original then you’ve come to the right place. I hope you enjoy the music & will join me on this journey that I’m so extremely grateful to be on.
Thank you all so very much.
Love,
Shawn James"
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Chance, Luck & Magic 2024 Launch, Be the first to taste Chance, Luck & Magic 2024, the latest edition of one of our proudest achievements.
On Saturday 18 October, you can come and taste the beer in our Wild Workshop, the place where it was made. Brewers Pete and Dave will be on hand from 2pm to raise the first toast and tell you all a little about how this year’s blend came to be. We’ll also pull a couple of other goodies from the cellar to keep you and CLM company.
And, to top it off, our friends at No Mames Tacos will be here for the edible pairings.
This beer is the ultimate expression of Wild Workshop’s inner-city terroir, and the 2024 bottle is no different; a blend of five years of 100% spontaneously fermented brews, aged in French oak. The result is a complex and truly unique drop that harnesses the natural character of Pōneke.
We love this beer, and we’re so chuffed that other people do too - we’re very honoured that Chance, Luck & Magic, in its various vintages, has garnered global recognition and become one of our most prestigious creations:
Silver medals at both the 2023 and 2024 World Beer Cup (huge!)
Four consecutive gold medals at the New Zealand Beer Awards, as well as two trophies for Champion European Ale, and the Champion Beer title in 2022
Champion International Beer at the 2024 Australian International Beer Awards
The release of each new edition has become a landmark annual event for us, a chance to take a moment and appreciate the beautiful things that come from the wild workings of the environment.
Come and celebrate with us!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Electra Business After Five - 4 November 2025, October/November Electra BA5 
Electra BA5 Business Under Pressure
How to safeguard, secure and stay ahead 
Join us for an informative evening designed to help local businesses navigate the financial and legal landscape of 2025. Our expert panel featuring a leading insurance broker, bank representative, lawyer, and accountant who will unpack the key issues shaping business resilience today.

Our panel brings together experienced professionals who work daily with New Zealand businesses navigating financial, legal, and operational challenges to provide insights. 

Topics include overviews on the latest Trust legislation and whether your trust is truly protecting you, the IRD’s $100 million investment in increased audits, and why 88% of liquidations and receiverships involve IRD debt. You’ll also gain crucial insights into insurance risks, and what movements in the OCR and interest rates mean for your business planning.

Hear from speakers from CS Law on trust protection, Grant Thornton on accounting and compliance trends, Insure Group on mitigating business and risks, and BNZ Business on preparing for lending and cashflow pressures.

This is a must-attend session for business owners, directors and advisors who want to stay informed, protect  assets and make smarter financial decisions in the year ahead.
Electra Business After Five
Tuesday 4th November 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf
Te Takeretanga o Kura-hau-pō, Levin
label: Business & Networking

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Stage 2 Health and Safety Representatives, The purpose of this two-day course is to extend the skill level of H&S Representatives. Stage 2 training focuses on specific risk and hazard identification and controls, approved Codes of Practice and using accident data to identify trends and develop preventative actions across the core elements of your workplace H&S system.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for people who have completed the Stage 1 course and are interested in taking their skills to the next level. It would also be useful for anyone who would like to know about the requirements for the role or who have employees in these positions.

Learning outcomes
Identify and report on links to productivity due to improved health and safety practices.
Determine injury causal factors from incident reports and notifiable events.
Provide detailed feedback to H&S Committee meetings for further action.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details
Duration: two full days, in person.
Time: 9am-4pm
NZQA Unit Standard: 17593 ( Assessment costs additional)


To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description: Cognac vs Armagnac, Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Carmichael, Carmichael is back for a spooky session... will we be in your halloween plans?
Dress up and get ready to boogie because we have an especially danceable set planned for the spookiest night of the year... and you are all invited!

Carmichael is a six-piece jazz ensemble, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Born from the darkest depths of jazz school, Carmichael was formed by a bunch of friends to make music that’s danceable as heck and have a good time doing it together.
Inspired by different global groove-driven collectives, such as Kokoroko, Ezra Collective, Nubiyan Twist & Fat Freddy’s Drop, their music blends elements of afrobeat, neo-soul and jazz fusion.

Featuring the beloved Carmichaelians :

Lily Atu - alto saxophone & vocals
Elisa Bird - baritone saxophone
Frank Paton - trumpet
Darcy Monteath - bass
Petar Tavich - guitar
Joseph Alexander - drums

Music from 9:30pm, FREE ENTRY

description:
Discover Te Muna - Go behind the scenes, Join us for a unique full day experience immersing yourself in the viticulture, wine making and wines of Te Muna valley. This spectacular valley lies nine kilometres east of Martinborough. Visit the vineyards, meet the producers, go behind the scenes and taste the wines where they are made.

We will pick you up from the Martinborough Square at 9.30 am to start your day at Big Sky Wines. Founders, viticulturists, and winemakers Katherine Jacobs and Jeremy Corban will give you a first look at their 2025 ferments, which have been produced from their organic vineyard. We will then take you to tour Blue Earth Estate vineyard and olive grove and enjoy a long lunch, accompanied by a glass of wine of course. From there we will take you to the stunning winery at Escarpment, and then to explore the beautiful terraced Craggy Range vineyard and taste their wines among the vines, both of which are not normally open to the public. We will finish the day with some of the other Te Muna producers joining us to share their wines and their stories. It will be a day of discovery - the place, the people and the wines of the beautiful Te Muna Valley.

Tickets are strictly limited to 18 people.
label: Food & Drink

The Lovers. The Fool. The Hanged Man. The Tower.

Judgement.

The art of Tarot blends self-reflection, interpretation and mysticism to offer guidance on our personal situations. Offer your questions to our players as they step into the possibilities laid out by the cards, and explore what could happen if we followed their wisdom... and if we don't.

Cast

Katherine Weaver
Christine Brooks
Brendon Bennetts
Jason Geary

Featuring Jean Sergent as our Tarot guide

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. description:
Father's Day Lunch, Saturday 6th and Sunday 7th September 2025. Celebrate this Father’s Day in the heart of the Wairarapa, surrounded by the breathtaking views of Wharekauhau Country Estate and Palliser Bay. Treat the father figure in your life to a memorable afternoon with a luxurious lunch at our renowned restaurant, where rustic charm meets world-class cuisine.

Our specially crafted Father’s Day menu highlights the finest seasonal produce, expertly prepared by our talented chefs. Enjoy a variety of mouthwatering dishes, from tender cuts of locally sourced meats to fresh, flavorful sides that will make every bite a celebration. Paired with a selection of New Zealand’s best wines, it's the perfect way to honor ‘Dad’ while taking in the stunning landscapes of rolling hills and expansive coastlines.

Relax in the elegant yet cozy atmosphere of our dining room, where impeccable service and a warm, welcoming environment make this a day to remember. Whether it's your first time or you're a returning guest, Wharekauhau offers an experience that combines exceptional food, unparalleled views, and a relaxed, family-friendly ambiance—everything needed to make this Father’s Day extra special.

Reserve your place today and give Dad the gift of a memorable experience he’ll treasure long after the day is over. Available on both Saturday and Sunday

description:
Pottery workshop Make a vase or cup and saucer At Big Mac Slabs, Pottery workshop Make a vase or cup and saucer At Big Mac Slabs
Make a vase or cup and saucer
When: 21st of September at 10.30am
Where: Big Mac Slab, Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu
How long: 2 hours
What it bring: just yourself

This vase or cup and saucer making workshop is a fun way to be introduced to slab building with clay. Fiona your tutor will show how to roll out a slab, add decoration by imprinting patterns into the surface. All materials are provided and each participant chooses a glaze colour for their items to be glazed. Fiona takes the items back to Whanganui to dry and then she fires and glazes them the colours chosen. Each participant will be given approximately 1kg of tan coloured clay and equipment needed to make the vase or cup and saucer.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
ROADKILL: The Uber-cool Musical - TAHI Festival: CANCELLED, Hey everyone- we have a little change of plans!
Unfortunately, ROADKILL: The Uber-Cool Musical won’t be happening this time around, but we’re already cooking up something even better for the future. All ticket holders will receive a full refund and we can’t wait to welcome you to our next big adventure.
Thank you for your excitement and your support.

CANCELLED-


ROADKILL The Uber-Cool Musical takes you on a wildly immersive journey through love, life and rock ’n’ roll — all from the back seat of a van. This intimate one-man musical combines humour, heart and unforgettable tunes for an experience like no other.
Strap in for the rollercoaster ride of your life as we take a regular mundane occurrence of driving in an Uber and blow wide open the private life, memories and miss happenings of our hero, and driver, Terry.

Carpool karaoke meets intense love story meets wild murder mystery.

Much more than a musical, its an experience, its a journey and an attraction!

In the space of a usual cabaret show and with the help of the passengers in the van, you will witness and be part of, childhood dreams, births, deaths and marriages, high drama, dark comedy, all sung live with a kickass, original, meatloaf-esque rock soundtrack. Surprises and magic ensues as we push the van, and Terry, to the limits of what is possible.

This will be an intimate, sensory overload, in a van. A full grand musical with all the bells and whistles.

With only 9 seats available each ride, grab your mates and have a private experience in the fast lane!
The hottest ticket in town- be sure to experience the ride of your life!

The show is in the style of a musical crossed with karaoke songs you have never heard before...

The van will be stationary and parked for this initial season.

Winner of BEST IN FRINGE and EMERGING ARTIST OF THE YEAR at the Dunedin Fringe and Winner of MOST INNOVATIVE at the NZ Fringe awards this year!
label: Arts & Theatre

The launch will take place from 12 PM to 5 PM on Saturday, 13 September, at a special one-day-only pop-up event at Alexia Urban Winery. The new Goose Neck Chardonnay will be pouring all day, accompanied by the return of ‘Tom’s Toasties’ gourmet toasties bar.

Tickets or bookings are not required—just turn up!

It's been four years since Alexia released a Chardonnay, so the first taste of the new vintage is highly anticipated.

description:
Honeymoon Around Asia, Honeymoon Around Asia: A Love Letter to Flavour
Pack your bags—Chow’s taking you on a romantic getaway through the flavours of Asia (no passport required
)
This five-course love affair is a journey through Thailand’s fiery passion, Japan’s delicate romance, Vietnam’s garden-fresh charm, Singapore’s bold intensity, and Korea’s comforting soul. Each dish is a love letter to its homeland—served with a playful twist and paired with mini Asia-inspired cocktails designed to make your tastebuds swoon
Expect an immersive vibe with house & disco beats, passport-style menus, and cheeky photo ops like our “Just Married to Dumplings
” station and “Love Letters Wall.” Whether you’re bringing your soulmate, your bestie, or your fellow foodie—it’s a night to indulge, laugh, and fall head-over-heels… for the food
One night only. Five courses. Five destinations. One unforgettable culinary getaway.
General release tickets are on sale from 12pm Friday 27 June
Spots are limited — Book Now !!

Are you ready to unleash your wildest desires and dance the night away? Prepare for an electrifying experience that will push the boundaries of pleasure and indulge your senses like never before! 🌈 Embrace Diverse Desires: A smorgasbord of sexualities, kinks, fetishes, and fantasies will come together for a night of unapologetic self-expression and connection.
Consent is Key: SPANK is a full permission safe space operating under the model of consent. We believe in empowering you to explore your sexuality freely, while respecting the boundaries of others. Remember, your desires are valid, but you must obtain explicit consent before engaging with others. Respect their boundaries and maintain a safe and enjoyable environment for everyone.
Unparalleled Experience: With our commitment to safety and enjoyment, we proudly offer you an electrifying event that promises to be both thrilling and secure. Join us for a unique Labour weekend celebration that will leave you breathless and craving for more.
Dress to Impress: 👗 Fetish Attire Compulsory: Dress up in your most tantalising kink and fetish costumes! Show off your unique style and embrace your inner desires. No jeans and jimmies allowed – this is your chance to shine and explore your fantasies.
🧥 Coat Check Available: Don't worry about your coats or extra clothing; we've got you covered with a convenient coat check service.
Join the Party: Are you ready to dive into a night of unbridled passion and wild dance moves? Sign up on the night with your name and email address to participate in the interactive play activity. Secure your spot for a night of unforgettable memories!


Please Note: We uphold a strict code of conduct and dress, and we reserve the right to remove anyone from the event at any time, for any reason, without a refund. We are dedicated to maintaining a safe and enjoyable environment for all attendees.

Don't miss out on this one-of-a-kind event where your desires are embraced and your fantasies come to life. Get ready to SPANK yourself into a world of ecstasy!


See you on the dance floor, The SPANK Team

description:
I-Sarn Thai KanTok, Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home. This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends. This event is made to be shared, the ticket price is for a shared menu for two. 

Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered. In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.

Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing. You’ll be served nine traditional dishes on a beautifully crafted bamboo tray, designed for sharing, just as they are in her village.

On the Kan-Tok:
Hor Mok Salmon – Steamed salmon in banana leaves, marinated with herbs, spices, and coconut milk
Mok Nor Mai with Pork Belly – Pork belly steamed with bamboo shoots
Larb Gai – A celebratory chicken mince salad with fresh herbs and toasted rice
E-Sarn Sausages – House-made, spiced and fermented in true north-eastern style
Nam Prik Tomato – Roasted tomato dipping sauce with chillies, garlic, and shallots
Som Tum – Green papaya salad with a sweet, sour, spicy kick
Sticky Rice – Soaked overnight and steamed in traditional bamboo baskets
Fresh and Steamed Seasonal Vegetables – To enjoy with sauces and mains

Dessert:
Kanom Chan – Thai layered jelly cake
Kanom Mun – Tapioca and coconut pudding

Pull up a seat at Daeng’s table and discover the stories, flavours, and traditions that shaped her childhood.
Single tickets or odd numbers unable to be catered to.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group, Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group
The Cancer support groups offered by Wairarapa Cancer Society are a great place for people navigating cancer to connect with others who have gone through similar experiences.

These groups provide a safe and supportive environment where individuals can share their emotions, experiences, and knowledge.

Not only do these support groups offer a sense of belonging and understanding, but they also provide practical advice, encouragement, and hope during what can be a difficult and challenging time.

This group provides an inclusive and open environment for individuals to attend and participate in the discussion topic. There is no pressure or expectation for attendees to stay for the entire open floor support session.

Structure of group meetings as follows.

- Welcome
- Topic presented and discussed.
- Open floor support
- Closing

This month our focus is on nutrition to support cancer prevention and recovery during treatment. We’ll look at how food choices can help maintain energy, support overall wellbeing, and aid the body through treatment and beyond.

All are welcome. If you would like particular questions covered in the session, please let me know ahead of time.

The support group places a strong emphasis on maintaining the confidentiality and ensuring the safety of attendees.

Please RSVP
There is no cost to attend this meeting.

description:
Love Language, Calling budding poets and hopeless romantics - this is your opportunity to share your love of language, with a food and poetry degustation. 
This four-course dinner is a physical manifestation of love and an ode to food. Join Simon Sweetman, Wellington writer, critic, musician and poet, as he reads some of his own poetry, and yours too if you're feeling game. Chefs Tim and Aaron Banks will lovingly create a four-course dinner with ingredients locally sourced and lovingly produced by small scale sustainable farmers... and perhaps they will read their own poems too. 
If you're feeling poetic bring along your own poem specially crafted around this year's festival theme 'Food is Love'. It can be as long or short as you like, as happy or sad, comical or tragic, Keats or Bukowski. Spot prizes for various categories including 'Most Related to the Theme' and 'Most Obviously Foodie' poems. Includes four courses, and a welcome glass of bubbles on arrival.
label: Food & Drink

Te Rau Huia, This year the incredible kapa haka rōpū from Ōtaki College, Paraparaumu College and Kapiti College wowed audiences at the Regional Secondary Kapa Haka Competition - performing with passion and grace and we have the chance to experience this again!

Join us at Te Raukura ki Kāpiti (Kāpiti College) for a night of breathtaking haka and waiata from our talented rangatahi.

All proceeds will help send Kapiti College’s Ngā Manu Kōrero representative to the National Competition.

Come along, be inspired, and support our next generation of leaders.

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

description:
Le Petit Chef, InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
label: Food & Drink

description: Outdoor Portraits - Beginners, A relaxed, beginner-friendly outdoor portrait session at Otari. We'll cover posing, using natural light, and simple composition tips to improve your portrait photos. Suitable for cameras of all types. Bring your camera and a charged battery.

description: Beginners Thai Kickboxing Class, Experience fun and energetic Muay Thai class with a passionate and experienced trainer. The first trial class is free. Please call or message to register. Muay Thai is Thailand's national sport and our trainer is a professional Thai fighter, but classes at the gym are a non-aggressive workout. You will learn kicks and punches on pads and bags and get a great workout. Students to get the full physical and mental benefits of Thai Boxing without the need for fighting and you'll definitely leave with a smile.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Love in Scent, Join fragrance aficionado Benny Castles for an immersive journey into the WORLD of love, told through the art of scent. In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Macaron Masterclass, MACARON MASTERCLASS
Presented by Le Ciel Bakery
Whisk, pipe, and finesse your way to perfect Parisian macarons

Join us for a hands-on masterclass where you’ll learn the secrets to mastering this delicate French treat — from glossy meringue to flawless feet. Led by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, this is your golden ticket to boujee baking greatness.

- Create & take home your own box of beautifully filled macarons
- Learn foolproof techniques, flavour infusions, and piping styles
- Start your evening with a complimentary glass of bubbles and a decadent Black Forest cake for two—because love (and baking) should always begin on a sweet note.

What you’ll learn:
- Mastering macaronage & piping flawless heart shapes
- Avoiding common meringue mishaps
- Chef’s expert tips for achieving that perfect crisp-yet-chewy texture

Only 12 people per class—an intimate setting where you’ll have Chef Shuchi’s full attention and guidance. Whether you're baking with your sweetheart, bestie, or favorite foodie, this experience is sure to be equal parts fun, romantic, and delicious.

Location: Le Ciel, 100 Tory street, Wellington
$62 per person
Limited spots are available—book now before they’re gone!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Lunch Speaker Series, Noble Rot invites you to enjoy a relaxed lunch in style. While away your afternoon with a leisurely three-course menu as they keep the wine flowing amongst you and your friends. They've lined up two incredible guest speakers at the forefront of the wine industry to entertain you with their stories, knowledge and insights into current trends in a relaxed but intimate atmosphere. You'll wish all learning was done this way. It’s the perfect excuse to treat your friends, your mum or your date.
 
Guest Speakers & Dates:

Saturday 9th — ‘Small Region, Big Sky’
Katherine Jacobs and her husband Jeremy embarked on a dream to produce some of Martinborough’s finest wines from their special vineyard in Te Muna, and they’ve achieved great success! Katherine will speak about upcoming trends, big dreams and hidden secrets in our favourite region’s wine scene.
 
Saturday 23rd — ‘A Rosie Afternoon’ 
Enjoy the company of Rosie Finn of Neudorf Vineyards, second generation of one of New Zealand's most prestigious wineries in Nelson. You’ll have the opportunity to ask Rosie all about current trends as she combines the story of her family winery’s historic roots and its impact on the landscape of New Zealand fine wines.

description:
Michelin Star to Martinborough, Join celebrated Chef and Union Square owner Adam Newell for a once-in-a-lifetime culinary experience. Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London. This exclusive event will offer an intimate exploration of Chef Newell's evolution as a chef and restaurateur, showcasing iconic dishes from four pivotal periods in his career.

Set in the elegant Napoleon dining room inside the historic Martinborough Hotel, each course represents a defining moment in Chef Newell’s career. Paired with fine wines selected by in-house Sommelier Carl Fraser, this evening is designed to be a feast for both the palate and the mind.

Course 1: 1980s – Claridge’s Hotel, London
A taste of the refined sophistication from one of London’s most prestigious hotels.
Course 2: 1990s – Le Gavroche, London
A nod to the classic French techniques that helped shape Chef Newell's early career.
Course 3: 2000s – Zibibbo, Wellington
A celebration of New Zealand’s finest ingredients and a significant step in his culinary journey.
Course 4: 2010s – Union Square Bistro, Martinborough
Reflecting his achievements at Union Square, the course that represents his current culinary vision.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Maille Sunday Kai, Escape the winter chill and head along to Cuba St Tavern for some Sunday Kai with Maille Mustard, running every Sunday of August. Each week features a different delectable roast, served with either a Maille Dijon Bloody Mary or warming mulled wine, and finished with a house-made dessert. Sunday has never tasted so good! Bookings available from 1pm.

$50 for 2 courses
$65 for 2 courses inc a Maille Bloody Mary or House made Mulled wine

Menu
Every Maille Sunday Kai event will offer a vegetarian option of eggplant parmigiana with buffalo mozzarella, Maille Dijon mustard, tomato ragù, garlic potato and broccolini.

3 August
Free-range roast porchetta served with garlic potato, creamed spinach, broccolini, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and apple sauce.
Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding with custard.

10 August
Roast duck breast served with duck fat roast potatoes, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, Yorkshire pudding, and Maille Dijon mustard and onion cream.
Dessert: Dark chocolate torte with orange mascarpone.

17 August
Conscious Valley roast lamb shoulder with garlic roast potatoes, honey-glazed carrots, minted peas, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and mint sauce.
Dessert: Bread and butter pudding with ginger gelato and crème anglaise.

24 August
Half a roast chicken with duck fat roast potatoes, garlic green beans, cavolo nero, Yorkshire pudding, chicken schmaltz and Maille mustard gravy.
Dessert: Steamed honey pudding with custard and honey gelato.

31 August
First Light roast sirloin served with honey-glazed carrots, duck fat roast potatoes, cabbage and bacon, Yorkshire pudding, horseradish, Maille Dijon mustard and jus.
Dessert: Chocolate fondant with vanilla bean gelato.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place, Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.
Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:
August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers
Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.
Tickets are available from Wednesday 18 June, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.
About the Artists
Ludus
is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.
Stephen Gallagher
is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.
David Long
is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.
Jules Desmond
is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.
Oghum
is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.
Jess Chambers
is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”
The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.
label: Music & Concerts

description: Milk Bar, Garage Project and Glou Glou are teaming up to showcase beer’s sweeter side and let the malt shine. Inspired by playful and nostalgic flavours, over three nights Garage Project will bring back the spirit of the original 2015 Milk Bar event while offering something fresh for first-timers. A must for anyone with a sweet tooth and a love of bold beer.
