description:
Family event: Explore Omnibirding with Giselle Clarkson, We are thrilled and delighted to announce we are going to be hosting a fabulous school holiday event with the multi-award winning Giselle Clarkson to celebrate the release of her latest book Omnibird: An Avian Investigator’s Handbook, a guide to the art and science of omnibirding.
Giselle Clarkson, the author of The Observologist, will be in Tawa for this very special event to explore the inner workings of the book and delights and wonders of the avian world.
Some birds are so commonplace it’s easy to forget how extraordinary they are. These creatures have a secret eyelid, hollow bones and a two-part brain. They dress in feathers. Omnibird, explores what’s remarkable about the birds all around us and the clues we can all use to become avian investigators.
Giselle is an author, illustrator and cartoonist based in Greytown, known for her work on conservation and environmental topics. She has illustrated award-winning picture books and nonfiction and is a 2023 Arts Foundation Laureate, receiving the prestigious Mallinson Rendel Illustrators Award.
This promises to be an unmissable event for bird and nature lovers of any age.
Books for sale thanks to the Children's Bookshop.
We wish to extend our thanks to Gecko Press for helping make this event happen.
This is a free event.
We expect this event to be very popular so to secure your seat early arrival is suggested.

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.
Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.
Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.
What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!
We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

description:
Mostly Music Soundscape Series | The Weather Machine, Mostly Music Soundscape Series | The Weather Machine
The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.



About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors at 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission. As a season pass holder you will be reserved seats near the front of the audience.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

With thanks to support from Creative NZ's Creative Communities Fund administered by Kāpiti Coast District Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st, Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Bar Crawl in Wellington on Saturday, Nov 1st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the wildest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join the spookiest Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, and get access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're spooky, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be at to celebrate Halloween.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your friends and take over the city with the Halloween Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and unforgettable Halloween experience!


🚨 Get Your 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this year's Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
El Horno
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 34 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:




🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀



A SPOOKTACULAR HALLOWEEN PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.

description:
Street Dance Foundations with Shifting Centre at Māoriland, Manu Wairere is a school holiday programme at the Māoriland Hub in Ōtaki, designed to ignite the creative potential of tamariki and rangatahi Māori aged 5–18.

Rangatahi are invited to join Shifting Centre, a Wellington-based artist collective, for a 3-day Street Dance Foundations Workshop.

Participants will explore the foundations of street dance through cypher and Talanoa, building confidence, creativity, and connection.

The workshop will conclude with a performance for whānau and friends.

description:
Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st, Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Bar Crawl in Wellington on Saturday, Nov 1st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the wildest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join the spookiest Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, and get access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're spooky, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be at to celebrate Halloween.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your friends and take over the city with the Halloween Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and unforgettable Halloween experience!


🚨 Get Your 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this year's Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
El Horno
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 34 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:




🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀



A SPOOKTACULAR HALLOWEEN PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️

Beer & Spirits Halloween Crawl – Wellington 2025, Beer & Spirits Halloween Crawl – Wellington 2025
Raise your glass to Halloween in Wellington! The Beer & Spirits Crawl brings cocktails, craft beer, costumes, and DJs on November 1st.

About this Event

🍺🥃 BEER & SPIRITS: HALLOWEEN BOOZE CRAWL 2025 – Wellington 🥃🍺 Halloween Saturday in Wellington is about to get boozier. The Beer & Spirits: Halloween Booze Crawl is your pass to explore the city’s best pubs, breweries, and nightlife spots in one epic night of costumes, cocktails, and craft beer.
On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, hundreds of party-ready crawlers will gather to toast the spookiest night of the year. From seasonal ales and spiced lagers to spooky-themed shots and signature cocktails, every stop on the crawl will be serving something worth raising a glass to.



EVENT HIGHLIGHTS
🥃 Beer + Spirits Combo: Enjoy the best of both worlds with craft beer options and premium cocktails at every venue.
🎶 Live Music & DJs: Halloween hits, party anthems, and dance-worthy beats all night long.
📍 Venues: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3 — hand-picked Wellington bars and breweries offering exclusive specials for crawl guests.
🎟 Your Ticket Includes: Wristband for entry, drink specials at each stop, and access to the official crawl map.

1️⃣ Check-In: Pick up your wristband at the starting venue between 7:30–10:30 PM.
2️⃣ Crawl at Your Own Pace: Visit participating middle-stop venues between 8:30–11:30 PM.
3️⃣ Last Call for Halloween: Everyone meets at the final venue at 11:30 PM for the Saturday night send-off party.



PARTICIPATING VENUES The lineup will be released soon — each location is chosen for great drinks, great atmosphere, and great music.
📍 On event day, click the to view the full venue list, drink specials, and schedule.

🎭 Costume Friendly: Whether you’re dressed as a beer-loving ghoul, a whiskey-wielding pirate, or a spooky pop culture icon, you’ll fit right in.

🚨 Saturday-Only Tickets: This is a one-night-only Halloween party. Early bird tickets start at just $15 — secure your spot before they’re gone.

What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🍺 Entry to 4+ pubs, breweries, and clubs in Wellington
🚫 No cover at all participating venues

description:
Echoes of Home - A Musical Journey Across Time, (Ticket Required)
Tuesday , 2 September 2025
Doors open: 4:30 PM | Performance begins: 5:15 PM sharp
Hunter Council Chamber, Hunter Building, Kelburn Parade, Wellington
Free Entry | All Welcome
In celebration of 80 years of Vietnam’s National Day (2/9), join us for a powerful evening of music, memory, and connection.
Through traditional and contemporary Vietnamese songs, Echoes of Home takes you on a heartfelt journey — honouring the past, embracing the present, and looking to the future. Performed by a diverse group of community members, this special event celebrates identity, culture, and the spirit of resilience.
What to expect:
• A beautifully curated musical programme honouring Vietnam’s story
• Performances of folk and modern Vietnamese music
• Dance, piano, harp, pipa, guitar, and more
• Multilingual storytelling to connect all audiences
• A welcoming, cross-cultural experience for all backgrounds
Please note: Doors close at 5:15 PM for the stage programme. No entry will be permitted during performances.
With thanks to our generous supporters:
MAY Coffee Crew • Hell Pizza • First National Real Estate Collective • Bellagio Cafe & Spa • Fabulash Brows & Beauty • Hutt City FM • Hi Tea • Golden Pine Trading Ltd • Saigon Xin Chao • Hutt City FM 106.7!
Hosted by Viet Hub NZ — rooted in culture, powered by community.
Follow this page for more updates

description:
Wunderhorse, Handsome Tours are pleased to present Wunderhorse in Australia + New Zealand in 2025!

Wunderhorse are Jacob Slater, Harry Fowler, Peter Woodin & Jamie Staples. 2022 saw the release of their debut album Cub, a collection of songs which found fans in Zane Lowe, NME, and BBC Radio 1, and took the band on tour with the likes of Fontaines D.C., Pixies, Sam Fender, and Foals, whilst also selling out their own headline slots along the way. Midas is out now.

Adopting an organic, unpolished recording process, Midas captures the visceral atmosphere of Wunderhorse’s raucous live performances. “We wanted it to sound like your face is pressed up against the amp,” frontman Jacob Slater told The Guardian. “No frills, no polish – just pure, uncut rock’n’roll.”
Indeed, the album’s rugged hooks, unfiltered noise, and fierce melodic sensitivity set Wunderhorse up for a year that will see them firmly established as an endlessly addictive and rousing generational talent.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ōtari Glow Worm Tour, Ōtari Glow Worm Tour
Take a guided night tour through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and discover some of the fascinating night-time residents on your way to see the titiwai/glowworms. Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the bush after dark and witness the magical glow of these unique creatures.

This outdoor night-time tour takes just over an hour.
If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 5 years and older.
The tour requires a moderate level of fitness, the route includes numerous steps to and from the glowworms.

Meet at the Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road. Bring warm clothes, walking shoes, and a torch.

This tour is operated by the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust. Join the Trust from just $20 a year and the glow worm tour is free, plus you’ll be supporting the amazing work the Trust does. Join today at owbt.nz/membership-donations/

Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.

For any changes or inquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Rathkeale Christmas Fete 2025, Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025! Walk through the gates of Rathkeale College on 1st November and be welcomed by a diverse range of colourful stalls, the aroma of freshy cooked food and plenty of festive inspiration.

Now in its 22nd year, the Christmas Fête has become a must-do event on the Wairarapa spring calendar. Stallholders travel from around the North Island to sell their wares and offer Christmas shoppers loads of inspiration. From festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, to flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.

Gourmet food is always a highlight at the Fête - think freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries & ice-cream - there is always a huge variety of flavours to tempt the taste buds. Devonshire Teas and home baking served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular Christmas cake stall features again this year - but visitors are encouraged to get in early as the cakes often sell out by midday.

The beauty of this Fête is that it’s a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children including facepainting and magic shows throughout the day.

Visitors can also explore the beautiful, expansive grounds of Rathkeale College including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.

Eftpos is available, but we strongly recommend that visitors bring cash.

Koha/gold coin entry.
Rathkeale College is a five-minute drive north of Masterton in the Wairarapa.

description:
Soundscape Series: Rameka Tamaki, People can expect a level of artistry and mastery over the guitar. Rameka will be playing a selection of Classical Guitar pieces which include places like Spain, Japan, South America, and also his own compositions. These will range from Baroque, to Romantic, and Modern, with elements of different genres that encompass different cultures and time periods from around the world.

Rameka Tamaki (Tūhoe, Maniapoto, Samoan, Tongan, Irish) is a Classical Guitarist from Aotearoa, New Zealand who has performed in festivals and shows around the world. With a passion for the guitar and Māori culture he completed his Bachelor of Music with First Class Honours at The New Zealand School of Music, Victoria University. His performances include ASIA Topa, The New Zealand Opera Company, Performance Space at Carriageworks Sydney, the Matariki Ahi Kā Festival, Gardens Magic, and Los Angeles for Kapa Haka.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

description:
Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience, Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience
Red Scare Theatre Company is proud to present Farrago Bazaar, an original Immersive theatre production with live action role-play elements. Unlike traditional theatre, you will be right in the middle of the action, and will have the power to shape the direction of the story.

400 years after the collapse of capitalism, the town of Farrago is preparing for its annual festival, where visitors from tribes across the continent will join to share food, stories and ideas. Parents and children are reunited; forbidden lovers search for each other; survivors of capitalism's last stronghold seek refuge. Amongst the six intertwining main narratives, the audience members each play characters from the visiting tribes and are free to shape the story as they see fit.

The culmination of artistic director Cassandra Tse’s PhD work into Immersive theatre and marking 12 years of Red Scare Theatre Company, Farrago Bazaar is the company’s most ambitious work yet, with a cast of twenty performers making up the various tribes of this post-post-apocalyptic world.

During the show, audiences can be drawn in to scripted storylines or create their own. As well as exploring the Bazaar – Innermost Gardens, transformed into a bustling market with secrets around every corner – they’ll be treated to a Farragonian feast.

Farrago Bazaar is a one-day experience with only two performances, on Saturday 22nd November: a matinee at 2pm and an evening show at 7pm.

Tickets are available now at https://www.redscare.co.nz/farrago-bazaar

description:
Fabric-a-brac 2025, Fabric-a-brac returns to Wellington for our second event in 2025!

The first Fabric-a-brac was held in Wellington 15 years ago - we're sew excited to still be here, bring the sewing community together and raising money for Mary Potter Hospice.
Fabric-a-brac is a fun fabric and sewing supplies market where you can shop for vintage and modern sewing and upholstery fabric, patterns, haberdashery and more. It brings the sewing community together to share stashes, stories and delight in our mutual love of textiles.
Fabric-a-brac is volunteer-run, and is a fundraiser for hospice - in Wellington this is Mary Potter Hospice. All profits from this event are donated to their work. We've raised $80,000 since our first event in 2009.
Selling fabric
If you have a stash you'd like to sell, you can come and take a stall. You pay a stallholder fee (which goes to Hospice) but anything you make on the day is yours to keep. Stalls are allocated via a ballot, which will take place closer to the time. Go to our website to find the form. Closes mid August.

If you have fabric, haberdashery or patterns you'd like to move on, but don't want to have a table, you can donate items. This will all go onto the hospice table on the day, and all profits will go to their wonderful work.
Fabric donation points
- Made Marion
- Mary Potter Hospice - you can take donations to the Mary Potter Hospice in Mein St, Newtown

Pop-up cafe
The fabulous cafe is back with all of its gorgeous volunteers and fab food. There will be tea, coffee and sweet treats for sale, so you can sit down and chat over your new projects and fabric purchases. All proceeds from the cafe also go to Hospice.
Buying fabric
Bring cash - most stallholders and the cafe will be selling by cash only.
We look forward to seeing our fabulous fabric and sewing community soon!
*Saturday September 20 2025
*St Anne's Parish Hall, Emmett Street, Newtown, Wellington
label: Markets & Fairs

Our ghastly ghouls, maleficent monsters and spooky scary skeletons will have you SCREAMING, death dropping, and chilled to the bone.

Prepare for a night(mare) full of the sexiest scares and tricks at every turn.

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg & Emma Barnes | Writers on Mondays, Three extraordinary poets introduce their new collections, books of poetry brimming over with feeling, and taut with intellectual curiosity. Amy Marguerite (over under fed), Sophie van Waardenberg (No Good), and Emma Barnes (IF WE KNEW HOW TO WE WOULD) talk with Anna Jackson about the conditionality of rapture, the loveliness of loneliness, the difficulty of living in a hungry body, how it has felt to keep writing through a pandemic, heart-break and grief, and why it matters to make space for metaphor and memory, for sparrows and bees and a guinea-pig, eating a dandelion, its mouth full of gold.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.
label: Arts & Theatre

Thorndon Fair 2025, Thorndon Fair 2025
Wellington’s iconic street fair is back!

Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.

With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
🖼️ Unique art and crafts
🍴 Delicious food and drink
👚 Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
📚 Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
🌿 Outdoor and experience products
🎶 Live music and entertainment all day

Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.

Around 40% of our stallholders travel 100km or more to be here, so many of the products you’ll find are unique to Wellington on the day.

🎈 Follow our page for sneak peeks, giveaways, and stallholder showcases as we count down to the big day.

description:

Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 4 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
AGM 2025, Hi everyone! Just letting you all know that next Thursday 14th August will be the Paremata Residents Association AGM
We are hosting the event at Mana Cruising Club (Ngati Toa Domain) and it gets underway at 7:00pm.
We have a guest speaker from Wellington Water (Steve Hutchison, Chief Advisor Wastewater) who will discuss the water network in our area, and give us insight into planned activities and future plans.
We also will run through the usual formalities required for associations (minutes, financial reports etc) and will try our best to not let it be to boring *insert sleeping emoji*
If anyone is keen on joining the committee team, you're welcome to put your name forward on the evening. Or send an email or Facebook message and let us know if you are interested.
The association needs good and willing people to help represent the local community and make our area a great place to live
See you on the night!

description:
Leadership Play Day - Wellington, Leadership Play Day: Wellington 17th October 2025
Friday 17th October 2025 | 8:30am–5:00pm
Location: Nairn Street Cottage, 68 Nairn Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011

What this day is all about
Leadership Play Day is a full-day, game-based learning experience that takes leadership development out of the boardroom and into play. Instead of being talked at with boring slides, you’ll step into three carefully designed games that let you actually practice leadership.
You’ll be experimenting, problem-solving, laughing (a lot), and walking away with insights that stick because you’ve lived them, not just heard them.
This isn’t theory. It’s leadership in action.
Learn more at our website.
How it works
The day is made up of three 2-hour games. You can book individual sessions ($99 each), or join us for the full day ($297) to play all three and unlock The Leadership Playbook - a bonus 60-minute facilitated debrief where we connect the dots and help you take away a clear set of personal leadership shifts.
Here’s what’s on in Wellington:
The Moonlit Market (8:30–10:30am)
Pitch, trade, and negotiate under pressure. Build agility, creativity, and bold decision-making in a playful, high-energy marketplace.
The Broken Bridge (11:00am–1:00pm)
A fantasy quest to practice difficult conversations. Explore courage, clarity, and how you show up when the stakes feel high.
The Inner Tides (1:45–3:45pm)
Use the Emotional Culture Deck in a role-playing game to strengthen emotional awareness, resilience, and confidence in leading with empathy.
The Leadership Playbook (4:00–5:00pm)
Available only with a full-day pass. A guided reflection session to connect your learning, extract insights, and leave with a practical playbook you can use back at work.
Why you should join
Practical skills, not theory - you’ll walk away with tools and insights you can use immediately.
Safe practice, real challenges - rehearse tough moments without real-world consequences.
Energy + engagement - no sitting back, you’ll be on your feet, in the mix, learning by doing.
Unique approach - game-based leadership development you won’t find anywhere else in NZ.
Whether you’re a leader, facilitator, HR/People professional, or just someone curious about growing your leadership edge - this day is designed for you.
Tickets
Individual game session: $99
Full day pass (all 3 games + Leadership Playbook debrief): $297
👉 Ready to roll the dice on your leadership?

Spots are limited - grab your ticket today.

description:
Kapiti Botanist Market, Kāpiti Coast, Get Ready – The Botanist Market is Coming to You!

Foxtail Events is beyond excited to bring the beloved Botanist Market to the Kāpiti Coast for the very first time — and we can’t wait to share it with you! Join us at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall for a lush, leafy celebration of all things green, gorgeous, and garden-inspired.

Whether you're a seasoned plant whisperer or simply love beautiful spaces filled with botanical charm, this market is your perfect winter escape!

Expect a vibrant mix of:
* Indoor & outdoor plants
* Botanical art, fashion & homewares
* Ceramics, planters & garden decor
* Natural skincare & eco beauty products
* Seedlings, garden tools & plant accessories
... and so much more!

This is more than just a market — it’s a community of plant lovers, creatives, and eco-conscious makers coming together in one gorgeous space.

Come see why the Botanist Market has captured hearts across Wellington — and now, it's your turn, Kāpiti! Bring a friend, bring your plant wishlist, and don’t miss this brand new local gem.

description:
Kāpiti Food Fair 2025, All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti
Website >> | Facebook >> | Instagram >> | YouTube >> | TikTok >>

description:
Malcolm Todd tickets, Presented by: Handsome Tours & Laneway
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

description:
She Rises: Spring Edition, When was the last time you truly paused?
Not just for a moment between tasks, but long enough to breathe and focus on your own wellbeing?

On the eve of Spring, join us for an afternoon, designed to nourish your soul, rejuvenate your energy and awaken the inspiration you need for the season ahead.
As a business owner, Leadership Coach and active mum of four, Sina Mikaio knows the importance of taking the time to escape the hustle and reset each season. That’s why she created She Rises - Spring Edition. An opportunity for you to step away from the noise, let go of the schedules and reconnect with your own inner wisdom.

Who Is This Workshop For?
This intimate gathering is for the women who:
Feels like she is holding it all—career, family and relationships—and is yearning for a space to finally let go.
Knows she wants more from life, but is seeking clarity on what that is and how to get there.
Is ready to release the stories of self doubt and exhaustion that have been holding her back.
Craves connection not only with herself, but with a circle of like-minded women who just "get it."

What To Expect: Your Journey
Your journey through this immersive afternoon will be woven through three powerful pillars:
Movement: Beginning with a nourishing yoga flow designed to release stored energy from the body, clear your mind and open your channels to receive your own guidance. (All levels welcome).
Mindset: A deep dive into your personal energy. You will learn how it impacts your presence, identify where you are leaking energy, release what no longer serves you and get crystal clear on what you want to call in.
Manifestation: A powerful guided visualisation to connect you with your deepest intuition. This practice will help bring your ideas forth, give you clarity on your next steps and provide you with the tools to build a purposeful pathway towards your goals.

You Will Leave With:
Clarity on your path for the season ahead
Unshakeable Confidence in your own wisdom, intelligence and power
The Courage to take aligned action towards a life you truly love
Actionable tools to regulate your nervous system and manage your energy daily.
A profound sense of feeling grounded, inspired and aligned within yourself.

Tickets available to purchase via eventbrite link below:

https://www.eventbrite.co.nz/e/she-rises-spring-edition-tickets-1550395166679?aff=oddtdtcreator

Join us Saturday 1st November from 9am - 3pm for a full day of music, kai, community, and whenua. Our last Open Day saw over 1500 people through the gates - this time we’re aiming for even bigger.

FEATURING:
- Garden tours with Cam & team (these always sell out so book your spot on our website
- Permaculture orchard tours & explore our first polyculture maze
- Live music from Casual Healing & friends
- Farm-fresh kai featuring our famous smoked lamb buns, sausages, veggies & more
- Market stalls, Coffee cart & other artisan producers
- Farm demos, including sheep dogs, ponies & more
- Kids zone, crafts & a range of activities
- Access to our full 4km Farm Trail Loop

General entry is FREE.
Garden tours $20 (kids come free).

So bring along the whole whānau, meet the animals, soak up the vibes, and enjoy a real day on the farm.

Volunteer spots are open too. If you want to get involved, email or head to the link in our bio.

description:
Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective, Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective
✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective ✨

Saturday 6th September · 11am – 2pm · Paraparaumu

For one day only, Lightbody Jewellery is journeying to Paraparaumu.

We’re honoured to be welcomed into Copperfield Collective, bringing with us a collection of our most sought-after treasures.

💫 Meet the maker – learn the stories and symbols hidden in every piece.

💫 Try on sacred treasures – jewellery alive with meaning, energy, and transformation.

💫 Feel the magic woven into silver and gold – creations that choose their keepers.

About Lightbody Jewellery

We are a small New Zealand brand, born from nothing but vision and persistence, built piece by piece, story by story. Lightbody Jewellery grew out of a desire to carry ancient symbols into the present, weaving spirit into matter so that jewellery could once again guide, teach, and protect.

Every pendant, ring, and talisman is handcrafted here in Aotearoa with intention. They are not made to follow trends, they are made to awaken, to empower, to transform.

What began as a spark has grown into a living brand carried by intuition, mystery, and craft. Each piece finds its keeper when the time is right.

This pop-up at Copperfield Collective is more than a display.
It’s a rare chance to meet the maker, hold the work, and feel which treasure has been waiting for you.

✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up
📍 Copperfield Collective - 17 Seaview Road, Paraparaumu Beach
📅 Saturday 6th September
🕚 11am – 2pm

description:
Not ya nanas market, Not ya nanas market
*Strictly R18*
Get ready to immerse yourself in a world where art and craft meet the dark and mysterious. This market is not for the faint of heart! Here's what you can expect:
1. Creepy-Cute Delights: Explore a wide range of art and craft creations that blend the creepy and cute aesthetics. From adorable monsters to spooky dolls, you'll find something to tickle your fancy.
2. Witchy Wonders: Dive into the world of witchcraft and magic. Discover spellbinding artwork, mystical jewelry, and enchanting potions. Embrace your inner witch or warlock!
3. Kinky Curiosities: For those who enjoy a touch of kink, we have a selection of unique and provocative art and crafts, and kink wear. Explore the boundaries of sensuality and embrace your desires in a safe and inclusive environment.
4. Sexy Sensations: Indulge in the world of sensuality and erotic art. Discover captivating paintings, sculptures, and photography that celebrate the beauty of the human form. Embrace your sexuality with pride!
5. LGBTQIA+ Friendly: This market is a safe space for all members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Celebrate diversity and inclusivity as you explore the wide range of art and craft offerings.
6. Alternative Art and Craft: Step outside the mainstream and explore the alternative side of creativity. From gothic to steampunk, from punk to cyberpunk, you'll find a variety of unique and unconventional art and craft pieces.
Don't miss out on this extraordinary event! Mark your calendars and invite your friends. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little bit spooked. See you at the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!
$5 cash only door entry
It definitely will NOT be your nana's market! See less
Upper Hutt, New Zealand

This is a kids-friendly day, with a childrens workstation, forbuilding and other family activities.
Workshops and acitvities include...
• Invertebrate studies
• Water testing
• Understanding fish passageways
• Stormwater networks
• Karaka berry foraging
• DIY Tracking tunnels
The day will also have a food truck and guided tours of the awa and forest trap line.
Come and celebrate the first year restoring the mauri and mana of this wāhi tūpuna urban stream and forest.

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Spinal Tap II: The End Continues, The long-awaited sequel to the comedy classic This is Spinal Tap is here to turn the Festival up to 11!

Forty-one years after the release of the original groundbreaking mockumentary, the now estranged bandmates David St. Hubbins, Nigel Tufnel, and Derek Smalls (Michael McKean, Christopher Guest, and Harry Shearer) are forced to reunite for one final concert.

Spinal Tap II: The End Continues also marks the resurrection of documentarian Marty Di Bergi (Rob Reiner), who once again tries to capture his favourite metal gods as they contemplate mortality—and the hope that their 12th drummer doesn’t join them in The Great Beyond.

Joined by music royalty Paul McCartney and Elton John, Spinal Tap wrestles with their checkered past to put on a concert that they hope will solidify their place in the pantheon of rock ’n’ roll.
Rating
Offensive language & sexual references
Director
Rob Reiner
Cast
Christopher Guest, Michael McKean, Harry Shearer, Rob Reiner

description:
Plant Sale, I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.

description:
From Europe to the Indo-Pacific: Finnish views on strategic partnerships and security in times of uncertainty, Finland, which shares a 1300km land border with Russia, has had its strategic circumstances dramatically impacted by the war in Ukraine. In this talk, State Secretary Pasi Rajala will discuss Europe’s evolving security landscape and its implications for Finland and NATO. He will share Finnish views on enhancing security and national resilience in response to shifting dynamics across Europe, the Indo-Pacific, and the global stage. He will also speak to the importance of deepening cooperation between Finland and New Zealand, two like-minded partners committed to democratic values, multilateralism, and the rules-based international order.
Mr. Pasi Rajala is State Secretary to Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen and Defence Minister Antti Häkkänen. He has previously served as Special European Affairs Adviser to the Finnish Prime Minister, Special Adviser to the Minister for Trade and Development, and Press Counselor and Spokesperson at the Finnish Embassy in Washington, D.C. Prior to that he held a number of communications positions, including in development finance company Finnfund, PR agency EuroRSCG, and the UN Development Program. Mr. Rajala holds a Master of Social Sciences degree from the University of Helsinki where he majored in International Relations.
label: Government & Politics

description:
NZIFF: Sex, Returning from last year’s Festival to screen alongside the rest of his Sex Dreams Love trilogy, Dag Johan Haugerud’s comic drama takes a candid and refreshing look at modern gender roles.

There has hardly been any investigation on contemporary male identity and sexuality as candid, insightful and hilarious as Norwegian auteur Dag Johan Haugerud’s Sex. After winning all major laurels in Nordic cinema with his impressive fresco Beware of Children (2019), the acclaimed director and author embarkson an Oslo-set trilogy simply called Sex Dreams Love.

The first instalment opens on one of the most tantalising and unexpected preludes in recent cinema. Two chimney sweeps frankly open up to each other on a coffee break in their office: the first reveals that he dreamt of being intensely looked at by none other than David Bowie, who was inspecting him as if he was a woman; the other confesses that he recently accepted the sexual advances of a male customer who asked him to have sex with him. But both men are “straight” and married to women. Here, the deft tone of the film and Haugerud’s rules of the game are immediately set.

A fervent admirer of Eric Rohmer’s thickly scripted skirmishes of love and ethics, the Norwegian writer-director infuses irony, depth and compassion in each of his elegantly composed tableaux depicting how the two men cope with the turmoil these experiences bring to their relationships with their partners and family, but most of all with themselves. Featuring some of the brightest and funniest dialogues of 2024, Sex is a real eye-opener. — Paolo Bertolin

description:
Steiner School Fair 2025, Nau Mai Haere Mai ki te Raphael House Steiner School Fair. The School Fair is our major annual fundraiser hosted by the school community. Its purpose is to celebrate the school’s education and culture with the wider Wellington Community.

Each year students, teachers and parents work together to transform the school environment. Activities, displays, artistic presentations, gift stalls and food offerings provide a venue for community engagement that is a highlight on the school’s annual calendar.

Dive into a world of magic and imagination at our Annual Fair! Join us for a day fueled by holistic education, creative adventures and community togetherness.

Throughout the year, parents, students and teachers get together to transform our school into a mystical, sensory wonderland.

Explore and shop from a delightful array of unique, handcrafted crafts, toys, and Seasonal treats. This is where nature, creativity and heartwarming experiences come together to nurture young minds and inspire families.

Kindergarten parents create small gifts, from natural, materials which the young child will receive in the Little Peoples room. The handwork room is lovingly and thoughtfully prepared with the sensory experiences and impressions of the young child in mind.

Other parents are busy with tasks like creating Christmas crackers and decorations and researching new and exciting tantalizing recipes for the two cafes.

The Teaching faculty gathers students' work, from Kindergarten to Class 12 (Year 13), which are on display in the Eurythmy Room. If you have ever wondered what a main lesson book is you are bound to find one, or more, here!

To ensure there is fun for everyone we even create games to play both indoors and out. Then to add to the atmosphere during the day you will hear the sound of music and singing, and even some dancing while enjoying an organic coffee. The School Fair is a great day for all.

Skip the traffic - There is very limited parking around the school area, so please make use of our Fair Shuttle Bus - every 30 minutes to and from Melling Station. Gold coin per person per trip.

description:
The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!, The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!
And now for something completely different…
Prepare yourself for a day of absurd antics, ridiculous competitions, and nonsensical fun as The Bond Store descends into Monty Python–inspired mayhem.

💰 Entry is FREE!
But to join the day’s silliness, games, and glorious nonsense, we will be asking for a donation to Kāpiti Golf for Good – a Lions & Rotary initiative.

👑 Gather your knights, twits, and lumberjacks for:

🕺 The Ministry of Silly Walks Competition

🩸 The Black Knight’s Limb Toss (just a flesh wound)

🎩 The Upper-Class Twit of the Year Race

🐴 The Two-Person Coconut Horse Race

🌲 The Lumberjack Song Karaoke (he’s okay!)

🧠 The Monty Python Quiz (bring your brain, or a dead parrot)

🏆 Prizes to be won, dignity to be lost.

But that’s not all! Beware of French guards at the gate, pop into the Argument Tent (“This isn’t an argument!”), and expect confusion, silliness, and possibly a Spanish Inquisition (though nobody expects that).

Plus: Market stalls and Monty Python–themed drinks at the bar.

Plus Steve Poulton live music from 4.30pm.

So grab your coconuts and gallop to The Bond Store for a day you won’t forget (no matter how hard you try).

Kindly stuff your pockets with good old-fashioned cash (none of that funny monopoly money) to hurl generously at the ‘Golf is Good’ charity in exchange for your entry into the day’s utterly ridiculous games

description:
Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of
St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and
stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion.

You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of
Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded professional embroiderer who graduated from the Royal
School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells
her work, as well as accepting commissions from churches, fashion designers and private
individuals. She has also had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan
and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered
3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of
New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

Venue: Loaves and Fishes Hall, Wellington Cathedral of St Paul.

description:
The Mad Hatter's Market Express, The Mad Hatter's Market Express

Journey with Steam Inc on this return trip to the Woodville Mad Hatter's Market Day!

Bring the family up into the heart of the Manawatu on the steam train, and enjoy a fun filled day at Woodville's famed Mad Hatter's Market Day. Hauled by Ja 1271, our 1956 built steam locomotive. Join the train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin or Palmerston North. Upon arrival at Woodville, there is the option to walk up to the square, or travel by shuttle bus up.

Woodville 150th Mad Hatter's Day
Since 2017, the local Woodville community have hosted this special event in the heart of the township celebrating all thing's 'mad'! Bring the kids along for a children's tea party and old time games - with a particular focus on steampunk. Featuring live music, over 70 market stalls and most importantly - the annual Crazy Hat Competition! Last year, people on our train took away 1st place!

Spot prizes are to be given out throughout the day for best costumes and hats, and an array of vouchers will also be up for grabs!

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage number and seating allocations at the ready.

Please note that if booking online, our booking system does add on a small percentage to the above fares. Steam Incorporated does not see this revenue.

Mad Hatters Menu
The wonderful team has put together an array of food trucks for all to enjoy at the market, and you can also support the local cafes of Woodville township. There will also be tea/coffee available on board the train, along with some alcoholic beverages and light snacks.

We can cater for larger group bookings - these are best dealt with directly through us by emailing admin@steaminc.org.nz or contacting 0800 783 264.

Book the Mad Hatters Market Express!
All seating is reserved and allocated on these special experiences. Prior booking is essential.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.

With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
🖼️ Unique art and crafts
🍴 Delicious food and drink
👚 Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
📚 Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
🌿 Outdoor and experience products
🎶 Live music and entertainment all day

Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.

Around 40% of our stallholders travel 100km or more to be here, so many of the products you’ll find are unique to Wellington on the day.

🎈 Follow our page for sneak peeks, giveaways, and stallholder showcases as we count down to the big day.

description:
Wairarapa Bookshop Hop 2025, The best booksellers in Wairarapa have come together to give you the ultimate book-lovers day out in celebration of New Zealand Bookshop Day.

This year, you can collect stamps from 13 new and used Wairarapa Bookshops and enjoy a range of other bookish events all day long.

One of the (many) great things about Wairarapa is we have 13 fantastic bookshops all within an easy 30 minute drive of one another, so it's entirely possible for you to hop around all 13 bookshops in a single day.

Celebrate NZ Bookshop Day with a Wairarapa wide Bookshop Hop. It's your chance to win lots of prizes and stock up your bookshelf.

STEP 1:
Pick up an official passport from any of the participating bookshops - available from all participating stores from Friday October 10th.

STEP 2:
Collect a stamp from each store you visit and make a purchase. Each stamp is an entry into the prize draws for $1,000 in bookshop vouchers.

STEP 3:
Leave your stamped entry with the last bookshop you visit.

This event happens rain or shine!

Register for free to stay up to date and for an extra chance to win a prize: bookshopday.nz/
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Workplace Wellbeing in Action: Practical Lessons from SiteSafe, Workplace Wellbeing in Action: Practical Lessons from SiteSafe
Event Details
📅 Date: Wednesday, 22 October 2025
🕐 Time: 5:00 PM – 6:30 PM
📍 Location: SiteSafe Headquarters, 23-25 Jarden Mile, Ngauranga, Wellington 6035
👥 Capacity and Cost: FREE, with a maximum of 20 attendees (NAWIC and non-NAWIC members welcome - bring a friend!)
🦺 PPE Requirements: No PPE required.
Join us for an engaging evening with SiteSafe, New Zealand’s leading experts in health, safety, and wellbeing. This session will offer a unique behind-the-scenes look at how SiteSafe cares for their own people, providing insight into the innovative initiatives they’ve implemented to support staff wellbeing, health, and safety.
This event is especially relevant for consultants, designers, and office-based professionals who want to see how a safety-focused culture can be successfully embedded within an organisation — even outside a construction site.
 Why attend:
Learn from their approach: Discover the specific HSE and wellbeing initiatives SiteSafe has introduced for their staff, including mental health support, proactive safety programs, and team engagement strategies. See how these approaches create a positive, resilient workplace culture.
Practical insights for your team: Whether you manage design teams, consult on projects, or work in office-based or site-based roles, learn actionable ideas to enhance wellbeing, safety awareness, and engagement within your own team.
Explore their offerings: Gain an overview of the courses, training, and advisory services SiteSafe provides, which can help organisations of any type embed stronger health, safety, and wellbeing practices.
Network in a relaxed environment: Connect with fellow industry professionals over snacks and drinks hosted by SiteSafe. Exchange ideas, share experiences, and enjoy informal conversations in a friendly setting.
SiteSafe is more than a site-safety organisation — they are a model for how to embed effective HSE and wellbeing practices that benefit staff, improve organisational culture, and support long-term project success. This event is an opportunity to see these practices in action, gain practical ideas for your own team, and connect with like-minded professionals in the industry.
🙏 Huge thanks to SiteSafe for offering us this opportunity!
 Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
Soundscape Series: The Weather Machine, The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers wanting more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.
