description:
Track Day- 2025, Track Day- 2025
🚗💥 START YOUR ENGINES! 💥🚗

We are beyond excited to announce Forged Development's First Ever Track Day at Manfeild Motorsport Park-Circuit Chris Amon!

📅 SAVE THE DATE: 27th September 2025!

In celebration of our founder and owner, Sameer Kumar’s 40th birthday, we’re kicking things into high gear with an action-packed PlayDay on Track event!
Forged Development, in collaboration with PlayDay on Track, we’ve been working tirelessly to deliver an unforgettable track experience. Whether you're a seasoned track enthusiast or just looking to enjoy a fun day on the tarmac, we’ve got you covered.

What’s in store:

A thrilling day on the iconic Manfeild Motorsport Park.

Designed for all skill levels, with three distinct Speed Groups to ensure a safe, exciting experience for everyone.

Maximum track time with minimal racing traffic, so you can make the most of every lap!

Track Entry Tickets now available:

Show and Shine Entry: Now Live

Spectator entrance free!


Competitor Information:

WOF or Reg aren't required, however 3rd Party insurance is preferred as Forged Development Limited and PlayDay on Track takes no liability for any damages or loss at the event.

What you need to bring: (You will not be allowed on track without the minimum safety requirments)
- Driver’s license
- Overalls (minimum 1 layer Cotton)
- Closed top shoes
- Helmet

Not mandatory however highly recommended:
- Neck Restraints/Hans device
- Fire extinguisher

No passengers unless a full MSNZ approved caged. (Expect in familiarization laps for non-caged vehicles)
Passengers wishing to go in a caged car must sign an indemnity form available from the documentation/registration area.

Garage sheds are on a first come, first serve basis.

Pitlane Garages are available for hire, limited available for purchase along with your ticket.

Vehicle Safety:
Participants are responsible for ensuring their car is safe. This includes:
- No fluid leaks (oil, fuel, coolant, brake fluid)
- Brakes in good working condition with sufficient pad material
- Tires in good health
- Lug nuts torqued to spec; all must be present
- Battery securely mounted
- Seat belts or harnesses in working condition
- No loose items inside the vehicle (tools, bottles, etc.)
You will be asked to sign a self-tech form during registration.

On-Track Rules:
- Passing allowed only in designated zones (straights) and with ownership on the driver overtaking to execute a safe pass.
- No hard-overtaking under braking/corners.
- Yield to faster vehicles; use mirrors frequently.
- If you spin or leave the track, rejoin only when safe or return to the pits.
- When on track, do not leave your vehicle unless if fire.
- Aggressive driving, unsafe behaviour, or reckless manoeuvres (e.g., drifting, tailgating) will result in ejection from the event.
- Obey all flag signals and track officials immediately.
- Pitlane Speed limit: 10 kph
- No tire burnouts, speeding, or aggressive driving in paddock/pit areas.

Weather Policy:
- Track day runs rain or shine unless deemed unsafe by organizers.
- Participants must adjust driving style to suit conditions.

Liability Disclaimer:
- All participants must sign a waiver of liability.
- You are responsible for any damage you cause to your vehicle, other vehicles, or track property.
- The track and organizers are not liable for injuries, mechanical failures, or accidents.

Refunds:
There are no refunds but you can transfer your entry to someone else (You can do this via contacting us directly)

Advertising release:
As a condition of entry, each entrant for themselves, as agent for accompanying adult and as parent or guardian for an accompanying child, grant the event promoter, Forged Development Limited, the exclusive right to photograph, video or film, or portrayal without names or credits as the event promoter may in their absolute discretion think fit.
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Katherine Mansfield's Thorndon: Guided Walking Tour, Katherine Mansfield's Thorndon: Guided Walking Tour
Part of the Wellington Heritage Festival 2025

"How hard is it to escape from places. However carefully one goes they hold you – you leave little bits of yourself fluttering on the fences – like rags and shreds of your very life.” Katherine Mansfield in a letter to Ida Baker, 1922

Explore the Thorndon that Katherine Mansfield knew and the traces of her legacy that remain in the landscape today. Beginning with an introductory talk, a viewing of the exhibition 75 Tinakori Road: “This marvel had come to the lane” and a hot drink at Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, the guided walking tour will finish at the National Library of New Zealand.

Please note: This is a guided walking tour which will involve approx. 30 minutes of walking on flat ground with frequents stops. Participants are encouraged to wear comfortable shoes and bring appropriate protection from sun and rain. The tour will begin upstairs at Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, if you have accessibility requirements, please see the accessibility information on our website or contact us to discuss.

Bad weather postponement dates: The tour will go ahead if there is light rain, so please bring a raincoat. If there is heavy rain and/or strong winds the Saturday 18 October tour will be postponed to Saturday 25 October; the Thursday 23 October tour will be postponed to Thursday 30 October. Participants will be notified by email and text message (if a mobile number is provided when booking) by 9am on the day of the tour if there is a postponement.

(Image: The Katherine Mansfield Memorial photographed by Charles P S Boyer, c1930s. Wellington City Council Archives, 00157-99)
label: Community & Culture

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness
Pulp Fiction
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Glow in the dark titiwai tours - New Zealand glow worms, A fascinating tour into the world of titiwai, New Zealand's glow worms, in Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. This outdoor night-time tour takes about an hour, and all are welcome to join. If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 7 years and older.
Meet at the Founders’ entrance to Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā on Glenmore Street. Please bring your ticket, a torch, and an umbrella if it’s raining. We'll see you there!
This tour is operated by the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden.
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Powell Hut Slow Overnight Stay, This is a mid week tramp to beat any rush.
This event is aimed for people wanting to get up to this hut and stay the night as a group but NOT have the stress or pressure to break any speed limits.
The start time is set early to give the maximum amount of walking time to reach the hut destination. Typically it is a 3-4hr walk but even with a huge amount of breaks we will be arriving just in time to have lunch at the top.
There will be regular posted stopping points along the way at Rocky Mt Lookout and again at Mt House Shelter.
You will be in charge of yourself through the trip but we will be there to answer questions and provide the entertainment like always

This is a fully serviced hut with water, gas cooking and a lovely wood burner to heat the hut during our stay.
The walking distance is 7.3km on a well formed track in most parts and formed stairs.
The elevation gain is approximately 500m which brings you to the hut which sits at 1200m above sea level.

description:
WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL, WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
Hi everyone - welcome to the WSKN Christmas SKISL / Paddle to Mana!

On Saturday 13th December we will have a Christmas event on Mana Island, departing Titahi Bay at 10am (so arriving at 9:30) getting to Mana around 10:40, keen ones can do stuff prior to lunch around 12:00, then there might be groups that head back at different time slots, but we can work that out on the day. Return could therefore either be 1:30 or 2:30 with the latest return to Titahi Bay being 3pm.

We've made this event later than the normal SKISL so that it's easier for folks to drive down from Palmerston North, and also because it is a lunch event.

The lawn on Mana is really nice, sheltered and pleasant and there are also good walks. Mana is of course a sanctuary so you must check your boats for any wildlife especially ants that may have gotten in past the hatches. Also we cannot have any fires

Plan B: If weather nukes Mana, we'll try for Green Point or Onehunga Bay in Whitireia Park by driving there.

Plan C: We will postpone to 21 December

description:
Feeding Frenzy Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington 2025, Feeding Frenzy Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington 2025
Packed dance floors, killer beats & spooky drinks. The frenzy hits Wellington Nov 1 — and you’re either in it or missing it.

About this Event


🩸🔥 FEEDING FRENZY HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL – Wellington 2025 🔥🩸

When Halloween Saturday hits Wellington, the streets turn into a party jungle — and the Feeding Frenzy Halloween Bar Crawl is at the top of the food chain. Hundreds of costumed crawlers will be out in full force on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, bouncing from one high-energy bar to the next, chasing the best music, the best drinks, and the wildest crowds in the city.
This isn’t a night where you settle into one place — it’s a moving, breathing, full-costume swarm of energy. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks that fit the season, and the kind of Halloween madness that only happens once a year.




WHAT’S IN STORE
🍹 Bars and clubs stocked with exclusive drink specials just for the crawl.
🎶 DJs pushing the energy with Halloween remixes, EDM, hip hop, and throwback anthems.
👻 Crowds dressed in everything from elaborate horror make-up to clever pop culture costumes.
📍 Venues chosen for atmosphere, music, and their ability to keep the party moving.


THE PLAN
The party starts at 7:30 PM at the first venue — grab your wristband and you’re in for the night. The feeding frenzy moves through multiple stops, all within walking distance, with each bar serving its own vibe and drink specials. By 11:30 PM, the entire crowd converges for a final blowout party that carries the night until 2 AM.

PARTICIPATING VENUES We’ll reveal the full lineup soon. Every location will be transformed for Halloween and serving themed drinks you won’t find on the menu any other night of the year.
📍 On event day, click the Crawl Map Link to see every participating bar, drink specials, and live music schedule.


🩸 Whether you’re a vampire, witch, demon, or something completely unexplainable, this is your night to roam the city in full costume and let loose with a crowd just as wild as you are.



🚨 Tickets: Starting at $15 — lock yours in now before they’re gone.

Your Ticket Includes:
🎟️ Entry to all participating bars and clubs in Wellington
🚫 No cover charges
📱 Digital crawl map access
🎵 DJs & entertainment at every venue
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drink specials




⚠️ Important Event Disclaimers
Age Requirement
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to participate. No exceptions will be made.
Wristbands
Your wristband is your pass for entry. Present your ticket or QR code at the check-in location to receive it. Wristbands must be worn throughout the night to access participating venues. If you miss the pickup window listed on the crawl map, you forfeit your access — no wristband means no entry. Lost or unclaimed wristbands cannot be replaced.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Tickets cannot be refunded, transferred, or exchanged. If the crawl is canceled without being rescheduled, the base ticket price (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Participating venues, event hours, and drink specials may be adjusted at any time without advance notice.
Venue Entry
Each participating location has the right to refuse service or entry for reasons including intoxication, violation of dress code, inappropriate conduct, or venue capacity. If denied entry at one stop, you may visit another participating venue. No refunds will be issued under these circumstances.
Capacity & Access
Venues may reach capacity at peak times. Admission is not guaranteed once a venue is full. Late arrivals may face lines or delays. Refunds will not be issued for wait times or inability to enter specific venues.
Self-Guided Crawl
This is a self-directed event. There is no host leading the group. Use the DIGITAL CRAWL MAP LINK to navigate between stops.
Venue Awareness
Not all bar staff may know about crawl logistics. If confusion arises, contact the event representative listed on the crawl map. If that venue cannot accommodate you, move on to another open crawl location.
Drink Specials
Discounts and drink deals are set independently by each bar. They may change, sell out, or be discontinued without notice.
Event Timing
Tickets are valid only during official crawl hours listed on the digital map. Showing up early, late, or outside of the crawl schedule does not guarantee entry.
Security
All venues will conduct their own security screening. A wristband does not bypass checks.
Costumes
Costumes must be safe and respectful. Props resembling weapons or offensive attire will result in denial of entry without refund.
Notifications
To stay updated, sign up for text alerts. These will notify you of venue changes or movement times during the crawl.
Conduct
Respect staff, other attendees, and venues. Disorderly behavior, property damage, or harassment will result in immediate removal without refund.
Liability Waiver
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge and accept that participation carries risks. You voluntarily assume all dangers, including but not limited to: accidents, personal injury, illness, disability, property damage, theft, alcohol-related incidents, interactions with other participants, and even serious injury or death.
You, and anyone acting on your behalf, hereby release and discharge Events Per Se, its affiliates, sponsors, contractors, employees, volunteers, and participating venues from any liability for losses, claims, or damages — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or any other cause — that may occur before, during, or after the crawl.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties against any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) that arise as a result of your actions during the event.
By attending, you confirm you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this agreement is intended to be as broad as allowed by law.
Event Continuity
The crawl will run rain or shine. Venues may change last minute. Always check your email and the digital crawl map for updates.
Acknowledgment
Purchase of a ticket signifies full acceptance of these disclaimers, terms, and conditions. You accept complete responsibility for your participation.

description:
Jonathan Kay - Massey University Lecturer/Master of Fine Arts Coordinator, Jonathan Kay is a photographic artist, researcher, and lecturer based at Massey University in Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington. His work explores the intersection of art and science, using photography to reveal the unseen and challenge conventional notions of landscape. Over the past seven years, his research has focused on developing a site-specific and responsive approach to photographic interventions within the landscape.
Drawing inspiration from scientific 'fieldwork,' Kay’s practice involves close observation and data collection, using these methods to uncover new insights into specific environments. However, his approach extends beyond the typical scientific framework by leveraging the unique possibilities of the photographic medium. This process enables him to move beyond the traditional, idealized representation of landscapes, offering deeper, more complex interpretations.

description:
Leadership And Management Part 1, Learn how to make the transition from buddy to the boss and lead a successful team. Managing staff can be a very rewarding, interesting and fun role, it can also be a tough and demanding job. Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other managers, your day can fill up before you know it.

This workshop aims to maximise your leadership and management potential and help you become a more confident, effective and efficient leader and manager with information on understanding personality types, effective communication, setting expectations and goals, assigning work, effective delegation, motivating staff, leadership styles, giving feedback and having courageous conversations, understanding what is required to be a good leader and manager and encouraging teamwork.
 
The workshop is designed for those who have been promoted recently into a supervisory management role or for those who have been there for some time but need to improve their leadership and management skills. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

description:
New Zealand Vocational Education and Training Research Forum, Rebuilding together.
Ngā mihi nui ki a koutou katoa

Skills Group and BCITO are delighted to join forces to return NZVETRF as a unique national event to showcase and disseminate new and emerging research and innovation in Vocational Education and Training.
Since 2004, the NZVETRF has been the must-attend event for policy makers, researchers and practitioners engaged in vocational education, across all parts of the tertiary sector and industry.
The vocational education sector is transforming through both policy and technological change. Knowing 'what works' and what is emerging is more critical than ever as a new network of provision for vocational education and training is established.
Over a day and a half you'll hear from international and national keynote speakers, government and sector stakeholders, the learner voice, and debates on the hot topics, along with curated and competitively selected research and evidence presentations.

Places are limited - register now to secure your place at Aotearoa's pre-eminent cross-sector vocational education event.
Call for Abstracts Now Open
We now invite researchers, practitioners, and policy makers to submit abstracts for presentation at the Forum. As part of New Zealand's premier VET research platform, your contributions will help shape New Zealand’s future as our sector moves forward.
Submission Guidelines
Abstracts should be no longer than 300 words and outline your completed research and intended presentation. We particularly welcome submissions that address one or more of our key conference themes:
·       Workplace learning and Industry Training
·       Diversity, Access and Equity
·       Developing our Future Workforce
·       Technology and Innovation
·       Learner Journey and Outcomes
·       Collaboration and System Approaches.
Your research should demonstrate evidence-based outcomes, share good practice, support high-quality research networks, and inform policy development. We encourage submissions that honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi and incorporate Māori perspectives in VET innovation.
Submit your abstract here
Submission Deadline: 5pm, 17 September 2025
An assessment panel comprising representatives from Skills Group, BCITO, and an independent assessor will evaluate all submissions. Successful presenters will be notified by the end of September 2025.
Keynote Speaker Announcement
We are delighted to announce that Kathryn Rowan, Executive Director of Switzerland-based Global Apprenticeship Network will address the Forum.

Kathryn is a seasoned leader with a background in human resources and corporate social responsibility, who brings a wealth of experience from her previous role as Vice President of Human Resources, Zone Latin America, and Global Youth Lead at Nestlé. Throughout her career, Ms. Rowan has consistently demonstrated a passion for harnessing the power of business to drive positive change in society. During her tenure at Nestlé, in national, regional, and global roles, she promoted initiatives to strengthen leadership and capability building, diversity, and corporate reputation, while spearheading youth-focused efforts, including the Global Alliance for Youth.
The Global Apprenticeship Network was established in 2014 by ILO, the International Organisation of Employers (IOE), the Organisation of Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), and Business at OECD. GAN is governed by a private-sector led, multi-stakeholder coalition representing major global corporations and international organisations, GAN's primary role is to encourage businesses to implement apprenticeship and WBL programs and support the creation of an enabling policy environment.
Further programme details and speaker announcements will be made in coming weeks, so register now!
Your Co-Hosts
Skills Group is New Zealand's largest Private Training Establishment, supporting 17,000 learners and training across 33 industries, through both work-based and provider-based learning, across 15 campuses nationwide.
BCITO is New Zealand's largest provider of Apprenticeships, having qualified 55,000 tradies and counting, across 15 construction and allied trades.

Skills and BCITO gratefully acknowledge Ako Aotearoa, the Centre for Tertiary Teaching Excellence, for support and permission to carry this event forward. We acknowledge Ako's enormous contribution to VET research and this event over many years. NZVETRF is a taonga, and as co-hosts we are committed to upholding the mana of the event.

Partner with us.
NZVETRF is all about walking the talk on sector collaboration. We warmly invite interest from interested education and industry partners to join on as event supporters. Sponsorship and event supporter packages are available. Contact nzvetrf@skills-group.org for details.

description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days, Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days
Get a close look and hands on experience with machinery of yesteryear. Weather permitting, we will have our Fowler Traction engine in steam too!

Find the machine that was used to make the 1950 Empire Games medals. Many of the machines have a association with the Wellington area.

Take a nostalgic trip through the vintage kitchen and other displays of household, and retail items from the past. Wellington Vintage Machinery is housed in an old Cheese Factory built in 1925. The factory has had an interesting past from cheese factory, to milk bottling plant, munitions store during WWII, and other uses before becoming home for the vintage machinery.

The building is one of the few remaining dairy factories designed by architects Duffill & Gibson of Hawera and built by CE Roebuck of New Plymouth.


Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/wellington-vintage-machinery-open-days-25/


Health & Safety:
Please wear closed toe footwear and keep an eye on any children that you bring along.

Most of the display is wheelchair accessible, and an accessible toilet facility is also available.

description:
The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 18th & 19th November, 2025, 1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session

About this Event

Join us on Thursday 13th November for a very special, final Beehive to Business event of the year, with Hon Todd McClay, Minister of Agriculture, Forestry, Trade & Investment and Associate Minister of Foreign Affairs.

In a year full of global geopolitical shocks, tariffs and increasing complexity for exporters – there is no Minister better positioned to deliver the insights and direction your business needs to know than Minister McClay.

Minister McClay is at the forefront of some of the most pressing issues for New Zealand’s economic position, be it new trade deals, the pressure facing our exporters or increasing Foreign Direct Investment through new agency InvestNZ.

If your business is chasing exports, or new capital from overseas – this final Beehive to Business is not one to be missed.

This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.

description:
Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent, Book Launch: Hoods Landing by Laura Vincent
Join Āporo Press at Unity Books for the mystical book launch of ‘Hoods Landing’ by Laura Vincent.

About this Event

Join Āporo Press at Unity Books Wellington on Halloween, 31 October, to celebrate the debut novel by Laura Vincent.

🎃 Friday 31 October, 6pm
🎃 Unity Books Wellington
🎃 All welcome!

Rita considered the dead. Shut her eyes. Rolled their names around her brain. Stacked each person in order like folded laundry, warm and crisp from the sun. She wondered how her name would sound amongst them.

In the rural reaches of Auckland, the women of the eclectic Gordon family gather for Christmas. They may push each other’s buttons, but know precisely when to offer tea (or a tipple). Rita, the 50-year-old baby of the family, is planning to tell them she has cancer. Drifting between past and present, she considers the lives of women in their community and reckons with what it all means for her future and her family.

Featuring elderly lesbians, twins who aren’t twins, and several dogs named Roger, Hoods Landing is about shoddy pasts, ambiguous futures and the imperfect bonds that tie family together.

About the author:

Laura Vincent (Ngāti Māhanga, Ngāpuhi) is an author whose work spans fiction, poetry and food writing. She has written the food blog hungryandfrozen.com since 2007, and her debut cookbook was published by Penguin Random House in 2013. Laura’s poetry has appeared in anthologies published by Āporo Press, Auckland University Press and Muswell Press, and she completed her Master of Creative Writing at Auckland University of Technology in 2022. Born in Waiuku, Laura currently lives in Tāmaki Makaurau. Hoods Landing is her first novel.

description:

A boy is stranded at sea. A storm bears down on him, and, in what he believes are his final moments, he ponders his life and the choice he made to come here—to explore what’s over the curious horizon—and wonders: Was this a mistake? There once was a boy… is a fun, poetic performance for tweens, teens and their whānau. This live “pop-up book” explores curiosity, courage, and finding light in the darkness.

Recommended for audiences aged 10+. Contains flashing lights.

This show was created as part of the TAHI Festival 2025 Creative Residency programme, in partnership with Creative NZ, PAYPA and Toi Poneke Arts Centre.

Kiwi is going on his first big holiday from Aotearoa across to the golden shores of Brisbane. He’s got his backpack, a pocket full of worms, and a head full of dreams. The most exciting thing of all is that he might even get to go on a rollercoaster! With his Mum, Kiwi navigates air travel, hotels and conversations with marsupials as his world stretches from the home he knows, to the world over the horizon.

A tale that celebrates the connection between our two countries, featuring stunning costume designs by GRIDLEY by Victoria and fresh waiata by NZ singer-songwriter Benny Tipene. Brought to the stage by the multi-award winning companies Horse With No Name and GRIDLEY by Victoria, Kiwi’s Big Hararei is a story about spreading your wings and flying into the unknown.

description:
The Life of Henry the Fifth, A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth

description:
Having Heard a Glow – Opening, Here, everything was aglow - and everything was connected by a web of invisible thread… and this morning, a new strand - fine, but still perceptible - pulled lightly at her heels…
Lewis Vivian Cosgrave (Ngāti Pūkenga, b.1997) is a Te-Whanganui-a-Tara based artist primarily focused on the experience of the quotidian, a life found along concrete pavements and inner city gardens, his works blend an interest in painting, drawing and photographic practices. Cosgrave works to find intentional reticence through the alteration of collected and personal archive imagery. Erasing, saturating and muddying with a refined sense of surface and delicate use of colour, arriving eventually to a space that grants us momentary reflection on the ordinary rhythms of daily life.
A short story by Lucy Clara accompanies the show.
Opening Friday, 26 September at 5pm – kindly sponsored by Duncan’s Brewing, Almighty and The Garden Table. The exhibition runs from 27 September – 18 October 2025 at Twentysix Gallery.

description:
Over and Out, Created and performed by Jackson Burling.

"NEVER become a truck driver!" - A young Jackson Burling took that advice, avoiding the fork in the road, but now, after a long and gruelling two year slog in the arts industry he must confront that age old question: "why not, Dad?" - and take us along for the ride. In Over and Out, premiering at the 2025 TAHI Festival, Burling brings a real interview, a big character, and even bigger questions to the stage.

One actor. 50 minutes. Countless emotional potholes. Along the way, we get a rare look into the gritty, heartfelt, and often-overlooked life of one of Aotearoa’s essential workers: the truck driver. Is the open road calling — or is the stage his true destination? Buckle up. This is verbatim theatre with serious mileage.

Audience Care: Contains coarse language and mature themes.

description:
HEXAFLEXAGON, Directed by Jim Fishwick
A hexaflexagon is a brightly-coloured six-sided shape that folds in on and out of itself to reveal face upon face upon face.
This show is also a hexaflexagon.
Six brightly-coloured shape-shifting actors fold scenes in on and out of themselves to reveal face upon face upon face. We wear lip gloss and carry a sword and play Super Mario and explore the forest and cry wet tears and eat giant pink-frosted donuts and party until dawn. We’re hexaflexagons. And so are you.
HEXAFLEXAGON is a high-art, high-energy improv show drenched in neon colours and backed by a hyperpop soundtrack. Six actors improvise scenes that are simultaneously very silly and very earnest, angular and amorphous, which weave together and snap apart.
As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
Image credit: Kirsty McGuire
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Pebble - Love In Every City, Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.
Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Wellington Law Revue 2025 - Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes), With the local elections looming, the Wellington City Council is divided. The National-led government wants to intervene, appointing none other than the Monopoly Man (yes the one from the board game!) to the job of fixing the Council. What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money. 
Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...
The Monopoly Man!
Can our heroes bankrupt our villain on the Monopoly board and beat him at his own game? Find out at the 2025 production of the Wellington Law Revue: Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes).

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

Thursday 4 September | 6pm–8pm

Tickets: $25–$35


About Tusiata Avia

Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. Her iconic play Wild Dogs Under My Skirt showed Off-Broadway in 2020, where it won the Fringe Encore Outstanding Production of the Year. Her most recent play, The Savage Coloniser Show won Best New Play at Wellington Theatre Awards 2024. Both plays are based on books of poetry of the same name.

Tusiata was awarded a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to poetry and in 2024, the Prime Ministers Award for Literary Achievement: Poetry.


This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.

description:
A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?, Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes
Date: Friday 5 September 2025
Time: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm
Presenters: Mary Ann Hardcastle Advance Care Plannining Facilitator & Chris Dunn Clinical Nurse Educator Nelson Tasman Hospice
Cost: Free
Limited attendees: Registration is essential
Who can attend?: General Public (This workshop is not designed for Health Professionals)
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice, 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”
hi@lynofuro.co.nz |
www.lynofuro.co.nz

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 4 Nov, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Real Talk Kāpiti, Real Talk Kāpiti
We are excited to announce that we are bringing Real Talk to Kāpiti. We can’t wait to share space with you all!
🔥Saturday 29th November
🔥11am to 3pm (doors open at 10.30am)
🔥Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,
Kapiti College, Paraparaumu

This is a FREE event for Rangatahi (14-25years) and also FREE for Rangatahi Service Providers, Kaiako, anyone that works with our rangatahi, Tāngata whaikaha and whaiora.
Click here to register for your tickets:
https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2025/real-talk-kapiti/paraparaumu

Real Talk Kōrero

We take our audience on a journey, a journey of laughter, a journey of tears, and a journey with absolute passion and purpose.
We create a safe space to speak about what we have experienced in our lives, and that we don’t have to be whakamā, we don’t have to live in silence, we don’t have to hide our secrets anymore.
Because when we speak – we heal, when we speak we free ourselves, and when we speak – we provide inspiration and hope for others.

We provide the following at each event:

❤️Inspiring kaikōrero
❤️Free kai and refreshments
❤️Opportunity to win some incredible prizes on the day
❤️FREE Real Talk pukapuka for every rangatahi in the audience

The subjects covered in our kōrero start with but are not limited to the subjects listed below:

⚫️Suicide and triggers and coping mechanisms
⚫️Mental Health awareness
⚫️Sexual, physical abuse and domestic violence
⚫️Being raised in gang affiliated environments
⚫️Drug and alcohol addiction
⚫️Teen pregnancy & pregnancy loss
⚫️Death & grief
⚫️Takatāpui & tangata whaikaha
⚫️Discrimination – racial, gender, sexual orientation
⚫️Relationship breakdowns
⚫️Career & business aspirations
⚫️Standing strong in who you are

We have a great line up of powerhouse, inspirational kaikōrero/speakers on the day:
🔥Pairama Wright – TikTok sensation
🔥Pania Te Paiho – Wāhine Toa Hunting & Hākuturi
🔥Peleti Oli – Youth Advocate
🔥Elise Niu

description:
Steps To Success - The tools to unlocking your potential, Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you be the best you can be. No matter what aspect in your life you want to level up, this workshop has the recipe to start living life at your best. You don't even have to be a member of the Fitness Portal. Just need to have a mind willing to learn.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Purchase your ticket here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSfMyBy9iQsriz.../viewform
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
Please make payment into the following account:
Account Name: Rocking Robins Rock N Roll Club
Account #: 06-0773-0877111-00
Particulars: STS
Reference: First + Last Name

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and visualization with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

description:
Journey into Om, Yoga without mantra is a bit like cake without the icing !
By now we all know that everything essentially is vibration. Yoga knew this 1000's of years ago, that is why sound is the first tool of Yoga.
Learn about the pranavah mantra ( om) as it relates to your Yoga Practice.
In this 2-hour workshop, you will understand the traditional and respectful way to use this sacred sound: both theoretically and practically.
We will draw on the ancient texts of Yoga as our point of reference.
The use of a mantra is a powerful tool for healing, emotional and mental clarity, and spiritual development. You will be guided in a variety of accessible practices to experience the effects of this mantra.
This workshop can open new dimensions to your practice, or it is also a great way to start on the Yoga Journey.
I teach from the Viniyoga tradition of Krishnamacharya, where mantra is used as an integral aspect of Yoga, whether it be asana, pranayama, or meditation.
This workshop will be nourishing to all the dimensions -heart, mind, and body.
You do not need to be a singer at all-just be willing to have a go at making a sound, even in your head if out loud feels too weird.

description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt, Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt

If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.

In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will discover:

What stops you from saying "no" when you really want to

How to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"

How to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict

Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

description:
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience
Stress and struggle leave their mark on both body and mind, sometimes in ways we can’t easily undo. Just as knots form in the body, impressions and tensions accumulate in the mind. While we can’t change the past, the Bhagavad-gita teaches that we can shape our future—what we choose to cultivate now carries us forward.
In this one-hour workshop, we’ll explore how philosophical and spiritual wisdom can help us rise above the tangles of trauma and anxiety. Through practical insights, open discussion, and guidance from the Gita’s philosophy, we’ll look at how to build resilience—not only by steadying the nervous system, but by exploring the deeper self beyond the changing body and mind.
Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 28th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
Gong Bath at Newtown Community Centre, ***$25***
Limited door sales for $30
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth*
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and frequencies of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground
**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 20 PEOPLE ONLY**
Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

description:
Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation, Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation
What happens when we strip away the surface layers of small talk, social roles, and even sight itself?
In this unique evening, you’ll step into the practice of Dyad Meditation — a powerful form of authentic relating where two people take turns speaking and listening in complete presence. One person shares, the other simply listens. No interruptions. No fixing. No judgment. Just the rare experience of being fully seen and fully heard.
The twist? You’ll be blindfolded.
By closing our eyes to the outer world, we drop our guards and tune into something deeper. This creates space for vulnerability, openness, and raw connection that we don’t often experience in daily life.
Expect an evening that’s real, grounding, and surprisingly freeing — a chance to connect with yourself and with others in ways that go beyond sight.
You don’t need to bring a partner or a friend — in fact, coming on your own is part of the experience. Everyone will be paired up on the night, so it’s all about connecting beyond familiar circles.
Afterwards, we’ll share reflections over a nourishing plant-based dinner, keeping the conversation alive in a relaxed space.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been exploring the art of authentic connection since his teens, when a rite of passage in Golden Bay first sparked his passion for circle work. Since then, he has been creating spaces that invite honesty, vulnerability, and depth — guiding people into experiences of being truly seen and heard. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and breathwork facilitator, Andre brings creativity and presence to all his offerings, inspired by the question of what it really means to be human.

You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. description:
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course, Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
with Kadam Birgit

By keeping Atisha’s Advice in our heart, we can maintain a peaceful happy mind, our human nature and good qualities will improve, we will be able to show a good example for the people of our troubled world and we will quickly attain full enlightenment.

As Venerable Geshe-la says, ‘Simply putting this Advice into practice we will naturally become a Bodhisattva, a holy compassionate being who is the object of everybody’s love and respect’.

On this half day course Kadam Birgit will share teachings given at the International Summer Festival 2025 on Advice from Atisha’s Heart.

Although it was composed many centuries ago, this much-loved Buddhist scripture is full of practical advice to help us deal with the challenges of modern living, and transform our life into an authentic path of inner development.

Everyone welcome.

WHAT TO EXPECT
These classes are based on Buddha’s teachings on the mind, but you do not need to be a Buddhist to attend, or to benefit from them. There is no physical exercise involved and you can choose to sit either in a chair or on a cushion. These classes are suitable for all levels of experience.

Registration starts at 9:30am. This course includes a vegan, wheat-free morning tea (we cannot guarantee gluten-free).
