description:
REMEMBRANCE- Somatic Dance, REMEMBRANCE
A somatic dance journey
Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for an evening of connection, ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.
🌑 Saturday 13 September
🕕 6–8.30pm
📍 All Saints Church Hall, Hataitai
🎟️ $40–$50
✨ Sober · Non-judgemental · All welcome · No experience needed
No door sales - tickets must be purchased online prior to the event.
As the season turns to spring, we gather in remembrance—an invitation to embody the strength within and feel how ancestral wisdom moves through us. When we connect to our inner foundations, we touch the support of those who came before and deepen our sense of belonging to life itself.
We’ll begin with ceremonial cacao, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. Barefoot and phone-free, you’re invited to drop deep into free-form movement, awakening parts of you that you may have forgotten.
Come as you are.
Move with what you feel.
Leave feeling empowered, connected, and alive.
Somatic dance is a guided movement practice that helps you tune into your body’s wisdom and move from the inside out. Unlike ecstatic dance, which is typically an open, DJ-led space with no facilitation, somatic dance offers gentle guidance to support you in exploring sensation, emotion, and embodiment in a safe, intentional way. You’re not learning steps or performing—you're being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.
Your Hosts...
Jenna Joan | Embodiment Facilitator
Jenna Joan is a somatic therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.
Sonic Sutra | Somatic Dance DJ
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide dancers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

description:
Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of
St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and
stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion.

You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of
Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded professional embroiderer who graduated from the Royal
School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells
her work, as well as accepting commissions from churches, fashion designers and private
individuals. She has also had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan
and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered
3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of
New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

Venue: Loaves and Fishes Hall, Wellington Cathedral of St Paul.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.

description:
Women of Hope One day Christian Conference 'Overcomers', Women of Hope One day Christian Conference 'Overcomers'
Join us at the Women of Hope One day Christian Conference 'Overcomers' to be inspired, empowered, and equipped to conquer life's challenges

About this Event

Welcome to the Women of Hope One day Christian Conference 'Overcomers'!
Date: Saturday November 1st 2025
Location: Hope
Join us for a powerful day of inspiration, worship, and fellowship with other women who are Overcomers. This conference is designed to uplift and empower you in your faith journey. Come ready to be encouraged and equipped to overcome any obstacle in your life. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to connect with other women of faith and grow together in Hope. We can't wait to see you there!
Our keynote speaker is Julia Grace, international speaker/singer/songwriter and mental wellness coach. Julia brings her message in a fun and innovative way. She is not to be missed!
We also have a great line up of 'Women who have overcome' who will bring words of encouragement throughout the day.
Our Hope Centre Worship team will lead us in song and we have some other fun things planned for the day.
Lunch is provided free, but dinner can be bought locally in Levin. You are welcome to bring your meals back to the cafe to eat.
We will also have Barista coffee available for $4 per cup.
You will also receive a small gift bag on arrival.
(4) Facebook follow us on fb Women of Hope for updates.

description:
Encounter Summit, Encounter Summit
A 2-day event during the school holidays for Year 7-13. Get ready for amazing worship, games, great sermons and connection.

About this Event

We are excited to invite your teenager to be part of our Encounter Summit - a two-day event designed for our next generation, from Year 7 to Year 13, filled with faith, fun, and fellowship. This summit is a powerful opportunity for young people to grow spiritually, encounter God in a fresh way, build lasting friendships, and create unforgettable memories.
We are thrilled to welcome Brodie McDowell, Youth Pastor at Elim Tauranga and the Elim National Youth Leader. Brodie is an inspiring communicator with a passion for reaching young people, and we believe his ministry will have a significant and lasting impact on our next generation.
Dates:
Friday 3 October 2025 - 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM
Saturday 4 October 2025 - 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM
Meals and Snacks
Provided: Snacks and dinner on both days
Not Provided: Lunch (teens can bring their own lunch or purchase from nearby restaurants)
We look forward to seeing what God will do in the lives of our youth during this incredible weekend. Thank you for supporting your teenager’s spiritual growth and community connections.
If you have any questions, please contact us Simba () or Cassie ().

description:
Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts, Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts
If you’ve been through a redundancy, restructure, or a big shift in your working life - or if you’ve been out of work for a while and are looking ahead to something new - this gathering is for you.
We’ll spend an hour outdoors (weather permitting) in a gentle, guided ritual to help you release some of the heaviness that comes with change and open up to what’s next. You can expect moments of quiet reflection, light movement, and simple nature-based activities designed to connect you with yourself, the land, and a sense of possibility. There’s no chanting, costumes, or anything too out-there - just a safe, thoughtful space to mark what you’ve been through and welcome in the next chapter.
The ritual will be hosted by Tamara Buckland - Leadership Strategist, Chief People Officer, and Druid - who blends leadership wisdom with nature-based practices to create meaningful, accessible experiences for people in transition.
After the ritual, we’ll wander to Picnic Café for coffee or tea (you’ll just need to cover your own drink) for those who’d like to keep connecting.
Details
📅 Friday 29 August (rain date: Friday 5 September)
🕛 12:00–1:00pm ritual
☕ 1:00pm coffee/tea at Picnic Café
💸 Free (pay for your own drink at the café)
📍 Wellington - location shared on registration
This is for anyone ready to put down some of the weight they’ve been carrying, connect with nature and themselves, and make space for the next chapter.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Cacao Ritual & Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshop, Cacao Ritual & Aromatherapy Candle-Making
A ritualUNION event

Join Rosenda of Cultivate You and Melanie from Poet Botanicals for a relaxing day at beautiful Mangaroa Farms. Connect with nature and community, while experiencing some beautiful self-care practices.

Cacao with Rosenda

Rosenda will guide you on an intimate journey with cacao; beginning with its sacred story and path to the Pacific, and flowing into a hands-on experience in the kitchen. Together, we’ll explore cacao not just as food, but as medicine and ritual, a way to slow down, connect, and return to what feels true.

Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshop

Discover the beauty of natural scent and the therapeutic power of essential oils in this hands-on workshop. This beautiful experience will be an invitation to slow down and reconnect with your senses. Learn the art of scent layering and with Melanie’s guidance, design a blend that reflects your own unique energy and intention. You’ll be taken through the process of making your own clean-burning aromatherapy candle, infused with the blend you’ve created. Your candle will serve as a lovely reminder of the day and inspiration to weave the therapeutic benefits of scent into your everyday rituals.

____

A nutritious, light lunch and refreshments will be provided.

____

When: Sunday 9th November

Time: 10am to 4pm

Where: Woodcote at Mangaroa Farms, Whitemans Valley (located just 40minutes from Wellington's CBD).

Investment: Earlybird price $169 until 9 October | $195 full-price

Bookings essential.

____

Cancellation Policy

If you can no longer attend the day please contact us at least 72 hours prior for a full refund. If you cancel within 72 hours we can only provide a refund if we're able to rebook your spot. Thank you for your understanding.
